text:
My husband and I went there last night once we landed in las vegas, and I am happy we did. The slices are huge, and delicious. 

I did however, just get the basic cheese pizza.. kind of hard to screw up. But I have no complaints.

I will definitely be going back for another slice before I go home.

I had the buffalo chicken pizza and it was really good. We were seated quickly which was ultimately a reason we pick the restaurant because the burger place next-door had a huge wait. I was really glad we did as everyone like their food. Our server was friendly attentive and helpful. The price is reasonable but in typical Vegas fashion slightly high. I would certainly eat at this place again. They also have a quick takeout window if you just looking to get a quick slice.

Hands down, the best pizza in Las Vegas.  Great Happy Hour with specials on slices and beer/wine.

I'm out in Vegas 5 or 6 times a year on business and always stop in a few times each trip.  

Ask for Melia.  Fantastic service.  Even when the bar gets slammed, she is able to nimbly manage her way around to everyone, making sure no one ever gets hungry or thirsty.  She makes you feel like you're the only one in the place and greets everyone with a million dollar smile.

Love me some Slice of Vegas!

Love the VEGAN menu! Thank you so much for so many options. Atmosphere was fun and the food was quite yummy. They had tasty shot specials which made dinner even more fun. Their pesto cauliflower (yes, vegan) was just delicious, even for carnivores. Impressed overall.

Food was fair but service was horrible!  Took an hour to get 2 gluten free pizzas and 2 pastas.  Not busy at all yet the waiter never came to our table either before or after food came.  When mentioned to him upon receiving the bill his reply was "yeah - it happens!"

I went to Slice of Vegas and was very impressed.  The ambiance was classy yet chill.  The food was wonderful.  We ordered two pizza's upon recommendation of our server David (who was great by the way) and they were gourmet quality.  The salad was fresh and tasty and cannoli for desert was the best!  Don't forget to try the Bannana Bread beer.

I need to explain my 4 stars. Had this restaurant been someplace else, it may be more deserving of a 3 star. But considering this is Vegas and even drinks at Starbucks are priced twice that of everywhere else, this place does deserve credit for $5 beers and $4 pizza slices at Happy Hour!! The pizza itself was above average, not great but not terrible. The beer (Fat Tire on draft) was good. Again, they both felt better considering I had paid $40 for mediocre lunch that afternoon!

The place also looked clean, spacious and I saw families with kids eating there which tells me it's a decent place to visit.
So excited to find a vegan menu in Vegas!  The garlic bread was amazing, and the server was so friendly and helpful.  Best part of our trip!

A vegan dream! We strolled by late after a show and they had an entire vegan menu. It was like stumbling into Disneyland on accident. The bruschetta was some of the best I have had. The vegan buffalo pizza was delicious as well! Service and atmosphere were excellent. There seems to be a lot of mediocre reviews but I guess what we ordered may have been exceptional. No complaints!

It seems we had a one time bad experience this past sunday. The Tuscan Salad was good but the Nonna's Margherita pizza was very soggy and tasteless. We could see the basil but there was no taste. We told our server ?Brent? but he didn't really seem to care. He brought us our check instead. Having lived around the US including Brooklyn and having italian pizza in Italy, we won't be returning here. I'm glad others haven't had this experience. The prices like most things in Vegas are inflated.

The vegan menu is fabulous!! Everything we ordered was fantastic. The pizza had perfect veggies, 'cheese,' and Gardein 'sausage.' We also had a side of sweet potato fries and vegan ranch dressing. Yum!  The beer menu was also fab with lots of regional brews and IPAs. Even though it was a busy lunch service during football, we got great service.  I wish I didn't have to go to the strip to get this amazing vegan pizza!

This place was perfect!  I was looking for setting of quality and quick.  We  had a few minutes before catching a show in the (Mandalay Bay) a Hotel.The atmosphere was ideal for families.  I will definitely return and tell my friends.

Had the buffalo chicken pizza and it did not disappoint. Dough was cooked perfectly and had just the right amount of garlic. The buffalo chicken topping was just right and not to vinegary. 

Service was great, we ordered from the deli counter and our pizza was ready before the promised time. 

Tax and tip included I believe the 18" pizza was under 40.

Came here yesterday pizza pie was really good had half/plain half pepperoni pizza I didnt have none of these crazy food,some people on here had so I wouldnt know but as far as if you are looking for pizza this is a good place to sit and relax after a long hot day at the strip

This is a great restaurant to frequent if you're staying in Mandalay Bay or the Luxor (or attending a Convention in Mandalay Bay).   I ate here twice during my stay and was happy both times.  

First I tried the Vegan Faux Pie which was good.  The second time I got the vegan meatball sandwich, the "Not You're Momma's Garlic Bread", and the vegan cake.   The vegan meatball sandwich was good, but the "Not You're Momma's Garlic Bread" was amazing - incredibly uniquely flavored, and unlike anything else I've ever had.  It comes with three large slices and on its own would probably be almost enough for a meal. I also recommend the cake - the cake portion was good, and very moist but could have been slightly more chocolatey.  But the frosting was unbelievable.

Delicious pizza, excellent service, reasonable prices (for the Strip).  Of note is the vegan menu--they don't treat vegans like they are bothering the staff.  There is a special menu and my wife loved the vegetarian meatball sub.

The food here was good and it came out fast which I appreciate. If you're a vegan you will be amazed at their vegan menu. Service was typical, nothing special there. 

Husband and I got BBQ chicken pizza and some hot wings. It was really good. They have a really good bar. If they turned up the lights a bit more I'd be more willing to give 5 stars it was too dim in there!

Amazing vegan options. We had the vegan garlic bread and vegan BBQ chick'n. Also, the mussels as an appetizer. I tricked my parents to eating vegan food without their knowledge and they liked it a lot!

By checking in on Foursquare at Mandalay Bay, I unlocked a special at Slice of Vegas called Happy Hour at Your Convenience--no restrictions listed. The hostess would not honor the special stating that the restaurant does not offer happy hour on Fridays and Saturdays, but I could return tomorrow. In that case, the special should be called Happy Hour at Hostess' Convenience."

Pizza was good. I ordered a slice and it was sitting on display then warmed over. If your like me, I like freshly made hot pizza. I am sure that if I ordered a whole pizza it would have been fantastic, because this warmed over pizza was good. Will go back if I'm in that mall again, but I'm not going to make the journey to walk through the casino for this pizza.

We stopped here because we were in Mandalay, short on time, and didn't want to spend a lot on dinner.  Slice Vegas offers a main restaurant as well as a little bar area where you can order slices and sit down for a minute.  

We got the special at the time- two cheese slices and a draft beer for $10.  A little more than it's worth, but a good deal for the Strip.

The pizza was fine.  It wasn't bad but it definitely wasn't as good as Secret Pizza.  The pieces were huge and my husband and I each had one and we were full.

You can order slices with toppings but those are at least $5 apiece.  Also, if you order a draft beer without the combo special, it's $8.  If all you are looking for is a drink, you might as well just pay the two extra dollars for the combo and feed some hungry people walking by.

I can't see myself making a special trip to eat here (like I have for Secret Pizza), but it's a good choice to have if you are in Mandalay or Luxor.

Such a great time! Went on a Monday midday. Had a restaurant.com certificate to use and it came in very handy. I was anxious to try this place because it has lots of vegan offerings. When I asked the server about what they had that I could try, he brought me an entire menu full of choices. We had the vegan chicken wings (with vegan ranch), and though a bit salty, they were pretty good. In addition, we ordered a vegan pizza, but when the waiter saw that it was not prepared properly, he made sure to buy us a round of drinks. Service was efficient and very friendly. I would go back in a heartbeat.
price is reasonable compare to other restaurants in LV. The garlic bread is good, I ate all the garlic too lol, the steak is sooooo delicious.  My dad loves it.

The overall look of this place is great, however, it seems as though that is what you are paying for. Food is overpriced, most items are $20+ while just a few are $15 and below. The coupon you get when checking into this, does not make up for paying as much as you do.

We ordered an 18" meat lovers pizza that was $30. We wanted to get a create your own pizza, but doing that with just one topping would have been $25, so we went with the signature pizza instead. It was very greasy, but there was more than enough of meat on every slice. We also got a pasta; angel hair-Alfredo ($15) with chicken (extra $5). The portion was good enough to split with two people, but the taste was very bland, there was also very little cube cut chicken pieces so paying the extra $5 was not worth it.

Before we sat down we noticed one of my family members wasn't doing so well due to his diabetes so we asked our server to please quickly bring us bread, water and anything else they had ready. Although we had stated why we needed it in a timely matter, we still had to wait about 10 minutes before we even received our water! One of our other family members had to go across the store to a mini mart and buy a few snacks for him, and also went in the "walk in buy a slice" area of this restaurant to get a pizza. Many waitresses were just looking at us nervously, which was bothersome.

Overall: overpriced, nice, but slow staff, food could have tasted better.

Ate here last night. Decor was nice and friendly staff. Ordered the calamari which was pretty good and a hand tossed pizza. I was hoping it was going to be more tasty and authentic, wasn't too impressed. But nice to say I ate here while in Vegas .

You'll be paying an outrageous amount of money for some below average pizza, I got four 12 inch pizzas and ended up spending 90 dollars. The crusts were rock hard and there was a scarce amount of sauce. The quality of the actual pizza was alright, really nothing special I honestly think dominos is better. The crust was extremely thin and was not filling at all. The only reason this review got three stars is because the woman who served use as extremely nice and I believe service is one of the most important parts of any business

5 stars for having a Vegan menu!
-2 for the overpriced tiny portions.

Overall, the food was pretty tasty. I had the Buffalo Vegan pizza, while my brother had the sandwich special which he enjoyed. 

Service was quick and attentive. 
I'd return, but solely because it's one of the few places with an vegan menu on the strip!

Needing a food fix while walking through various casinos, we stopped here to check out the happy hour for a small nibble. We were drawn in by half price cheese slices, so we walked in and got a table. They also offer half price appetizers. We decided to start with one slice each, as they are pretty big. We also wanted to try the meatball appetizer. Upon placing our order, we are told that there is a minimum of two cheese slices per person...odd! Clearly the intention is to fill you up on cheap cheese pizza so you order less of the more expensive stuff. We didn't fall for that so one of us ordered two slices and had our one slice each. How was the food? Nothing terribly special unfortunately. The cheese pizza was super salty and the meatballs while good were generic and seemed about the same caliber as the frozen variety. Would we come here again to try the actual entrees?....no, there are far many better options in the same building even.
Awesome pizza and sweet potato fries are good. Open til 12 on friday nights. Drinks are decent prices . Wines range $6-8 and beers $5-8
Went here expecting to have some great pizza and it ended up being trash. Ordered a family sized Greek pizza and it was disgusting. Will not be recommending or coming back.
I went back because my vegan pizza was so good I had to try something else. Got the meatless meatball sub and it was great as well. So nice to have vegan options close by and on the strip. Well done.

We were in Vegas for a couple nights, went the first night at the happy hour. Service was great, lots of selection for beer. Roasted cauliflower appetizer was great. Went the next night, service was excellent, beer & food were great. Talked with the manager about the service and he was great. When we go back, we definately stop here again!

The service was so bad, we were laughing as we left. The manager felt bad and paid for our dinner. Basically as long as you don't get "Stanley?" as your server you should be fine.

The food is mediocre. Pasta's probably from a box and the sauce from a jar. We didn't try the pizza though. 

At least we were just visiting, but never again!

Server had no personality-bad start. Pizza was more like one you would purchase in the frozen food aisle. Crust tasted stale and flat. Cheese quality was below average. $25 price tag was over the top. Many better choices in Las Vegas .

Stopped in here about 9pm on a Sunday night, not very busy. Friendly hostess told us we could sit anywhere.  Sat right at the bar.   Bartender very slow to provide service.  We ordered 2 beers and she came back shortly there after.  Simple order, basic 3 topping pizza.    Pizza came very quickly brought out by the kitchen, asked if we needed anything else.. Told him plates and silverware would be nice.  Bartender comes over and throws down 2 plates...  Pizza was actually very good, sausage, chicken, pepperoni, nice crust sauce not too sweet.   Price was kind of high, $38 for a 12" 3 topping pizza, a Peroni and a Stella. Asked once for the check, not sure if she didn't hear us or just wasn't up to customer service this evening, never asked how anything was.  Lucky we had cash or we may still be waiting.  
Bottom line, would go back for the pizza, but horrible customer service by the bartender on a slow night and a bit pricey.

I absolutely loved this place! So excited to see they had a whole vegan menu. The vegan wings were hands down the best I have ever had, and I eat at a ton of vegan restaurants. The service was excellent and the waitress was so wonderful. I had the best pineapple cider in the world. The vegan buffalo chicken pizza was unique and on point! My boyfriend got the vegan BBQ chicken pizza, and we both loved it so much. I am so happy about the experience we had here , thank you!

Service ok ,food really bad ( salad pretty good) our group wanted pizza I'm not big pizza person . I had the hot dogs big mistake, cold nasty . The rest had pizza some said it was ok another said  not cooked enough . All in all never again

I ordinarily wouldn't go Las Vegas, but my wife had a conference to go to, Grandma volunteered to watch her Granddaughter, so I came with for a short weekend away. Being vegan isn't hard, but I wish there were more places like this around.  We were there a month ago and I am still craving that Vegan Buffalo "chicken" pizza and those vegan dough balls. 
The next time come back to Las Vegas will be in a couple years when the new NHL team starts up but the only things I want to do are: eat at Slice of Vegas, watch your new hockey team, play Metallica pinball at the arcade in NY,NY and hike at Red Rock Canyon.

Average at best, not sure why it has high ratings.  Are people that clueless on pizza?

They are also way overpriced, but then again we are in Vegas and at a hotel tourist trap lol
Not bad pizza wine is pretty good for house red also the 5 for 25 coupon on restaurant .com is a good deal

It's a nice relaxing place to take the kids.  They loved the pizza and the zeppoli pizza bites for dessert.  I really enjoyed the garlic bread with a baked head of garlic.  I wasn't wild about the Chicken Parmesan.  The spaghetti was good, but nothing special.  The service was good both times we were there. We'll definitely go back with the kids.

Worst service ever. Came from Los Angeles with family stayed at the Mandalay bay and asked front desk for a recommendation on pizza because the kids were starving after the pool. We went ahead and took the advise went to this slice of Vegas place waited 20 mins to be seated. Got in sat down ordered and waited an hour for the manager to finally come talk to us about the ridiculous wait time. He said he will check after the waitress had already told us she was very sorry and her manager was made aware of a back up they had in the kitchen. He came up to us very unapologetic and more clueless about the situation. As he was there telling us he will check the times on Order, ...as if we would sit there and lie about wait time., point blank our kids left crying and we decided to leave and not do business with this location where management sucks. Service was the worst. Mad we didn't get to taste the pizza we were recommended.
I've been visiting Vegas for years and never miss this place. Amazing food, service, and a good size vegan menu if someone in your party requires it.

We stayed at Luxor therefore the restaurants as few minutes walking distance from our hotel, my son is craving for Italian so we went for lunch at this place.
The boy had Lasagna, as I noticed the food is made in good quality that comes with layers of goodies plus a garlic toast and a very reasonable price for Las Vegas. Wait until my order the server was not happy (dark face) at all since my lunch was only a small side dish (just a soup). ! You cannot force guess to order food then end up throwing it away!

Food quality:  good price good food 5 stars.
Service: 1 star totally  :( !

PS: I have the same small size dish at Tom's Urban, the sever was so pleasant...! Guess who would get the better tip?

Great food. Be careful when ordering the atomic wings. I ordered them but asked for them to be hotter.  They did it I'll tell you what it just about took me out. Great service they were on it with the milk when I needed it.

Came here because they have a whole vegan menu but also regular pizza as well which is perfect because I am vegan and my boyfriend isn't. We came during happy hour so he got half off wings and then a personal BBQ chicken pizza which is huge I got the vegan BBQ chikn pizza. It was so good the perfect amount of daiya ! Our server was Michelle and she was so attentive and really sweet. We will definitely be back not only because of the good food but because of the great service (:
The pizza was fresh and delish! The chicken wings are really good! Could have eaten  much more than the six  that comes in the appetizer portion. Waitstaff was very helpful. Would eat here again!

Food and service is good. We eat here when we are in a rush or really don't want to think a great deal about what we want for lunch or dinner. It is close to the room, is always good and service is nice. Plus they offer gluten free pasta so I can have an Italian dinner. Perfect after a long day of shopping or sitting by the pool.

This place was awesome!  After spending the entire day traveling to Vegas we wanted a substantial dinner to welcome us.  Definitely got what we were looking for here.  Started with an order of calamari and the sauce was absolutely amazing.  I ordered a Mobgarita to enjoy while we waited for the pizza.   We ordered a large il Mangino pizza thinking we would have leftovers to take back to our room and chill on for a couple of days.  That pizza barely lasted the night.  Great food and quick, friendly service.  Definitely worth a visit if you are looking for pizza on the Strip.

Not recommended. 
I was waiting to get a server for 15 minutes. Server came back with attitude issues and treated us like garbage.
The server needs to be more educated and learn how to treat Asians.

If I could give zero I would.  Worst pizza, awful service.  Should never be considered the best gluten free option for anything.  Even the non-gluten folks in our party were horrified- stick to Ellio's.

I wanted to like this place but I just don't. They have an entire menu that is Vegan and I love that but honestly the pizza was mediocre and WAY overpriced. You can get a better tasting and cheaper vegan pizza at Whole Foods. The roasted cauliflower was good but nothing amazing. I feel bad for the amount of money that we spent here, it could have been used for something much better.

The pizza and beer selection fantastic! 
Ordered a small 'Choked Pig' and it was plenty for two
They have some great options on tap; if you're not sure, ask for a sample!
Cannoli for desert was good: crisp flaky crust and balanced filling.
Late lunch= great service. Immediately seated and very little wait for food and drinks.

You know how many times in my life I walked away from a pizza place because they can't manage to take in order properly? Never . The staff thought it was more interesting to chitchat then to help put a slice of pizza in the oven and took forever to charge the room credit. Won't last long here if they keep this up.

I'm with the others, why would anyone give this place more than 1 star?

 First, it would be awesome if they knew how to cook a pizza or just even serve it hot. 

Second, at a slow bar, it took over 10 minutes to even be acknowledged. 

Vegas has seen a lot of my money , but this awful place never will again.

The service was friendly and the food came out quickly.  The sliced chili dogs had a great tasting chili on them and the fries were crisp and tasty with a slight salt and pepper seasoning.  The wife had the meatball sandwich. The sauce was good and the meatballs were tender and fresh.  The atmosphere was good,  they have a juke box and bar.  In the middle of a great shopping area between Mandalay Bayan the Luxor.
We needed a vegan dinner while in Vegas. This place has a complete page of their menu devoted to vegan choices. We had the  buffalo "chicken" strips and a deluxe pizza. All was excellent!

This restaurant is awesome. They provide both vegan & gluten free menus - as a vegan, having options is awesome! They have special drink deals during NFL games & half off appetizers during happy hour. They have quite a few tvs for sports fans. Last time we were in Vegas, we went 4 times because it was so good!! Their vegan meatball sub sandwich is fantastic.

Great menu options for all eaters. Service is pretty slow so don't go on a time crunch because they are helping large groups. We spent a total of an hour there waiting mostly. Vegan menu is awesome service not so much. Had to flag somebody down to get our check. Waited over a half hour for the food.

We jumped in one night looking for a quick nosh without breaking the bank. Food was good and the pizza (we ordered a large pepperoni extra cheese and garlic) was above average; decent crisp crust, tangy sauce and generous toppings.

One of the better "on the strip" pizza places

Cons:
LOUD - they think they're a night club after 6pm
Pricey - Three topping pizza is over $30

Vegan pizza! Love that there is a separate vegan menu here. We did the build your own with daiya cheese, olives, pineapple & garlic! Yummy! We got the personal size which had 6 slices. I Will be back very soon to try more off the vegan menu ! I Highly recommend this place especially if your vegan. We called in ahead of time to set up a group reservation & as soon as we got here we were seated within a few minutes ;)

Great pizza! Used a yelp coupon and got a huge 18 inch pizza with three toppings for $15. The booth was a bit uncomfortable but there are other sitting options there. Overall, a great place to grab a bite to eat.

I tried this the other night, and I had mixed feelings. My friend and I ordered the Mama's Garlic Bread with Melted Cheese on top. It was $6.95 for the garlic bread and an additional $1.95 for the cheese. It came out with 4 small pieces of bread. I guess that's the price that you pay for dining in a casino. They had a huge garlic clove where you could squeeze on top of the bread. The garlic clove itself was really good. We ordered the Choked Pig pizza which was pretty good. It had an aioli pesto, mozzarello cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, bacon, artichoke mix, and whiskey sour cream drizzled onto the pizza and topped with basil. I liked the flavoring of the pizza. It was awesome. My friend covered his pizza with the chili peppers because he thought it had no taste. I hadn't noticed it until my friend mentioned it, but the pizza was so difficult to chew. My mouth hurt so much. The pizza was really tough. I prefer chewy pizza to crunchy pizza.
Amazing atmosphere and great food. Full list of bottles beer from all over the country. Choice of vegan and gluten free options!
Pizza was really great! Had lots of gluten free options (penne pasta, pizza crust, burger buns, etc).

Strolling through the shops and decide to get a slice of pizza for fuel.  Walked to the side where we can order to go.  Got a pepperoni and sausage pizza.  The pepperonis were big and pizza was thin.  Flavor was really good especially when it was piping hot.  Definitely got my fuel back after that slice.
I loved their vegan options! Everything sounded so good. I ended up getting their vegan pesto pasta and it was delicious! Definitely will be returning.
Great pizza, wings, atmosphere and service. Recommend highly to relax and watch sports.

I stayed at Mandalay Bay for 3 nights and this restaurant and Hussong's Cantina were the only places I ate not only because they had the most vegan options, but also because they were SO GOOD. At Slice of Vegas, we were seated immediately by a super friendly hostess and the waitress immediately came over and was very accommodating to me being vegan and my friend being non-vegan (making sure she knew which meal was vegan and which wasn't). I think I had almost everything on their vegan menu. Even my non-vegan friend loved it! Next time I go to Vegas, I know where I'm taking everyone!

This place was the biggest surprise of my Vegas trip. I went in expecting just some generic meat/cheese replacements, and that is not what I got at all. 

When researching places to eat with vegan options, this one came up, but I immediately thought to myself, ive done the fake za before, many times, might want to go with something different. I am glad I made the time to come here. 

I ordered the not your mommas garlic bread as an app, since it was happy hour this was half off!!!! Then a Back East Buffalo and the "cheesecake" for dessert. 

The garlic bread was good. It was probably what I was most excited about, being a garlic bread fan, although it ended up being my least favorite of the three (but still, very good). There were just enough for 2 to share, so if you have more than 2 I would suggest maybe getting a second order or second ap. 

The pizza was great! It was almost perfect, a refreshing bed of carrots and celery with buffalo sauce, vegan ranch, and gardein chicken and daiya. The carrots and celery made this pie for me, and I hate celery! but this was cut thin and the mingling with buffalo sauce and the ranch made it all delicious. I am not usually a big gardein fan, but this seemed to be marinated in the sauce, and tasted fairly good. My only complaint is that the crust was not evenly cooked, with some burnt like spots on one side, but it wasn't very bad, just that part was extra crunchy. 

And now the star of the show, the cheesecake. I was expecting generic vegan cheesecake, and I got a great tasting cheesecake if it were to stand alone, but alas it didn't, it came with a pineapple compote that was probably the best tasting fruit compote I have had in my life! So good, lighly herbaceous, just delicious. 

Service was great throughout, and my dining companion enjoyed her slices as well. Next time im in Vegas, this place I will be!

I took my little family here garlic bread was amazing pizza was decent service well that's y the got 2 stars we were sat before a table of 7 another waitress came greeted them n got them drinks it took them 10.75 min to come greet us I timed it no BS the MANAGER came got us drinks he was nice we ordered got out food my wife is allergic to parsley we ask for no parsley It came with parsley so we let them know the server not our waiter gave us a glare like we are making his job harder by asking to not add an item he takes it and brings it back even more mixed in my wife didn't want to make a big deal about it but I was ready to she took a couple bites of what didn't have parsley and still had to go buy benadryl for her allergies we really felt unwanted here

Slice of Vegas!!! A must stop. First visit was for a quick take out. Grabbed a Italian deli sandwich for my son,  I was very lucky to get a taste of, it was great. I myself had The Bootlegger burger a.k.a, Bleu cheeseburger. Being from Chicago, I feel my opinion on burgers can be taken seriously. This was an incredible display of flavor. The burger meat itself was top notch, tender and flavorful. However the flavor doesn't stop there. Mushrooms, grilled onions, JALAPEÑO BACON, and avocado, yes avocado. This complex burger is perfect in texture and flavor. Try it with sweet potato fries. The very next day I had to have it again, so I did. There are many different options for food, but I couldn't bring myself to pass it up. Cool bar and even cooler bartender. Johanna said it was her first day, but that was very hard to believe. She was very attentive and knew how to handle the rush, a true pro, not to mention very friendly with a great smile. I have to finally recommend the Red Tail Ale, what a brew. Can't wait to go back, it will be my first stop for a bite and brew. Thanks for a great time Slice of Vegas, and of course our superstar bartender Johanna!!!
The pizza was great, but the service was a little slow and there weren't a whole lot of customers in the restaurant. They do have a convenient by-the-slice counter which I thought was cool.

If you are looking for something casual and not too overpriced, then try some pizza at Slice of Vegas.  We started off with the yummy garlic bread and marinara. The New York style pizza was delicious however the pepperoni was a bit too greasy...nothing a little blotting could not fix! The server was very attentive.
I wish we were there for lunch hen you can order pizza by the slice!!!
Oh, and don't forget to check in for your 15% discount! Every bit of savings counts in Vegas!

Located in a mall area between the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. They have good vegan and gluten free options which is so rare in Vegas. Service was very slow with some big groups there at the time. Took forever just to pay our bill.

Nothing special here except for the beer selection.
The 10 meat pizza was decent.
The caesar salad was the most bland salad I've come across.
The waiter had no idea what was going on, but it was his first day so I'll forgive him.
I can't say that the decor was anything special, just looked like every other pub/lounge I've ever been in.
Awesome Italian restaurant between Luxor and Mandalay Bay! Typical food good price and nice people.

I was recently in Las Vegas with my mom and sister. My mom is a very picky omnivore and my sister is a salad aficionado who is vegan friendly. I knew from word of mouth that the vegan menu was stellar here and was not disappointed. I ordered the BBQ Chik'n Pizza and my sister ordered the Romelia's salad. Her salad looked good but didn't taste very good after I had coated my mouth in barbecue sauce! She loved it though. I thought my pizza was great. Both my mom and sister enjoyed the non-vegan garlic bread and my mom seemed to enjoy her non-vegan pizza slices. I wanted an order of the vegan bread but knew I wouldn't have room. Things have sure changed a lot vegan-wise since I was last in Las Vegas in 2003! Slice of Vegas was great and worth the walk and tram ride over to Mandalay Bay.

Went here while waiting to see the Chris angel show at the Luxor. the hostess was obviously new but she seated us right away. It was around 3:30 on a Tuesday so there were only like four other booths taken. 
Our server was nice with cool tattoos and recommended her favorite dishes. We ordered wings and since they were half off for happy hour we ordered a BBQ and a hot. Both were delicious! My favorite part of the meal. The BBQ had a little kick too it and was that sticky sauce you lick off your fingers..yum! They were very big with a lot of moist meat. My only complaint would be that the hot flavor was not hot enough for my taste. We also ordered a Caesar salad which was really good too, the croutons were very garlicy and the sauce very creamy. The pizza was kind of greasy and the crust underdone. So the app and salad was what brought my rating up to 4 stars!
Not great on the pizza, but the wings were amazing! And salad great!
Best pizza in Vegas!!  Wow we ordered the 18" for a party of four and it was satisfying. The server was great and very attentive. Great price too.

Bought a dining certificate from Travelzoo $39 dinner: 2 glasses of wine, 2 appetizers and 2 entrees. We called in advance to make a reservation for Friday at 7 o'clock; it was totally unnecessary. The restaurant was only half full. 

We were first seated in booth overlooking the mall, but I became nauseated from the overpowering scents wafting over from Lush. They moved us without any trouble.

We asked to substitute beer for wine, but no go. House wine was the only option. Two pinot grigios were brought over. It was really sharp, way too much acidity.

We started with the tuscan salad ($10.95) Fresh spring mix, tossed with diced Roma tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, sliced red onion, basil, parsley and toasted chunks of herb 
infused bread. Finished with an aged balsamic vinaigrette. And garlic fries ($6.95). The salad was nicely dressed and fresh only complaint was the lack of mozzarella cheese. The fries were shoestring and crisp, but pretty average. The garlic aioli was heavy; not a fan.

Next we had the Margherita ($18.95) pizza and the rigatoni with meatballs and bologonese ($17.90). With a name like Slice of Vegas I had to try the Pizza. I wish I hadn't. The rigatoni was far superior. The margherita crust was tasteless and the ingredients lacked that high quality flavor. It was a real disappointment. The meatballs were ok, they tasted too bready to me, but the bolgonese sauce with the rigatoni was a real surprise. My husband and I both liked it.

If I were judging the pasta and salad on its own, I'd give an A-OK rating, but since the signature item is pizza. This was definitely "meh" and we were thankful our tab was about 50% off. It's definitely not worth full price.

Horrible experience! Found this place while we were walking between casinos. They looked open so we walked in and sat at the bar. We could tell the bartender was busy but she took care of us pretty quickly and got our order in and got us some drinks. We were hungry so we ordered a pizza and some fries. After 40 minutes it was apparent there was something wrong in the kitchen. No one had a pizza at their table.  A few finally came out and they were for people who came in 15 minutes after us!  So, after an hour of waiting, with no one coming to check on us or tell us anything i asked the manager, Christy, about the status of our order. She was completely unprofessional and rude. According to her they were technically closed and re opened to accommodate "your group" and they were shorthanded. We should be patient and grateful that they were serving us.  WHAT!?  I was not part of any group that caused her back up. And furthermore, lady, you were not accommodating me, you reopened cause you saw a chance to make some money. If you didn't have the manpower, CHRISTY, you shouldn't have opened.  Minimum you should APOLOGIZE and check on my freaking order. And if you were having issues you should have stopped by sooner to let us know. Horrible customer service.  Will never go back and will warn EVERYONE.

DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.
Pizza slices are not fresh nor can you get a topping as simple as garlic on your slice. Fried raviolis are obviously frozen and thrown in the fryer. There are a lot of great pizza places around, New York New York has a great one. Service was horrible. This was the only negative eating experience we had in Vegas. I don't like "fast food" pizza (Pizza Hut etc.) but honestly, this pizza was worse.

If you like fresh roasted garlic, try the appetizer garlic bread and squeeze the daily fresh roasted cloves on the bread. Buffalo pizza was spot on--not to hot but not mild either. Great drink selection.

5 stars for the $5 Fat Tire happy hour and the calamari
3 stars for the pizza - it was decent, it hit the spot, but nothing to write home about
2 stars for the t shirts - wait staff wear shirts that have all of these euphemism for breasts. Lame and borderline offensive.  I get it, it's Vegas, but what does this have to do with pizza?  Totally unnecessary. (Edited:  I was informed by the owner after posting the review that the shirts are to raise awareness of breast cancer research.  ok)

The wife and I had just checked into our room and we're starving after a long drive from LA so we decided to walk around and find something to nibble on before dinner... we walked past Slice of Vegas and saw the Happy Hour special so figured "why not".

The slices were good... I'm an east coast Italian and I'm  hard to please but these are passable. Very good... we also split the meatball appitizer...that was an excellent  choice. Very tasty. Will visit again.

Have you ever had Tombstone frozen pizza? Because that's what this place reminds me of. 

My gf and I split a pizza, half cheese and half The Garden. The pizza is thin, the crust is dry. The crust is crunchy and very dry. I wasn't too stoked on it. It's not horrible, but it's not awesome. It seriously just tastes like Tombstone frozen pizza. They do have a decent beer selection though, so that's cool.

The service was mediocre. Our waitress was cool. She was nice and pleasant and took care of us. The service is just slow, maybe she had too many tables? It took awhile to get our food, it took even longer to get our check. At least she was attentive. 

It seems to me most people who are giving it high ratings are eating off the vegan menu. I would have gladly eaten some items from the vegan menu to try it out, but my gf wasn't feeling it. 

I wouldn't eat here again off the normal menu, but I'd try the vegan menu just to see if it really is all that it's hyped up to be. The only reason they got 3 stars is because they have some solid craft beer choices.

SO excited to find they had a VEGAN MENU and I ate there 4 times while in town and everything was great!  They are also SUPER sweet and accommodating-- the last night, they let me customize a meal since I couldn't decide which of the 3 meals I wanted! haha  It was a hoagie with portabello mushrooms, peppers, onions, vegan chicken all tossed in a pesto sauce! MMMMMmmmmm :D  Had a pesto pasta the first night with vegan chicken and fries.. SO good!!

Pizza is pretty good. Tuscan Soup good, but no where as good as mine! lol Not your mama's garlic bread, yum!!! But the cannolis, sooooo GOOD! I have to say, that the shells for these cannolis are the best I've ever had! So if you come here, definitely get the Cannolis, you will not be disappointed. Also, super friendly staff.

Slow service, mediocre food. Waited for about ten minutes before being greeted at our table. Took another ten minutes to get a water and a soda. We got a bbq chicken pizza. The chicken was truly disgusting--low quality, not marrinated, unseasoned, undercooked and definitely wasn't grilled, perhaps boiled or pan cooked. I found it inedible. Once I removed the chicken, the pizza was pretty good. Sat ten minutes at the table after we finished our food (empty drinks also) and we finally had to flag down our waitress for the bill

Last review of my Vegas trip: this is a casual shindig located in Mandalay Bay. It's got a huge menu and reasonable rates. Eating here won't break the bank, and then you can go ahead and use the money you saved on Michael Jackson: One tickets. I'd eat here again.

I am going to rate their Vegan Pizza because they are one of only 2 places that serve vegan pizza in Vegas ( that I know of) 

To start, I am dumbfounded that other places don't offer it. All they have to do is use a different cheese and charge a premium for it. Not like they have to change all ingredients in making the pizza. So I am very glad this place allows me to come with my friends and we are all able to get something to eat. 

I tried their Vegan Supreme Pizza. I have to say that while vegan pizza will probably never be as good as the "real thing", this rates a solid 7/10. 

The dough is very good, the sauce used was not that bad ( a little too thick for my personal taste but good nevertheless) the cheese used I believe is regular Daiya, which vegans have a love or hate relationship with. It's not my cheese of choice for pizzas I make at home but it's decent. 

The only con is the price. It is quite expensive, I ended up paying about $35 after taxes for an 18".  

I understand they charge a solid $7-8 premium on top of the vegan pizzas, and again, no complaints at all, at least they're giving us an option. BUT it's not like I can go there every weekend and grab a pizza, so unfortunately the price is much higher than i'd expect to pay for a pizza. 

Very decent taste. Very Expensive as well. Will I go back?  On rare occasions due to the price. But I can see myself trying their other flavors.

This place gives me mixed feelings, sometimes I really love it and sometimes I can go without. Even though they are known for their pizzas, their salads are the best. Mainly the caprese salad loaded with fried capers and bitter greens, I would regularly come here for that. Id give them 5 stars but their pizza is a miss for me- the more toppings the undercooked dough you'll end up eating. Thumbs up for their salads, and thumbs down for their pizzas. Oh the cannolis are pretty good though.
Fast and lovely service. Food was good. Wasnt the greatest  pizza ive tried. But if I'm looking for something quick,  I'll definitely stop back in.

We were looking for a quick place to eat that had vegan opitons (hard to find). This was on the way to the Shark Reef we were going to and YAY they had a vegan menu. We got the Buffalo Chicken Pizza and the Pesto Garlic bread. Both were sooooo good. I wish the pizza had more toppings but it was still great. Would go back in a second.

Great food and friendly service. Stop by every time I'm on the strip. Nestled in the Mandalay place mall "which offers free valet" it is convenient and affordable.
And the local craft beer selection  is amazing!

Ok you guys...
Took Sarie out for a little 5th of July lunch.  I was pretty hung this morning, so we thought some sausage and carbs would definitely do the trick. Found a groupon for this joint. It's in Mandalay place, nice location. (It's always fun to stare at Pete Rose sitting at an empty autograph table).
At the podium we were quoted a ten minute wait, which was exactly how long it took. Seated at a crappy corner table, then I asked to move to a slightly less crappy corner table. Oh well.
They have a very nice beer selection. Great microbrews including my favorite beer ever brewed, New Belgium's 'La Folie.' Try it if you dare: a sour brown ale aged in merlot casks. Very well babanced, perfect use of Brettanomyces and tannin. Whoooohooo.
The people next to us had a gigantic pepperoni pizza on the table.  It looked alright, a little soggy for my taste. I also saw some spaghetti and red sauce dishes that appeared to be nothing spactacular.
Sarie ordered a cup of coffee and we relaxed a minute. The menu looked good, we decided to share a 'panini'... We ordered the proscuitto and brie. "That sandwich is no longer on the menu" our server tells us. What are you talking about, I think to myself, it's printed right there, stupid. Obviously it's on the menu. How about saying something like 'Oh, i'm very sorry, we're out of that one. maybe you'd like the _____ instead.' But I said Ok, we'll take the meatball sub.  
Big mistake. 
First of all, it had very marginal flavor. The 'meatball' was more like a mushy sausage patty than a meatball. The red sauce was equally flavorless and I only knew it has cheese because I could see it. No taste there either.  AND it was certainly not a panini, which should be pressed and grilled. This was more like a toasted sandwich. Im sure Quiznos has a better one, anyway. 
The garlic fries would have been wonderful if they were not served cold. 80 degrees is perfect for San Diego, not frenchies. I would have sent for some fresh ones, but our server might as well have been David Copperfield's sister, as good as she was at vanishing. We got the bill, and I was surprised to see that Sarie's cup of coffee cost about as much as a footlong meatball sub at Subway (which is where we should have gone in the first place).
Started feeling sick on the way home (although that might've been due to last night's festivities, which included copious amounts of liquid courage and about 65 cubic yards of mentholated smoke).
Oh, and the groupon isn't even good until tomorrow, so now I'll have to go back, although I really don't want to. But when I do, it'll be for 2 bottles of La Folie and some hot garlic fries.
All in all, this was a terrible way to spend $20 and an hour of our time. Blah food, blah service, blah blah blah. I'm giving it 2 stars only because of the great beer list and clean atmosphere.
Thanks you guys. Always a pleasure telling you how it is.

Ordered a burger to share with my wife. Spot on. The sweet potato fries went really well with the burger. Burger looked like a juiced up hotdog and tastes great. Service was bit spotty. Got 15% discount from yelp for which the waitress took our phone back to the manager.

Quite honestly, don't understand the awful reviews. Yes its pricey BUT when you go out to dine, do you mind paying a little extra for great service? Nuh uh..I sure don't.

Food is good, not great orgasmic great. My first experience was latenight in their deli side of the restaurant. We went to dine in but it was too late so we went over to the other side. The young girl with the cool hat was a sweet heart. My fiance was very specific about tri cutting her slices and light on this heavy on that and despite the five people behind us, she kept a smile on her face and said absolutely. We ordered five slices because we didnt want to wait for a whole pizza so we paid twice what we could've if we were fifteen minutes patient. I wanted my pizza pronto! The pizza once perfectly customized had good flavor but pepperoni was a bit salty. Try shrimp with garlic...mmmm....Great service not easy on pocket. 

Restaurant we dined in a couple days later. Hostess was friendly and server was very attentive as well. We orderd the capri sandwhich with garlic fries ((delicious)) .  My boo ordered the feducinni alfredo with marinara and meatballs extra cheese , She enjoyed it as well. We couldnt resist so we also ordered a loaded slice sliced in half. Tasty but a little cold by the time we ate it, 

Oh and they have a jukebox.,make everyone listen to what you wanna hear,,,awesome!

We will be going back for a quick bite
Great thin crust pizza place in the area. The meat lovers had a good portion of meat, and the ambience wasn't too loud.

Their slices are roughly $5-6 bucks each so if you think you'll eat around 3 slices -- just get a personal pie -- you'll get more bang for your buck.

We got the 4 cheese truffle pizza -- which was good flavor-wise but pretty greasy . The Caesar salad was pretty standard, but I enjoyed the parmesan crisps that were in the salad that was a nice touch. Their pizza won't blow you away, but it's a  solid choice for your pizza craving. 

Service wise -- our waitress was pretty lackluster. She was friendly -- however didn't provide great service. Our waters were almost always empty unless we initiated a request. Took a while to order our drinks and food respectively.. below par service.

Yeah, not a good place to eat pizza, not a good place for customer service... not a good place. (Period) It looks nice from the outside. However, the attitudes of the server(s) and manager leave a LOT to be desired. Funny thing the manager stated that they put a premium on service... as I was walking out the door 100% NOT satisfied. There are too many other places to eat to have to worry about BAD attitudes.

The pizza was TERRIBLE. After reading reviews of how good the food is, it was just awful. We got a slice and a margherita pizza. I mean it was bad and we are from Philadelphia. Worse than suburban Philadelphia pizza. Very disappointed 

Service was very good
1st off I didn't eat there but I did stop in for a beer. They have an awesome craft beer selection and the waitress was super friendly. Will definitely go back for more beer!

When I stay at the Mandalay I prefer to eat outside of the resort. I love the pizza here, the sauce and cheese portion is the way I like it, on the light side.

Service is quick, staff is friendly.  If you want to get away from the buffet line, this is the place to go.
Overall this place was amazing.  We got the garden veggie pizza alone with a hoagie sandwich.  Both items were full of flavor.  Definitely will return here when I come back to Vegas.

Starting out w/ full disclosure, I am not a fan of NY style pizza so I was never going to love Slice of Vegas.....but in the end, I felt this pizza was only okay.....greasy, flimsy crust but there was a nice toppings ratio

Extra props go to the poor staff who was forced to deal w/ the masses of drunken Mandalay Bay beach / concert goers who were completely wasted by the time we showed up at 7pm

They took orders efficiently & served up the pizza choices quickly

I also appreciated the fact there were many choices for toppings & you could choose or build your own.  They also had quite a number of good-looking side dishes ( such as spicy, roasted cauliflower ) and I imagine this would have been yummy on their cheese pizza..... alas, Sis doesn't like spicy & we wanted to get something Sis, Mr & I could all share

So we opted for the 4 Cheese w/ Truffle Oil.  I liked the creamy ricotta & the truffle was pungent in smell but unfortunately not in taste

So all in all, this wasn't all that bad but I'd probably look elsewhere, in seeking pizza nirvana
Tastes like Totinos!

We stay at the Luxor a lot because of the free rooms. Binge drinking all day and night gets to you. I usually wake up and crave soup... sadly the food court in the Luxor does not have that... 

Slice of Vegas has the Tuscan Soup DAILY and also another soup of the day. It's also very hearty and yummy soups. It gives you life! 

The pizza, pasta and burgers are really good. I try something new everytime and they haven't disappointed me once yet!

Hubby and I met a group of about 15 other people here for Vegan Pizza Day 2013.
Hubby and I just ordered water but I did notice they carry wine and beer. I'm not sure if but I thought I saw a full bar.

We ordered an order of Not Your Mama's Garlic Bread and WOWOWOWOWOWOWWWW it was sooooo good! The pesto on it was perfect (not too much) and the whole clove of roasted garlic on the side...I ate almost the whole thing by myself. I saved the last of it to spread on my pizza and I even squished out the last tiny bit and licked it off my finger...yep it was that good!

Hubby and I ordered an 18" Vegan Faux Pie and let me tell you...it was perfect. Not toooo much cheese. Even though I'm not a huge fan of Daiya cheese I really liked it on this pizza because they did not use too much. Sometimes it can get all goopey if your not careful with it. The veggies were cooked perfect and the sauce was seasoned perfect and I liked the little kick that it had to it. I was excited that we had a bunch of pieces left over :)

I convinced our friend to trade me one of his vegan buffalo pizza pieces and it was super duper good also. I just really liked our veggie pizza better and I'm trying to limit my soy meat products right now.

Our service was perfect and with our large group...we have zero complaints! I can't wait to go back and try some of those yummmmmmmy vegan sandwiches on the menu.

Yummmmmmm!
I was impressed with how good the pizza was.  Be sure you don't miss out on the garlic Parmesan fries.    Amazing.   The service was also very good

After walking an hour from the other end of the Strip to taste this vegan-friendly restaurant, we were told that their dining room closed at 10 pm, while they still sold (non-vegan) pizza slices until 11. Nowhere, including their own website, does it say the time difference. The employee working the pizza slice station did patiently explain that Hussong's next door had a vegan menu as well.

Despite the recent 5 star reviews, I really think the 3.5 star rating on Yelp is an accurate representation of the food and service you'll get here.

The pizza was incredibly salty, which made me want to drink more water. But the waiter never came! She seemed really busy because the restaurant was closing in 30 minutes, which resulted in us waiting a long time to put in our orders. My water never got refilled either. 

The food is a 2/5 and so is the service.

Avoid this place like the plague. I'll keep it simple; service was horrible, management etiquette was crap, food was poor. To be faIr, perhaps the waitress, manager, and cook were all having a bad day, which led to my dissapointing experience. If so, my advice to those people - moving forward ensure  2 of the 3 of you  are having an ok day to hold the place together or at least be professional and put your personal drama aside when working with patrons.

Tuesday Special from 2pm - 4pm, you can get a slice of cheese pizza for 2 dollars or a 1 topping slice for 3 dollars.

PIzza dough was really bland and it was soft even after heating it back up in the pizza oven. The cheese and sauce were OK. 

It's not in the Settebello, Metro, or Secret Pizza league.. but it's far better than a Papa Johns or Domino's. Probably compareable to a Rosati's. It's a good deal for that time period.
I was in for some pizza over the weekend and Johnna was our server. Both she and the food were AMAZING. Thank you Las Vegas for having great pizza like the east coast.

Been here 3 times to eat while in Vegas. It is convenient to the Luxor hotel. A little pricy but pretty good pizza. You can get a whole pizza or they have specials by the slice. A tad bit too much garlic on the seasoned fries. I will return because of the great location, and sometimes they have a Groupon offer.
Big prices for small portions,  but I guess that's vegas. The flavor was ok. I got the fettuccine alfredo, baby daddy got pizza. Satisfied but won't be back anytime soon.

We eat here every time we go to Vegas because of the vegan options.  Everything I've eaten here has been great and the vegan pizza really is one of the best that I've had.  I took off one star because it is quite pricey for a pizza joint, which I'm sure is because everything is expensive in Vegas.

In our week in Vegas we stopped in for lunch/dinner here about 3 times I think. This was not only due to convenience, but because it was a great bargain and delicious food. The happy hour is seriously amazing. Discount appetizers, beer, and pizza by the slice. Every time we visited, the service was fast and friendly. I think this was one of our favorite easy casual spots for grabbing a beer and a snack. My son (9 yrs old) loved the wings and pizza! I would classify the atmosphere kind of like a family friendly sports bar. I'm sure it can get loud during sports games, but we didn't experience any crowds or noise. Over all, I would definitely recommend-

I love this place! My friends and I ordered an 18 inch pizza with huge pepperoni and meatball slices. It was a bit greasy, but all in all a good pie. Oh also you have to try the watermelon lemonade! Yum!
I often bring family when there in town here. Good pizza and I like the location because I go to Luxor and Mandalay Bay often. Just a slice to go or sit down for a whole pie its all good.

So great to have a place with a Vegan Menu right by the strip (we stayed at Luxor, and it's accessible from inside of the hotel).

If you're vegan and in Vegas this is a great spot :) 

Recommend the Not Your Mama's Garlic Bread and the Buffalo Pizza, the fries are good too! They do a great job on their sauces (spicy marinara, pesto, etc). I also tried the Spaghetti with meatballs and garlic, the noodles and sauce were delicious, the meatballs were okay, but not exceptional.

The vegan pizza here was amazing and visiting Las Vegas it's was hard for me to find good vegan food! I was suprised to find out that this place has a separate vegan menu and I highly recommend this place for vegan wanting grab a fast bite. They use Daiya cheese which I am not found of but it is a good product. I would recommend that they use other vegan cheese options such as Chao, Follow your Heart and Kite Hill. The food here was great!

There are many vegan options. I ordered a veggie salad with hummus, which was very good; and the vegetables were all perfectly fresh. I also had the best vegan chocolate cake ever! Polite staff, as well.
Great place with good food, and a good selection of craft beers.  The bartenders were very nice.

This place was fantastic. A full vegan menu, which the pizza was great, awesome service, AND I left my credit card at the restaurant and didn't realize it until I got to the airport. I called them and they were nice enough to mail it back to me. They're awesome!

This place is great.  I came here for lunch on a Thursday.  Ordered a pizza and a side salad.  
i really liked the atmosphere.  Check in on yelp for some free delicious garlic parmesan fries.  Their alcoholic drinks are a little pricey, but you are in a hotel... The servers were fast and friendly, and a member of management came by to ask how our food was.  Everyone in the restaurant seemed to be enjoying their meals as well.

Ordered the supreme pizza it's was ok! Not really crazy about it! Had the Rosemary fries with aioli dip that's really good. The hostess at the podium are really nice. The place has a cool set up also have a juke box to play music of your choice.
Came here on a business trip and was really disappointed. The pizza is about the same as Chucky Cheese, thin and greasy. Hopefully their other food is better.

Very Good Vegan Pizza!! I will be coming here again. I have had other vegan pizza, and none as good as this place. They even have a separate fryer for vegan food. They have a full menu of vegan food. Veggie Burgers, vegan buffalo Chick'n, vegan dessert, and appetizers. The food is actually very very good.

Their vegan menu was amazing! I tried the three course special for Veganuary and I particularly liked the pesto hummus. My boyfriend got the pesto garlic bread and meatball sub and it was awesome. A little pricey but if you want to try great vegan food, this is a good option!

The pizza was just aight. I had a slice of pepperoni. The pepperoni was definitely a step up from most pizza joints. The sauce was okay, a little salty. If I had a beer with it I think it would have been perfect. It could've used more cheese. The crust was crunchy how I like it. It didn't come out all that hot either. I would have felt better paying $3 for slice but it is in Mandalay Bay so enough said.

Not just pizza available here!

Paninis, pasta, pizza and some fantastic apps and desserts :)

Great service too! And there's a jukebox!!
I love their vegan menu!! Their selection was great and my mushroom and bell pepper sandwich was super tasty! I love the garden salad too!

Not a bad place for a quick slice and a beer.  The pizza is decent and the staff is friendly.  I had a meat lovers type thing and it was delicious.  I don't have any complaints at all about the food.

The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the restrooms are outside the place and way down a long hallway.  It's a sit down place that serves beer without a restroom ?  It was just weird and bothered me.  Felt like a food court with sit down prices.

A greasy, cold shingle sold to me as a pizza slice. 

Never again.

Every time we are in Vegas, we go here because they have WONDERFUL vegan options!  The service is always great and you can peoplewatch by the windows.  This is such a great late night snack!  Try the vegan buffalo chicken pizza and the doughballs for dessert!

Thanks for having us!

Left Burger bar after too big a tab for just 2 beers and came here. This place is awesome.
They have a great happy hour, great beer on tap, great beer in bottles, and daily specials. Our stone IPAs were only $4! SO we each had two and ordered "not your jams garlic bread". just needed something small before the show-It was incredible! Garlic bread covered in pesto served with a head of roasted garlic! SO delicious! I would come in here every time before shows, and maybe even make special trips!  (I don't live near the strip, in fact I hate the strip.)

Located in the mall between Mandalay Bay and Luxor. Very casual place with TVs all around. You can sit down or buy a slice a la carte. The food here was average. If you like thin and greasy pizza then this place might be for you. Look to spend about $18 for a personal pizza which is high but consistent with Vegas prices. I don't think we will be back but might be ok to grab a slice in a pinch.

Passable. Nothing was bad and surely nothing was great- with the exception of the roasted elephant garlic which accompanied the garlic bread. No way that was a 12 inch pizza. Thank goodness I only ordered one with one topping. I would have been really miffed if I would have gotten one of the specialty ones that was 19$ for that dinky of a pizza. Salads are crazy over-priced- I mean crazy...$12 for a salad they said was supposed to have a variety of items besides lettuce. Was almost all lettuce and a pittance of the other items. Beer prices are a little high as well. Service was a mix- waiter was very nice and helpful. However one of the hostesses was literally a deer in headlights. She must have literally stared at me for 4 or 5 minutes while I stood in front of her. I finally had to say I had a reservation and she was like "Oh" It was really weird and then sadly her manager remarked that she's "highly qualified to be a hostess" instead of saying he was sorry for what happened. Strange management. Incredibly overpriced. A big waste of your time. The taste of the food is just over a 3 out of 5, but their cheapness in ingredient use and price-gouging lands them an overall 2. If you come here, you surely won't leaving saying the food tasted bad, but you might be mad at yourself for the reasons mentioned above. There are SO many better places to go in Vega$ @ all price points where you get your money's worth whether high or low. This is SURELY not one of them.

The garlic bread was hard as a rock! It hurt my teeth when I tried to eat it. When we mentioned it to our server, she tried to tell us that it's always like that, but said she'd have her manager come to speak to us. He came over and said that's just how it is because of the bread they use and then they toast it. No attempt at customer service whatsoever! When our pasta came, you could tell it had been sitting for a while. The pasta was so hard it couldn't even be considered al dente and the sauce dried up within minutes. Seriously, the best thing we had there was a tequila shot, and that's because they didn't have to cook it!

HUGE portions, share the garlic fries! Some of the food was a little bland. Toasted ravioli was yum. 
Let me also add that I would totally go back when I visit the area. It was a fun atmosphere, and the service was great

AMAZING vegan food! 
We ordered bruschetta, Cajun fries as appetizers. I ordered a custom pizza with Basil, bell peppers, onions and vegan cheese. My husband ordered vegan pasta. At the end of it, nothing was left. It was a lot of yummy in my tummy!! I'm definitely coming back again.

We Had The Most Amazing Time Here. We Came To Vegas Last Year And We Where Walking And We Seen This Restaurant... I Don't Remember Why We Didn't Try It Out Then. But Anyways, Today We Decided To Try It. The Food Was Amazing, We Ordered The Helldorado Pizza, Supper Delicious And Super Spicy. We Also Ordered Parmesan Fries, Salted Edammae And A Cesar Salad. Everything Was So Good. Our Waitress Was Johnna, And She Was Extremely Nice. She Always Came By To See If We Needed Anything Or If We Where Okay. Also, There Was A Magician, I Believe His Name Was Zac, He Did A Little Show ... And Then Went Around Peoples Table Doing Some Entertainment. He Came To Our Table, We Had A Great Time With Him. He Told Us Jokes, Did Some Tricks And Told Us Stories. I Thought That Was Cool. Everyone Was Nice. The Restuarnt Was Clean And It Wasn't Too Busy. Which Was Nice And Calm. I Would Really Recommend This Place If You Enjoy Pizza And Drinks. We Will Definatly Be Coming Bcak.

I had the chicken parm pizza and it was delicious! Crispy chicken, and very fresh ingredients. Being that we went about 45 minutes before closing, the service was still quick and friendly and everything was cooked fresh and hot (no end of the night, cold items). P.S-The garlic fries were AMAZING!

Very good Pizza in the Luxor/Mandalay bay corridor.  

This place is conveniently located in the walking corridor between the Luxor and the shops at Mandalay Bay. The pizza looked very gourmet on all the signs and in all of the advertisements I saw at the Luxor.  We had just gotten to Vegas and were famished so we decided to have pizza for lunch.

We ordered a Sausage, Mushroom, Onion, jalapeno pizza.  Everything on top was incredible.  Fresh toppings, tasty sauce, good amount of cheese. The crust was thin, which was perfect for us, but it was a little too crispy.  Probably about an 1/8 of an inch of hard crispiness. This is totally personal preference.  We thoroughly enjoyed the pizza and the friendly service.  

Great place!

I loved their Garlic Shoestring Fries which was tossed in salt, black pepper Parmigiano-Reggiano and garlic and served with a delicious pesto aioli sauce....  The New York style pizza was also delectable with a thin, chewy crust and fresh ingredients.  I will definitely come back for more!

We went here last night with a group of six. We decided to try it because I had a coupon to the restaurant and reviews seemed fair. Our server was very unenthused to serve us and our over all experience was maybe 3 stars. 
The reason I'm leaving them one star is after the restaurant my brother-in-law and I started feeling sick. We both ordered a side Caesar salad and a small pizza. Not only did we stay up all night throwing up but we stayed in our hotel room the entire following day with food poisoning. 
I was curious if it was from the alcohol but I was the only one in our group that was actually drinking that night. Our vegas trip was ruined.

They have an awesome beer selection and our waiter (who was also the bartender) was incredible....but the pizza was ehh. We were buzzed and excited we had stumbled upon a pizza place. When our pizza finally came out, 45 min wait by the way, is wasn't a pizza but bread with a pool of grease on top. Super disappointing, but as we walked out the sandwiches looked decent...so maybe give those a try.

So many choices for vegetarians and vegans.  We had a vegetarian meatball pizza, meatball sub, and the vegetarian wings (they are gardein).  I always stop here when I am in Vegas, because I appreciate the effort!    The real star is the service.  Our order got mixed up in the kitchen, and our server came out to apologize, rushed the rest of the order out so we could eat while we waited for the other pizza (which took all of 10 mins, tops).  Then the host came over to apologize, and offered us a free desert.    Now all you need is truly great vegan pepperoni!

great thin crust pizza; great vegan chicken wings! My dad ordered the pasta fagioli and roasted artichoke and he loved it! My brother ordered one of the pasta dishes and enjoyed it also. I ordered the gluten free margherita & another without cheese and it was great. Great vegan & gluten free options overall
Awesome food! Little pricey but worth every penny! Relaxing atmosphere and easy going servers. A welcome smile at the door!

So good.  We make it a point to go to this pizza place whenever we are in Vegas.  I'm vegan and my husband is not, and we are both totally satisfied.  I like the buffalo chicken pizza, whatever it is called . . . delicious!  Also last time we got the ridiculous fishbowl drink and it was super tasty and really fun - and huge.

Excellent!

I especially loved the Pesto Pizza!!

The plain slices are fantastic.
It's a bit pricey, but worth it for mid mall snacking.

Give it a shot!!!

Slice of Vegas is a great and reasonably priced Italian restaurant worth every penny. We ate lunch there three days in a row trying different menu items, and each time we had great food and great service. The pizzas and pastas are very tasty. Next time we are in Vegas, this is one restaurant we are definitely going to visit.
I absolute love the vegan menu! From the meatless meatball subs to the garlic Rosemary fries own could be in Italian heaven for a while. Oh, and yes, there's vegan dessert !!!!!
The food was good, our waiter was nice. The service was quick and the prices weren't too bad.

I came here with a friend who purchased a Groupon. I don't think he realized it was in a strip hotel. Anyways, we made the commute from Henderson and we were pretty disappointed When we arrived We were directed to the bar, unless we wanted to wait even though the place was 30 percent full. 

We started with the garlic bread with pesto. They brought us regular "garlic bread" which was 4 slices of Italian bread with a roasted bulb of garlic on the side. It was OK. The bread didn't have any kind of butter or oil on it. It was kind of an interesting take on garlic bread. For my entree I had the meatball panini. It was just OK. The best part were the garlic fries it came with. The meatballs we're homemade, but not that great.

Unless I'm stranded at Mandalay Bay and starving, I will not be returning to Slice of Vegas.

1. We just happened to be at the Minus 5 ice bar next door and needed to find lunch.
2. We had to go to the airport in less than an hour, so it couldn't be a drawn out meal.
3. We are foodies
Man, were we blown away. All we ordered was a 'Choked Pig Pizza and it was the greatest pizza I've had since I can remember. Service was fun and personal, and very accommodating to us needing to get out. 3 of us girls DUSTED the pizza, and should have ordered a second one to go for the flights home.
Will definitely be back there on my next Vegas vacation!

Had food poisoning when I came here (not from this place). I was not in the right mind to be eating, but I figured some bread and fluids might work. Bread turned into pizza which delicious cheese. My cousin got the 5 cheese I think and it was way better than mine. The ricotta was super good. Started feeling good and ordered a beer with dinner too. It was a nice easy casual dining experience. I plan to go back when I am in town next month.

The pizza was pretty good, but I was highly disappointed that they didn't offer their special tanked drink at a smaller size. I really wanted one but there was no way that I could have drank a whole one by myself. However they did have cheery Lambic and that drink paired really well with the pizza.

This place is straight up garbage... The pizzas are just ok. Honestly I would rather eat dominos that this place. My friend ordered the meatballs and wow is was like frozen meatballs overcooked and dump in sauce. Would not recommend this flavorless meal. Also we ordered both soups and they were both really disgusting. The Tuscan had wayyy too much Tabasco added into it, and I love Tabasco... The other soup was just flavorless. It was like drinking water. Honestly a waste of money. Go to the food court a little farther down and get something cheaper.

In search of a spot on day 3 in Vegas to not spend a fortune on food we came across this unassuming pizza joint.

Employees were very friendly and the place was clean. Because it was busy we were seated at the bar. Side note: the bar stools aren't very comfy on the ole' back. 

I opted to "make my own" pizza while my girlfriend went for the "Greek". I'd say it took slightly longer than average for the pies to come out. And they were just ok... not bad, not great, just ok.

I will say that I never could have imagined that a gyro inspired pizza would be good, but it was definitely the better of the two. 

I should also warn that their sausage is very very very very finely ground.  Why is that important? It reminded me of the cheap stuff on the $1 frozen mini pizzas I ate in college when I was broke. No me gusta. 

Like I said: not bad, not good, just ok for what the place is...
Food was satisfying.  Salad was delicious as was the pizza and pasta.

I had heard from many people that eating vegan in Vegas was fairly difficult. I found quite the contrary. I also was coming from a highly isolate hunting community in the middle of northern Canada, so I could be a bad judge but many restaurants in Vegas not only offer vegan options but have a fully vegan menu available upon request. Slice of Vegas was of our first stops, the night we arrived. We were famished, of course. Slice of Vegas is located in lovely Mandalay Place which is easily accessible from the Luxor hotel. Unfortunately, the restaurant was full, so we didn't get to dine in but the waitress told us we could order from their take-out window. That's what we did. Ana and I opted on sharing the BBQ chick'n pizza, Dave went for the meatless meatball sub and we all got a slice of their peanut butter chocolate cake for dessert.

The food was incredible, flavourful and even the biggest meat-eater would not be disappointed with the vegan food. The cake was simply delicious that I can't help but rave about that all on it's own. It was moist and extremely chocolatey, along with that delicious peanut butter creamy frosting. It was the perfect place to start off my palate's vacation.
Had great service from Janneke from El Paso, Texas.  Made us feel at home! Outstanding

Tried this place while we were in Vegas since we had a coupon. The husband got the meat ball sandwich and I got the Philly cheesesteak. We both loved our sandwiches! So so good! I had a side Caesar salad and loved that as well! For desert we tried the cannoli sand they also were very tasty! Glad we tried this place!
Ordered from the vegan menu. Food was okay, but not special, especially considering the prices. I will say the vegan chocolate cake with peanut butter frosting was delicious.

I don't know how their regular pizza compares to others, but their vegan pizza is the best I've had anywhere! I started with the vegan hot wings, which were just Gardein chicken tenders with their hot sauce and vegan ranch. All good. Then I ordered the meatless meatball pizza.  Seriously, the most legit vegan pizza I've ever had! Our server was also great. We had a party of 11 people, which he handled without a hiccup.
This pizza was amazing! My friends and I stopped while we were visiting. My cheese pizza was amazing. The personal pans are large enough to share it so if you're on a budget it's a good idea.

Can't really attest to the food, but the ownership of this place is great. I had an allergy incident here and they were quick to get back with me and refund my purchase. The owner met with me personally which was impressive.

My favorite pizza is BBQ chicken and they serve up a very good version here. The prices weren't too bad with the Groupon my girl had. Service was decent, they have a good amount of beer on tap and they air football in the bar. What's not to like about this place?

This was a good place to grab a quick bite to eat. Pizza and sandwiches were both yummy, service was friendly. Not gourmet but a nice switch up from the usual fancy restaurants or buffets that you get in Vegas.

We love this place! We have been here multiple times. All of the pizza is good, my favorite is the 4 cheese truffle.  BUT, you have to try the appetizers! The roasted cauliflower is so good and the Not Your Mamas Garlic bread is to die for! It comes with an actual clove of garlic that you squeeze out and spread on the bread, amazing! I highly recommend!

A little late (!) review, as I went in January this year! But backtracking on some places I haven't reviewed that I went to while in The Vegas. I loved this joint! In my hotel, it provided me with excellent vegan friendly choices! I brought back my brother and his girlfriend so he could get involved in some veggie friendly meat substitutions. I tried both the Meatless Meatball and The Vegan Faux Pie- both were delicious. As far as sides go, the Meatless Meatballs were good but a very small portion for the $ & the what I thought were faux 'chicken wings' turned out to be what we in the UK would deem were chicken nuggets? That was v disappointing, but I'm not sure what I expected I would get in a vegan chicken wing! Maybe over-expectation! Great, great pizza's though for vegans! Well worth the trip.
Very solid. Big portion for my meatball sandwich. Sat at bar and everyone was very nice and attentive. I just went solo for a quick lunch and watched some sports while also working.

We found this place browsing for events on facebook. They had a special for National Cheese Pizza Day.  $1.99 for a 12 in cheese Pizza. Available only on 9/5/2016. Incredible deal considering that the pizza is huge and delicious!!! Limit was 1 per guest and additional toppings was $1.75 each.

We were one of the first there so we were greeted and seated right away. Julie was our waiter who waited on us very nice and kept making sure we were ok.

We ordered the jalapeno mac n cheese. I'm usually not a fan of restaurants mac n cheese but this. Omg. So good. It had bacon bits in too. My husband and I shared as an appetizer. It was served in a bread bowl. Which made it even more amazing. We also ordered my boys dough balls to play with while we waited for our food.  They were $2 each and so worth it.  The boys really enjoyed them lol
