Only down fall for me was that they had no discounts on beer for locals. I understand being inside a casino on the strip they up beer prices for that reason. But again being local I wish I got a discount. They had some pretty awesome beers on draft that I wanted to try more of.  

All in all this place is awesome! I'd come back again.

What a surprise!

Located between the Mandalay Bay and Luxor, this hidden gem is a must try. 

My friends and I stumbled in here after not being able to decide where to eat...

At the end of the night I think the quorum agreed it was an excellent decision.

After a day and part of the night full of drinking and gambling beer, wings and pizza was it for dinner.  

The wings were tasty, fresh and perfect with the side of ranch.  The Parmesan fries were good too! We shared two types of pizzas, the meat lovers as well as the chicken bbq. Both were delicious and were gone in minutes.

It was easy to decide what type of pizza to share and we all had a good time.

Food is reasonably priced and service is fast surprisingly good considering the time we came in.  

Our large group was seated in the rear where there were a few tvs. There was a display of old matches and old memorabilia/art of historic Vegas which I enjoyed. The place was comfy and accommodating.

If I stay at the Delano again, I wouldn't hesitate to dine here again.

Thanks Slice of Vegas for excellent food, service and pictures... you helped make a quick bachelors party memorable.

Cheers and see you all soon!

Came here specifically to try out the vegan options. I got the personal veggie "faux" pie, which comes with pizza sauce, daiya mozzarella, and various veggies. It was really tasty and they used a good, moderate amount of the daiya. 

Definitely recommended!

4-stars for Happy Hour, otherwise a bit pricey but what in Vegas isn't? $15 for Spaghetti Marinara in a Mall (Yes it's not in the hotel but in the Mandalay Mall) is a bit pricey.  I like NY Style pizza and they have it although the sauce is a bit bland.  Big pieces.  $2.50 a slice for cheese during Happy Hour (min two slices per person) is great plus half off beer and wine. Good service.   It's SO hard to find decent dining at a reasonable price on The Strip. Everything in the hotels (aside from fast food) is SUCH a rip off. This is one of those few places that is attached to Luxor/Mandalay Bay and is decent food at a reasonable price in a good atmosphere. So as a result, I'm giving it 4 stars.

Service: Excellent and efficient, super friendly hostess and servers. 

Menu: a nice variety of salads and pizzas, Plenty of great beers but the best ones are not on tap. Prices are high but its the strip so I guess that is expected. $18 for a 12 inch cheese pizza is kind of ridiculous but again, being that it's in the Luxor, you know you are overpaying to begin with. 

Pizza: pretty damn good. It's not what I normally get, which is traditional cheese NY pizza but this is the type of pizza that is great if you get some toppings. We enjoyed it and would definitely get it again. 

Salad: perfect amount of dressing to veggies. Tasty and fresh.

Overall: if you are in the Luxor this is a good option. Would I go back just to eat here again, probably not. But if I was over this way, I would def eat here again.
Great food. The il Mangino pizza is amazing. Wings and fries super tasty.  Great service and super friendly staff. Will definitely come here again next time I'm in Vegas.

I cannot review the food for this place; however, I have strong opinions about the customer service. My friend, who suffers from celiac, and I went because the online menu advertises a gluten free pizza. We were so excited! Unfortunately, as soon as the server found out my friend has celiac, he told us that they cannot promise the food has not come in contact with the flour in the air from the other pizza crust and there could be cross-contamination.  (This information is also posted on the restaurant menu.) My friend, who does not seem to have issues with trace amounts of wheat, decided it was worth the risk. Before we could start ordering again, the server left the table to get the manager. The manager came back and told us "we do not recommend" people with celiac eat here... and continued with what the server said then simply waited for us to leave. He didn't ask if we understood the risk or if we were ok with this possibility of cross- contamination. We were just excused. Even as I started to explain that we understood and it was ok he just stood there waiting for us to leave. It was so rude. We have been all over vegas and had so many people go out of their ways to make sure we had an amazing experience and felt comfortable eating there. This was such a shock to the experience. He made us feel so uncomfortable and so unwelcome. 
I understand he needs to take care of his restaurant but at the end of the day, he should not be kicking people out because of a health condition. So very unprofessional.

There was a little mix up in the kitchen with our order, but I have to say that our waitress Johnna handled everything great! She was so patient and extremely helpful. All in all it was a good experience :-)

Good pizza, but not at their terrible pricing. Ordered a small BBQ chicken pizza and it was just under 20 bucks and not very big either since it was a small...maybe like 10 inches? We weren't too hungry so it was perfect to split between 2 people as a snack. Service was mediocre but at least we got steady refills on our water. 

The good thing is that they're open late when nearly everything else in Mandalay Place is closed. I would only come here again for happy hour, otherwise this place is way too pricey for what you get. So many other pizza joints you can hit up that have better pizza and more reasonable pricing!

So I came in and had a beer. Same price you would get at any other surrounding establishment. For my food I got the jalapeño Mac and cheese. It was the best. I will swing back before I leave to eat to go home.

The meat pizza was huge and i could not finish it.

It was great to see that this place had vegan options.  The vegan pizza and sandwich were actually very tasty.  Just beware that if you order from the counter, that you must sit at the counter seats.  This was not specified when we ordered so we had to find seating downstairs with tables.
Fun spot at the Mandalay Bay shop strip. We happen to stop in on National pizza day, and had a great time.

Excellent service.  I can't remember his name but he was extremely attentive and accommodating. 

Great happy hour. Pizza by the slice.  
Would like to try the specialty options next time.  They offer sauces other than marinara A+++! 

The calamari was cooked perfectly.

Been here twice now and both times the food was good and tasty.  We had a group of 13 people and ended up with lots of left overs. I recommend this for families with kids and casual dinner night. Food is reasonably priced for Vegas restaurant. Recommend for casual dinner night with the kids.

First of all the service was great, just taking off two stars for the quality of the food. We got the calamari as an appetizer and it was pretty good. It left me with high hopes for the meal. I got the chicken parm and my BF got the meatball sub. My chicken parm was just okay. Came with way too much spaghetti in my opinion. Per my BF the meatball sub was "alright". The portions are large, so come hungry!

Came in here on a Tuesday night and sat at the bar. 
Ordered a Bruchetta as an appetizer.
 It tasted great, except for one thing; it had a large chunk of tin foil inside the garlic. After politely bringing it to the bartenders attention she quickly took it off the plate and threw it away; immediately went, and started speaking to a manager on the other side of the bar.
A few moments later, said manager approaches and casually asks about how the appetizer was, while feigning ignorance. 
After explaining to her about the tin foil she replied that they cook it in tin foil and that it was perfectly normal. 
I told her to make sure it doesn't happen to any other customers as it is "not perfectly normal" 
That was the end of that.  No compensation.  No apologies.  No nothing. Just your typical Las Vegas customer service that we've all grown so accustomed to. 
The bill was around 100$ for 2 drinks an appetizer and two entrées. 
You decide if this is a place you want to eat at.

Fettuccini was okay. Overcharged me by $10. Still trying to get that resolved. Manager and server were nice.
Update:  they straightened out the overcharge issue and sent a nice email to apologize.

Slices are big, I got the pepperoni sausage pizza and it was good! Service was slow though, even though the pizza are pre made and they just heat it back up in their oven. I was the only one in line at the time and after I ordered, waited about almost 10 minutes and was wondering why everyone who was in line after me getting their pizza already. I had to ask and it turns out they forgot about my pizza so had to wait another 5 minutes or so, didn't get a sorry or anything, they just tried to play it off saying they're making it already.

Was really stoked about this place because they have a vegan menu, and eating vegan in Vegas is not an easy task!  We started off with the mild chikun wings and the meatless meatballs. Both were great! The ranch that came with the wings was superb, as was the sauces on the wings and the meatballs. We were literally licking our fingers! Next we got the barbecue chikun pizza which was also delicious. To top it off, a yummy chocolate stout beer and vegan chocolate peanut butter cake with sugar coasted grapes on the side. This was literally to die for. The service at this place was ok, on the mediocre side, but overall we loved it and would definitely come back to try the rest of the menu!

Wow!  Hands down the best pizza I've ever eaten! I travel way too much for work, and I get a chance to eat one of my favorite foods - pizza - in a lot of place, and Slice is the best I've had.  Somehow they've made the normal pizza flavors just pop!  Great atmosphere and very friendly staff.  I would highly recommend Slice.

I want to preface this with the following review to be a combination of both dinner and and after dinner visit for alcohol only. They must be doing something right if we went back two times in the same night, right?

Earlier in the experience I did go for dinner and once again had the hangover pizza. It didn't quite have the same flare as last time so I'm open to trying the meatball sandwich next time since from the previous experience I sampled a meatless meatball and couldn't tell the difference. Not to say that the pizza was bad this time because that's far from the truth as I found the dough very soft and light on the muffin top as I walked away!

Later on after watching Michael Jackson one we decided to come back and mosey up to the bar for some alcoholic hi-jinx. What stuck out was the Italian Creamsicle. It was what I call a sleeper drink because it goes down sweet, but once consumed takes you to an inebriated happy place. The bartender appeared like she was training, but beyond being amazingly beautiful she made sure we were always taken care of. Although the drink sounded fruity on paper with banana liqueur, orange juice, and pineapple juice she made mine a bit more heavy on the rum which I had no complaints about.

I would recommend this for a more quieter paced setting and drink selection was pretty extensive between mixed drinks and otherwise. It was reasonably priced and thankfully not overpriced compared to other places. On a plus you can shell out $14 and get a souvenir glass to take home. Cheesy and touristy in that regard, but at least it's memories nonetheless

I'm a pizza fan and was really excited to discover this restaurant on Yelp! I was even more excited when I saw that there was a deal on restaurant.com. I am all into meat lovers' pizza and I came into this restaurant, already knowing that I was going to order the 12-inch 10-meat pizza. The pizza was okay. I think the choices of the 10 different meats were misjudged. A lot of preserved and salty meat that made my pizza overall, pretty salty. I had to eat it with a side of ranch to get rid of the saltiness. I like that they made thin crust pizzas. For dessert, I got the cannolis, which I really liked! I was here around 6pm on a Friday and the place was 2/3 empty. The waiter was somehow pretty busy and we had difficulty catching his attention several times. Wouldn't go back and would've been disappointed if I actually paid full price and not used my deal. If craving pizza, I would recommend Secret Pizza at the Cosmopolitan. The white pizza is divine there.

Love it! I'm vegan - whole vegan menu with pizza, pasta, salads, sandwiches and dessert! 
My dad is a carnivore and also had a great burger!
Love love love.

Stopped by for lunch during a conference. Was a bit disappointed to be honest. I ordered a water "It's 110 outside" and the waitress seemed miffed, came by every five minutes asking what she could get me from the bar, even after i told her i would just be having the water.

I tried to order a slice of their "10 meat pizza" which i have had previously, and was greatness. I was informed only cheese, pepperoni, or pepperoni and sausage was available by the slice (Name of restaurant is slice). I wanted the jalapeño Mac which i have had previously, so i just went with a slice of pepperoni and sausage, instead of ordering a full 10" 10 meat pizza. 

The Jalapeño Mac was awesome again, it's served in a bread bowl and has bacon. Don't leave without trying it. 

The pizza on the other hand was pedestrian at best. Considering the greatness i remembered of the 10 meat pizza, i was expecting at least a very good slice, but i wouldn't consider it better than any mall pizza stop. 

The questionable service combined with the rather low execution of their namesake "slice" of pizza really hurt the experience.
Good bang for your buck if you are staying in the hotel! The crust has a nice garlic flavor and the pizza was really fresh and hot
AMAZING pizza! Will eat here every time I come to Vegas! White pizza FTW

This will be my favorite pizza place in Vegas. Place is clean. Waitress was awesome very helpful and made sure our drinks were full all the time. A++++ place recommends to all.  Food was delicious. The wings amazing. Pizza oh lord.

Dear Slice of Vegas,
It disheartens me to have to write this letter about the experience myself and 9 of my friends had at your restaurant tonight. 
-Tonight 10 friends of mine all got together to celebrate an upcoming wedding in our group of friends.
-We arrived at Slice of Vegas about 7:45 PM and were promptly seated in your nice back room by no later than 7:55 PM. 
-We were greeted by our waiter who took our drink order and then followed up to take our dinner order with normal service.
-Before ordering we requested our bill to be split about 5 ways, that's just how it is when you are in big groups. 
-When it came time for us to order while ordering we specifically asked for some extra sauce on the side of our meal. 
-All of our meals came out promptly/hot but were delivered by somebody other than our waiter and that's when everything started to go downhill for our group. 
-This is the beginning to when we never saw our waiter again. 
-After 15 minutes of having an empty water cups, and not receiving the extra sauces I requested on the side of my wife and my meal I went out to the main dining area with my wife's and my water cups to be refilled by the bar tender. The bartender wouldn't fill my cups instead she flagged down the original waiter who from the other side of the room shouts "What do you need!" In a disinterested tone. I raised up my two empty glasses of water and approached him, he said he'll bring them to the table, I also requested the sauces that I had ordered with the meal (ranch and marinara). 
-He did then promptly came to the table with 2 waters for us after I did this, and told me the sauces are on their way, but he didn't take the time to ask anybody else if they needed anything (3/4 of the drinks, waters and $2.95 sodas were empty). We still had never had the usual "Did everything come out alright?" that you get, especially when you weren't the actual waiter that handed out the food. 
-After about 7 more minutes of waiting for the sauces (and ¾ of all the food eaten on the table), I approached the main dining room where he looked at me from across the room and shouted again "what do you need!" This time seeming irritated and not caring at all, it was at this exact time the sauces were being delivered by another waiter. 
-We continued to complete our meal, but still had absolutely 0 interaction at our table in the back room with our waiter since we gave him our order at the beginning of the evening. Everybody still had empty drinks and nobody had come by to check up on us.
-After about 20 minutes of us all sitting there, waiting for our checks I had, had enough of this nonsense and talked to the "manager" of the night. I explained to him, verbatim what I just described to you, drinks had never been refilled, sauces didn't come until the meal was practically completed, never seen our waiter again. I asked the manager "Joseph" if he felt the service we had received was "unacceptable". Joseph would not agree/use the word unacceptable, he would transition into saying it's busy, and apologized. I informed him again about the horrible and lack of service that was provided and once again inquired to see if it he felt it was "unacceptable" once again he changed the subject to doing their best and it's really busy. So I inquired as to if this is what service should be like and is expected to be like in this restaurant, because if so I'd like to inform my friends. He said "No, it isn't" so I informed him then it's "unacceptable" isn't it.
-The checks were finally brought out. No nice check folder, just a Hodgepodge of nonsense handing them out willy-nilly. To my frustration, we all found that a 20% gratuity was automatically added to all our checks. This I felt was beyond unacceptable for the amount of service/lack of service rendered for the evening.
-I Approached the manager about it, he said it's company policy and he "can't do anything about it", I explained again all the things we had been through in the evening again (we just had this conversation less than 4 minutes ago) he continued with his story of "it's corporate policy we can't change it" this went on for over 8 minutes until I told him, if that is company policy then we are all paying cash and leaving no tip at all if that is how the company does business. He then finally agreed to remove the tip, but in a last attempt to still do little to nothing about the situation he tried to just take it off my 1 check out of the 5 at the table. I then requested he take it off all 5 of our checks, which he finally did. After this was all said and done we noticed that your waiter had put 2 $.50 sauces on everyone's bills. There was no notification that it was an upgraded charge for sauce, and not everyone wanted sauce or ranch and I guarantee there were more charges for sauces on all our bill than actual sauces were provided to our table which is fraud.

-It was very clear this waiter thought they would automatically get their 20% tip from our t

There aren't a ton of restaurants in Las Vegas that make a conscious effort to be Vegan-Friendly. Slice of Vegas happens to be one - you just have to be okay with paying for it. 

I got a Buffalo Chik'n pizza. I believe they used Gardein for their meats - fine in my book. Delicious, filling, and unique - it had pizza sauce and buffalo sauce which made it a bit different from standard buffalo fare. Definitely passed my meal grading scale, but failed my I'm Cheap scale, $18.95 for 12". Thankfully, there are deals to be had. Just do some Googling. 

Also - Happy Hour is legit! 1/2 off appetizers, wine, and beer from 3-6 M-Th.

My server was great - attentive, friendly, and even suggested another vegan-friendly restaurant, Hussongs Cantina.

All in all - a solid choice for vegans. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas.

Just went once, and once is enough. I had a slice of the veggie pizza. Who knows how long it was sitting there, as I just went to the express side. It was just ok. Pretty tasteless and the crust was really hard and bland. I sat at the bar on the express side, there was a lot of crumbs covering the surface. It wasn't busy so I'm not sure why it hadn't been wiped down. The cashier seemed to be just going through the motions, super average place at best.
Amazing fried ravioli and buffalo edemame! Quick service for a reasonable price, especially with the yelp deal!

I love their special vegan menu with a lot of great options. However, don't attempt to sit to long in the booth or you will be asked to leave even though the place is not even half full and your bill is over $200.

Went for the counter service as a quick thing to grab on my way out of town.

The pizza looked appealing and had that essential layer of grease but fell short of what I'd even consider passable pizza ala Sbarro. (Setting the bar really, really low). 

The cheese, sauce and toppings were all tasty however since the pizza had been setting out and they don't reheat it prior to serving, the cheese got hard and lost its hold onto the crust. 

The crust was the real disappointment though. The crust had no rise and no chew but it wasn't thin crust. It was a dense crust with a thin ring around similar to what I would expect at a high school cafeteria. On top of that the crust was burnt on the bottom, but not in the good way like you'd expect from a Napoletana pizza. This just had a crispy exterior and a light acrid flavor. 

It's not really fair to judge a whole restaurant based on a slice from the counter so take this review with a shaker of salt.

I ordered the vegan bbq chicken pizza, vegan garlic bread, and vegan chocolate cake. The pizza was delicious and just what you would expect. The garlic bread was good, but I wish it was a little more toasted. Now the chocolate cake. This was by far one of the best vegan cakes I've had. That peanut butter frosting was to die for. Even my non vegan friend loved it. Thank you for having vegan options!

This is the Las Vegas spot! Great happy hour, super cheap drinks and 2.50 slices of pizza. What the heck, a diamond! So glad we found this place especially since we have been cashing out this whole trip. Brandon was our server and he was great.  He paced out our apps, salad, and entrees.  He suggested great local draft beers and was super informative about the happy hour menu!  Loved his service and the food was tasty af. If your in the luxor/Mandalay bay area stop in for a cold brew and smiling faces.  High marks!

I came here around lunch time craving pizza. I left mildly disappointed. 
The service was brilliant, all of the TVs showing sports confused me (disclosure, we had been in Vegas for two days at this point, I'm from England, we normally have a maximum of one TV showing the news) and the pizza gave me mixed feelings. 
In the UK I have never experienced a pizza that has a puddle of grease in the middle of it. This pizza tasted absolutely wonderful but you had to hold it up and let the grease drip off of it before attempting to eat it. The portions were also a lot larger than we had expected. Upon finishing both my partner and I felt rather unwell and we had to rush back to our hotel room, there was far too much grease on the pizza and that caused us to feel rather nauseous. 
All in all three stars, after the excess grease had dropped off of the pizza there was a rather pleasant taste to it but after leaving us attached to the toilet for the remainder of the day we weren't too impressed.
I'm not trying to be a jerk. I'm just a bit confused why this place is closed on a holiday weekend on Forth of July at Midnight. I think

Super awesome, especially if you're looking for vegan options in Vegas. They had a whole menu full of specialty items and they were super attentive to our order (ie pointing out that my drink had milk in it when I ordered a vegan pizza to share with my boyfriend). 

The drinks were delicious, the garlic fries and BBQ Chik'n pizza were wonderful, and the service was excellent. I would absolutely come here again next time I'm in Vegas.
We had a personal pizza with pepperoni and meatballs and a pitcher of beer, it was enough for two people. Service was great!

What a cool place to grab a slice, this place Is awesome with tons of tvs playing sports and they have an old timey jukebox. Pizza was amaz-balls!!! I did notice they have a to go window if you don't want to sit down and eat. Will be putting this in my rotation when visiting Vegas.

Ordered appetizers and beer before heading over to shark tank.

Door-to-door, service was awesome! 
Beer selection was fabulous!  
Food arrived in less than 10 min, and was outstanding!
The calamari was super delish, garnished with red and green peppers!

Will definitely return, when we have a full appetite, to check out the pies!

The pizza was adequate: not bad, but definitely not great.

I ordered the garlic bread because some raved about it on Yelp, but after trying it I have no idea why anybody recommended it.  It could have easily been called "greasy bread" instead of "garlic bread".  It was just THIN slices of Italian bread with some garlic butter smeared on it.  It was better if you took some of the fresh garlic provided with it and put it on top.  I ordered it with cheese which I thought would be a sprinkle of cheese, but turned out to be a big glob of cheese on every slice.  My stomach hurt after eating this stuff.

Some of the folks I was with said they accidentally ordered the vegan pizza earlier in the week and said they regretted it.  You are probably better off eating at Burger Bar next door.

My girlfriend and I go to Vegas about twice a year. Once for a family reunion and once just for us . Regardless of the reason or the time for which we go a Slice of Vegas has become a tradition for us. As a vegan I can attest to the amazing selection of vegan friendly menu items, my absolute favorite is their BBQ chicken pizza and of course the vegan chocolate cake . As a vegetarian my girlfriend loves their pasta and Mac N Cheese. This place is an absolute must!
Great food. Cold beers. Who could want anything more?! Our server, Johnna was fantastic. Great experience and convenient to Mandalay Bay casino floor.

It's hard to find a place with good veg options AND good carnivorous options.  This place fits the bill so well we ate here two days in a row.  The entire back page of the menu is vegan yay!  I had the buffalo chik'n ranch pizza which is AMAZING, the bruschetta, and the supreme pizza with big hunks of field roast yum yum.  Hubby had burger and fries both days.  Lots of TV's for watching sports. Real chill atmosphere. Friendly, attentive service.  A little spendy but hey it's Vegas.

One of my favorite hang out in Vegas for a low key meal. Great local beer selection, pizza and wings are great. Plenty of TVs for the games. Wait staff has always been great, provided solid recommendations and prompt service.

Horrible crew tonight...it's like everyone decided to dumb down for Memorial Day weekend. 

Our server with green hair was a bit awkward..."oh I forgot the diet coke...I heard so many water orders...ready to order?" You're joking right? Not even, "let me go grab that real quick." No sense of urgency. 

The gentlemen who brought our food out were nice. 

As we were ready to close the check, to our knowledge we didn't know who was a busser and who was a server...the busser comes over and says "I'll get your server..." My father gives a confused look...and then a lady comes over and says "I'll take care of that...(death stare to our table)." And then she states "he can't handle the checks he's a busser...AND! He's my son!" Like you have shirts to differentiate what your job is...

Last I checked, it's a place of business...him being your son has nothing to do with it. Business is business..."he's my son" BS!

Seriously awesome pizza ! Try the Il Mangino ! It's freakin awesome . Totally boss service and just as tubular staff. Their specialty drinks are to die for and the garlic bread comes with A REAL CLOVE OF GARLIC !!!
Big slice for $5. The pepperoni was good- lots of flavor, wide, flat slices. The crust was thin and crisp. I would've preferred more sauce but I enjoyed this pizza
The pizza is a little on the expensive side but still pretty good. The pizza crust is probably the winning point. If staying at the Mandalay Bay stop by and give it a try.

One of the worst slices of pizza I've ever had.  The dough was dry and gritty, the sauce was none existent and toppings tasted days old.  I should have taken a picture.  You could tell when they brought it out that the meal wasn't going to be pleasant. I would not recommend ordering by the slice.  Iced tea was weak, lacking any tea taste and lemonade had a zing like it was mixed with Tang(yes the orange powder drink)

Full disclaimer, we did not complain to any of the staff.  We just chocked down as much as we could, paid and left.

It's our first day in Vegas and we're Vegan. Of course, we were starving after we got off the plane. And since we were staying at Mandalay Bay, this was a no brainer! Tried the Garden Faux Pie and Not Your Mamma's Garlic Bread. The "cheese" replacement on the pizza was so freaking good! I'll definitely go back. I also loved the garlic that came with the bread. The server said it's deep fried.
Worst pizza i've ever had. Even pizza hut (which sucks) is better than this. We didn't even want the leftovers. My girlfriend which likes most places hated it. Save yourself. You've been warned.
If you're Vegan you GOTTA check this place out. They have a full vegan menu of Pizzas, pastas, salads. sandwiches and desserts which include an AMAZING Cheesecake! Worth the trip!

We originally wanted to eat next door, but there was a 30 minute wait so we popped over to Slice of Vegas.  Friendly staff, fun setting and really good food!  Almost forgot to check in and unlock the free garlic parm fries and that would have been a travesty because they were delicious and not something I would normally order with a pizza.  We also got the garlic bread with cheese.  The roasted garlic bulb that came with it was amazing.  The pizza was very good as well.  I'm all about the crust and it was just the right amount of thick and thin (in fact, I was eating the leftover crusts off my husbands plate).  Overall, great lunch spot.

If you are a vegan in Vegas, you should eat here. It is located in the Shoppes in Mandalay Place. We always have great service and they have awesome music playing on the restaurant juke box, BUT when 2 salads and 2 drinks total up to over $50 with tip, it just leaves a bad taste in your mouth. BEST ADVICE: come during happy hour and eat off that menu. Otherwise, it is wayyyy overpriced for a pizza place. The vegan chick'n wings are good and reminiscent of cafeteria chicken Mcnuggets. My sister, the vegan, likes the meatless meatball sub with fries. For the non-vegan food, the Caprese salad is delicious, but adding some extra protein will cost you - a lot. I really wasn't that impressed with the pizza, and none of us ordered it again after our first visit. Overall, lots of options for vegans but with a hefty price tag.
Delicious 10 meat pizza served by the lovely Johnna, great quality in both crust and meat and great service! Recommend!

As mentioned many times in reviews, Slice of Vegas is overpriced for what you get. The environment is fun and welcoming. It would be great for a group of friends and they have TV's  all over so you can catch a game from any seat in the place. The hostess was friendly. The server was nice but seemed to be robotic in his approach. 

It was not very busy when I dined here and service was mostly prompt. TV's were everywhere but the volume was not too loud so you can easily have conversations with your group while dining and watch the games. 

The pizza was very good, NOT great but very good. Ordering a small (12') will set you back $20. It is good but not at all worth that price even being in Mandalay Place. The cocktails were well made. The presentation was weak but the flavor was perfect. The What's 6" and hard  is cucumber Efiin and very refreshing. The Mob-a-rita is an Italian Margarita and also quite nice, They do pour a little heavy handed but the balance is still nice for the cocktails. $14 for cocktails and they are about 10 ounces. 

The concept is good, the atmosphere is fun and the food is pretty good. The cocktails were the star but when considering the price of everything I can't give it more than 3 stars. It is nice to grab a bite before a show at the House of Blues or if you are shopping but it is not worth making a special trip to check out.  Much better in concept than reality.

I discovered Slice on a recent 5 day trip to Vegas.  I went there 3 times.  Since The Strip is primarily a meat eaters paradise full of overpriced tourist traps, I was particularly thrilled to find Slice as a reasonably affordable vegan & vegetarian option.    

Their roasted cauliflower is served in a cast iron skillet and is drenched in an amazing pesto sauce.  It is an amazing appetizer.

The Titan Veggie Burger was delicious.  The black bean patty was tasty and the "secret" sauce was a nice touch.  

The pizza was just the way I like it - thin crust, not greasy, with a good sauce.  I had a basic cheese & mushrooms pizza.  My wife had the vegan pizza with shredded daiya which she gave two thumbs up to.  Sometimes places put too much daiya on vegan pizzas, but this one had just the right amount.

To top it all off, they have a top notch beer selection.  Lots of wonderful west coast craft beer choices.

The servers and bartenders were very friendly, which was a departure from most of the other places I visited in Vegas during this trip.

They are located in the Mandalay Bay Shoppes.  Check 'em out!
Great service and good food.  Great happy hour items too.  Can't get enough of the cauliflower and truffle parmesan fries. They are my favorite.
We usually go to this place when we are in town. Love the food especially the meatball appetizer. The staff is super friendly too.  Love to sit at the bar and chat with the bartenders

Wow ! Such an amazing experience!! My server Allisha was sweet and knowledgeable. It was our first visit so she helped us choose some stuff on the menu and everything was very yummy she suggested (compliments to the chef!) She was pretty busy when we were there but never lacked attentiveness or professionalism at any time the fact that she was busy didnt even seem to bother her. The atmosphere is pretty cool here and a great option for a fun pizza place with the family. Super happy we chose to eat here for dinner! If you try it out ask for Allisha to be your server and tip her well she deserves it !! Thank you Allisha and Chefs at Slice of Vegas !

I hosted a group of 20 here on just a few hours notice.  I was transferred to their sales manager who handled the details efficiently and made the whole process completely stress free for someone not used to organizing events.  The servers and manager at the restaurant were just great.  I had to increase the guest count from 15 to 25 and order more food which was taken care of efficiently and with smiles.  Because this was a business event and I couldn't cover drinks, we had to have individual drink tabs which made things more difficult for the staff.  They handled it smoothly and without a hint of annoyance.  The food was great too.

With literally hundreds of fine dining establishments within a few minutes walk of this place, why would one go to a pizza joint jammed into a mini-mall in the walkway between Luxor and Mandalay Bay?  In short, cuz the food is damn good. 

Minimal wait and more reasonable prices than the casino/resorts for a satisfying dining experience.

Shoestring fries with Parmesan garlic and garlic aioli was very tasty.  I had a meatball sub with a side of marinara sauce and my wife had the pasta Alfredo with shrimp. Food was okay but nothing spectacular. Service was decent but nothing out of the ordinary. Server refilled our drinks a couple of times and asked how everything was. The shocker was when we got the bill and there was a mandatory 18% tip already added although it was just my wife and I. I don't have a problem adding a service charge for groups of 5 or more but for 2 people. Plain ridiculous. What's worse is there is a line for additional tip on the bill. Not coming back again. Would not recommend to my friends.

I was definitely impressed by Slice of Vegas' vegan menu. I had the meatless meatball pizza and, while certainly not revolutionary, it was tasty. Although the music was a little loud, the restaurant was clean and well-decorated, and we had excellent service. Overall I was pretty happy with my experience.

We used a restaurant.com coupon which made a great experience better. The offering of beverages both alcoholic and non-alcoholic was large. They had a great suggestions of combo pizza, pasta, and sandwiches, but then you could build your own of all these offerings. They also had gluten free, vegetarian, and vegan options. This flexibility creates a great place for picky eaters. The atmosphere was fun and lively and the shirts offered for sale were hilarious. 

The family size pizza was good for 2, not sure it would feed 4. The individual feeds 1 nice size adult. The bowls of pasta are substantial and the add ins were worth it. There was enough protein and added veggies to have with your last bite of pasta.

Will be returning for great thin crust pizza.

This pizza is a thin crust that is fantastic! I am not gluten-free but my best friend is and she ordered a fantastic pepperoni pizza and I could not tell the difference! Also the manager came out in and asked if we had any requests, we wanted gluten free beer which is Estrella Damm Daura, a gluten-free beer, so we had of beer pizza party on site! Thank you Andy and crew!! Capital awesome!

Food was very tasty. My wife had a personal pizza with 2 toppings and I had pasta with meatballs. Both were done very well. A little expensive though. With 2 non alcoholic drinks the bill was about $46. Luckily we had a restaurant.com certificate. Would certainly eat here again, preferably with another certificate though.
Pretty darned good pizza, and at a price that allows you to still walk away with some cash in your pocket. I like getting a quick slice here while walking by.

We came here on a Groupon. We ordered a curry pizza, margarita pizza and rosemary garlic fries. Curry wasn't that great, but margarita was good. Lots of TVs. Good beer selection. It is located inside of the Shops of Mandalay Bay
 
Would we go back without a Groupon? Probably not. It was pretty good though, but there are so many place to eat in Vegas.

Great pizza at Mandalay bay shops area between Mandalay bay and the Luxor. Get it by the slice or s whole pie. You can even bill it to your room. Staff was attentive and friendly. Price point is not over priced for Vegas. I ate here a couple times and both times it was great!
It's not too expensive, but the food isn't good.  I just had a take out order, so I can't speak to the ambiance of the dine in experience.  The staff all seemed friendly.

This was my second time here (first time being the same time last year) The service started off a little spotty at first but got much better as the evening progressed. Everyone had different items but I had the roasted cauliflower and a side salad as my meal. The roasted cauliflower was quite flavorful for a pizza place and I wish I had ordered another one. My friends Salmon left something to be desired however and we sent back the first one as it was way over cooked. The second one came out better but we learned our lesson, do not order a fish dish at a pizza place even i they advertise it. All in all, everyone else seemed to enjoy the rest of there meals and drinks. I am sure that when I  am back in Vegas again for work, I will be heading up to slice for either pizza or just the roasted cauliflower.

First of all the food was bland, and took forever, the service was absolutely terrible I saw our waitress twice in an hour and we had to ask for a soda refill and what really toped it off they take it upon themselves to charge a %18 tip automatically,and so I now know why she didn't care she knew she was getting a tip regardless, I would not recommend this place to anyone unless its free, but the bar tenders seemed ok but giving an %18 tip to someone that barely earned there pay for that day really made my stomach turn!

Stopped by for a slice only.  It was the last cheese slice in the display.   So.....who knows how old that slice was.   But......i review 'em as I get 'em.

Wasn't impressed. Crust was hard.  Cheese was average at best.   I didn't like the sauce. It seemed a bit too heavy on herbs.    Also, 15 seconds after I placed my order, a fresh cheese pie came out.  Why wouldn't they have given me a fresh slice????? At $5.25 for a slice of cheese piazza,  they should have.

Service was average. Asked server for water 3xs. Asked for ranch with the pizza we ordered and still had to ask again when pizza arrived. Pastas are bomb. Meatballs taste great on the spaghetti and meatballs.

Stopped in here while in the Casino and I was shocked to see a full vegan menu! Our server was great, and we didn't realize we walked in right before close but she insisted we stay. I shared the personal size vegan BBQ chicken pizza with a friend. There was plenty for us both and it was about $18.50. Pretty steep, but it was great. My stomach kind of hurt after, but thats because I don't eat pizza very much. I would go back.
Stay away from the sliders and meatballs.  Nothing like food poisoning to ruin a perfectly good Vegas trip.

Stopped by for lunch after sitting at the pool all morning. Honestly just hoping for even a decent slice in the middle of the desert but the waitress Bianca had a great personality and recommended the il Mangino. Not the type of pizza I would normally order but turned out to be really good. I should knock off a star because the water they brought us tasted TERRIBLE but their solid selection of craft beers (~20) made up for it.

After checking in at Mandalay Bay, we decided to grab some food before heading out for the night. Slice of Vegas is located in the Shoppes at Mandalay Place, which is connected to the hotel and casino, and is perfect for a casual, quick, bite to eat.

My cousin and I ended up sharing the chicken wings ($9.95) in the medium sauce which was really good. I'm not usually a fan of wings but I loved these! We also made our own pizza and ordered a 12 inch pepperoni pizza for $14.95 and added mushroom for $1.95. The pizza was pretty standard but hit the spot. 

If you are looking for a quick bite or a place to relax after drinking and spending time in the casino, Slice of Vegas is perfect. Also, the pizza is good for hangovers ;)

Exactly what the doctor ordered.  Good pizza, great service, casual atmosphere.

Went twice in three days!
Expensive but decent thin crust pizza. Good bartenders. 3 cheese with truffle oil was good. Good stop between convention center and Luxor

My boyfriend and I had a really good experience here. From the moment we were seated to the moment we left, everything was good. Our server was very friendly and would constantly check in. We received our food in a very good timely manner and the servings were bigger then we expected. Everything tasted amazing from the salads, pizza and pasta. I have no complaints and would recommended this restaurant to friends and family who are looking for an affordable Italian meal.

Great food and great service. Michelle was very attentive. Food was delicious. The caprese salad was delicious and unique...the gluten free pizza was very good. Love their pizza sauce. The only downer was they have Pepsi products...

Went by store after manager said he fixed advertising $3 slices after 3pm.  Found out he again misrepresented the promotion. This place is just not to be trusted I guess. Thought he was sincere but wrong. Beware of misleading advertising.  Suggest walking on by this one.

Have gone here a couple times now and will continue to make this my go to spot for pizza when in vegas. The pizza is good place is clean and the beer is cold what more could you want. Oh 5.00 beers in a bucket of 5
For what is basically a restaurant in a mall, this place isn't bad. The meatball appetizer was great and my gluten free penne with pesto was pretty good as well.

The 5 stars are for the buffalo edamame (omg, seriously?? Too die for!!), the dirty spicy martini and Melissa's service. I can't even comment on the cheese pizza slice after that fab edamame (also garlic and bleu cheese crumbles and ranch? Who cares, so good!) as I stopped eating it to inhale the edamame. Ha! Delish! Service was fast and super nice! #fatkidhappiness
Food was really good, service was just a little slow but the food was still really good! If you don't mind a little wait, definitely worth it for the food!
Over priced for what you got.  Didn't see the slices only until we ordered that might have been better.  Very disappointed.  Also $6 for a soda is outrageous.

Mike was our waiter, and by far the most personable I have ever experienced at Slice of Vegas.  From the time we sat down until the time we left, Mike provided nothing but a warm welcoming atmosphere, was prompt to our attention and periodically checked up to make sure we were satisfied.  The food is what you would expect, pizzas, pastas, and various Italian-inspired dishes.  If you come expecting Olive Garden quality, you'll be pleasantly surprised.  Personally, the food at Slice tastes much more fresh and has better quality / portions for what you pay.  At the back, there is a page full of gluten-free options, which has lots of options.  Mlife users, be sure to save your receipt and take it to the Mlife desk for your tier credits!  There is a $69.99 challenge of finishing a Double stack 18" pizza in under an hour.  All terms and conditions are listed in the menu which is nice.  They leave a comment card in the check billfold, which allows you to give feedback right then and there.  For those who are looking for a quick bite, they have a separate counter to the right of the restaurant where you can simply purchase a slice of pizza and take it to go.  No pastas or entrees served from this area.  Highly recommended for anyone looking for quality pizza or various menu items.

Great staff.  Great food. Good variety on the menu.  Comfortable seating. Conveniently located between Mandalay Bay and Luxor. I recommend it! 

I travel to Vegas twice a month and this place is worth visiting every time.

Went during off-peak season and I'm so glad I did.

It was happy hour from 3-6 pm so select appetizers were half-off as well as wine and beer selections. Servings were massive and the price was so cheap!

We got the buffalo edamame, garlic bread (with real garlic infused), sweet potato fries, a slice of cheese pizza and wine. 1/5 of the way in, I was already stuffed and ready to call mercy.

Staff is super friendly. It's a bit unfortunate that during off-peak season while we were there, there were maybe 2 or 3 other parties.

3.5. Located in the shops that connect Mandalay Bay and Luxor, Slice of Vegas has some good points:

1. They sell by the slice as well
2. They have a Happy Hour that runs during the work week.

Other than that, Slice of Vegas would probably be my dinner pick based off of sheer convenience for when I'm being utterly lazy and don't want to walk too far to go anywhere. It really wouldn't be my first, second, or third pick for pizza on the Strip but gets the job done when you are in need. It's not bad pizza, just a greasy knife-and-fork pizza that doesn't leave any lasting impressions of pizza happiness in your mind. (Pin Up Pizza does for me!)

Kudos to these guys for a Yelp discount. As always, expect Strip pricing for anything here, so pricing seems exorbitant for the pizza quality that you get here. Stop by if you are on your death bed from hunger and need a pick-me-up before the next activity on your to-do list.

Have eaten here twice during vegas trips, and it has been great both times! Prices are pretty high ($11 for a salad, $19 for a "personal pizza", $10 for bruschetta). But the personal pizza is large enough to split, so we paid around $45 for an app, pizza and beer.

Very disappointed with the Margarita Pizza. My 9 year old couldn't eat it. Super bland with more sauce than cheese. Not worth $30 for an 18-inch. Since when does a kid spit out pizza?! Caesars salad was bland too. The only tasty item were the garlic fries. Disappointed with this choice.

Located next door to Burger Bar inside Mandalay's shopping area, Slice is a large eatery with full bar, several televisions and a varied menu.

Service was prompt and friendly as there was quite a few servers working for early Saturday lunch shift.  Slice offers, pizza's, pasta, sandwiches, salads and burgers.  We tried a burger and a Philly cheese steak sammie.  Both entree's came with choice of sweet potato or regular fries.  We both got sweet potato fries and the portions were huge!  Both of our sammies were well cooked big and flavorful not to mention the prices were considerably cheaper than Burger Bar.  

One cool item we noticed was the big glass beer taps you can order and have placed on your table or in front of you at the bar.  Basically at least a yard size glass tube with its own tap on the bottom so you can pour your own glass, totally cool.

I strongly recommend trying this place if your stuck in Mandalay and want to eat some place good but still affordable.

I can't believe that I came to a pizza place and I didn't order any pizza! My friend and I shared an order of the not your mamma's garlic bread. I loved the pesto spread and the roasted glove of garlic. I had a garden salad which was filled with all the regular ingredients- tomatoes, cucumber, red onions, etc. It was almost big enough to be shared. I am a part time vegan so I was excited to see all the options on the menu. 
Service was friendly. There were plenty of seats for an intimate time or a big group of friends. TVs at the bar to keep you up to date on scores. There is a To Go section as well.

We were attending a comedy show the other night at house of blues and we decided to give this book mark a try;) so so so glad we did! 

  It's Located right next to the burger bar in the shoppes area of Mandalay bay. We made a reservation on yelp and were seated promptly. 

  Our server, Johanna was very helpful. We had a restaurant.com coupon (yes, check them out because they are on there)! She informed us of what we needed to spend ($37.50) and went on to take our drink order. My boyfriend ordered the absolute gimlet (it sounded good, but it wasn't) and we had to send it back. We offered to pay for it, but Johanna had no problem replacing it. We decided to play it safe and just order a bottle of Pinot noir. Their wine prices on bottles are fair and they carry some very drinkable brands;) 

  The food... Oh my gosh! We ordered off the vegan menu (yes I said menu)! We opted for the almond pesto cauliflower, truffle sweet potato fries, and a vegan veggie pizza. Everything came out pretty quickly. Seasoned to perfection and generous portion sizes, everything tasted amazing. I can honestly say I can't find one thing to complain about. Their vegan dessert menu looked great (vegan zeppollis! Chocolates cake with pnb frosting!! Ny cheesecake!!!) but we just couldn't fit anything in. We figure it's just another very good excuse to come
Back. 

  They have a happy hour mon-thurs from 3-6pm. Apps are half off and we were informed that their house wines were cheaper than a soda! By far one of our new go to's when we are on the strip!!
Tyler out server provided a lot of help and great service in helping me select gluten free vegan items. Fyi the small pizza is for one person (common).
Really good pizza. Their crust is done right and both the garden and bbq chicken pizza were great. We ordered the Caesar salad as well and it was very good. Good casual eats in Mandalay.

If this place isn't overrated - I'm not sure what is.

I'll start by saying that I was inclined to try Slice of Vegas because of a Groupon.  As a local - it's always entertaining to spend a few hours on a Friday night at the Strip - looking at all tourists so we figured we could be entertained AND eat for cheap.
 
Neither one of is drinks alcohol on any regular basis so cocktails were not in the mix so thererefore cannot comment on prices. 

We started our night with about a 15 min wait for a table - which really wasn't so bad.  The staff seemed friendly so I will give them a + in that department aside from the fact that our waitress was a bit peeved that I only ordered water with lemon.  As someone who tries to pay attention to the calories that I put into my body - I don't normally drink soda or juice and I'm sorry but I'm not paying $2.75 or $2.95 for water that had a Lipton tea bag in it .  There are a lot of things that I spend a lot of money on but I'm not going to be ripped off when I don't even want the item.  Had she not been peeved - she would have gotten our standard 20-25% tip. 

As far as food - we ordered an antipasto app - I think it was about $11.95.  It was decently sized and had a good amount of taste but I think I'm just spoiled coming from back east.  I'm used a really hearty platter when I get an antipasto.  I am also looking for more meat and cheese in Vegas and it seems no one gets it right. In addition to the antipasto - we ordered a 12" meat lovers pizza.  It too was tasty and I will say that it was MUCH tastier than Grimaldi's (who everyone raves about) but seriously - damn near $20 for a 12 inch pizza and $30 for a large .. You have to be joking.  There is no way in hell that I would EVER pay $30 for 16 inch pizza - I don't care what's on it. 

So - all in all - for a tourist walking thru the Shoppes at Mandalay Bay dying for pizza - more power to you.  For a local - don't waste your money.  There are plenty of places in town with mediocre pizza for less money.

The pepperoni slice and Caesar Salad I had there were terrific!  Tasted like NYC slices - kudos to the kitchen.

The bartender was very friendly; service was fast, and the prices were just right!

Had a great experience here with a large group of 13 people.

Fantastic service. Very attentive and prompt.  

Food is good for the prices.  Not fine dining, but the prices are reasonable.

They honored a Yelp check-in coupon for a group of 13!  Was very pleased about that.

4 stars!
The best italian food ever.....the buffalo greek pizza on the vegan menu is mind blowing, other dishes we ordered were  great too and the staff is amazing.....fantastic experience and a must visit!!!

I am giving Slice of Vegas only 3 stars for the simple reason that I got food poisoning somewhere during my stay at the Mandalay Bay and this was one of the places I ate.  I will say, I liked the food better than that and would probably give it 4 stars if I didn't get sick.

I really enjoyed the bruschetta which included tomato bruschetta, olive tapanade, roasted garlic and Italian white beans.  It was really yummy and a nice size portion.  I also had the make your own pasta and got it with mozzarella cheese, pomodoro sauce and artichokes.  I also ordered it with mushrooms but they forgot to add those in and brought them to me on the side.

The service was ok but it was not busy while we were there.  Overall, I liked this place for lunch but not sure if it was there that got me sick.  I will say, I am leaning towards the buffet...

Friendly staff. Great food and fast service. Had a 12" supreme pizza and shells florentine. Great portion. Hit the spot. This location is in the between the Mandalay and luxor. They have a full bar. Lots of alcholic beverage to choose from. Music playing and also lots of T.V.

I came back with kids and sat at the Restaurant this time, and not the To Go counter.  It was much much better.  Calamari was good (ask for marinara on the side).  Pizza and sandwiches were solid as well.  Would be 4 stars as a stand alone, but I can't forget the terrible pizza by the slice.

I think this place is just ok. Their ratings definitely reflect it. Had a slice of their cheese pizza and it was just ok. It wasn't the best, but it wasn't the worst either. It's a big slice. Flavoring and freshness was ok. Kinda just ate here as a grab and go casual type of place. Their slices of pizza was sitting out in the counter, so it was an easy meal. There aren't that many dining options in this part of the Strip. I really did like that if you do carryout, they give you a whole pizza box for just a slice. Makes it easy to carry around.

I wasn't sure what to expect, but it all worked out just great. Laid-back atmosphere, very friendly staff, great selection of local beers, and most impressively, a full vegan menu!! Thank you thank you for being so accommodating & delicious.

Kind of disappointed with this pizza. It's, in my opinion, not worth the price. My wife and I love pizza and we had a crazy craving for a slice. Decided to check this place out before a show and while we didn't mind paying the price, we were less than satisfied with the flavor. It lacked any flavor and didn't really leave us with that "We definitely have to come back for more" feeling. The sauce was meh, the dough was slightly better. I can see how people would think it was amazing if they were drunk, because well they're drunk, but I wouldn't recommend it to any pizza lover who just wanted a good pie.

Their pasta was good! My coworker was obsessed with their pesto and she said she could eat that every day lol. I had tried their baked salmon angel hair with the thin slice of bread. It's a bit greasy, but just like how most pastas are, at least the flavor was very good. I then went there a second time and got the building your own pasta to get it to $30 so I could use the Yelp deal. It was also delicious!

It's on the lower side of budget for a restaurant inside a hotel because they give you big portions. I sampled a few bites of other dishes as well and they all tasted good.

Service was friendly and prompt too. 

Honestly I had lower expectations for a place like this inside the hotel, but I have to say I was pleasantly surprised!

I'd come back if I'm craving some pasta and is in Mandalay Bay.

*** Don't forget to buy the Yelp deal! It's almost like 50% off! (Limited one per table though.)

Went towards closing knowing that there slices might be old I ordered a new full pie for $28!  Well only eat one sliced it was disgusting. Some of the worst pizza I've ever had. It's barely even worth five dollars.  Well the pizza dough tasted bland and burnt.  Topping where not high quality at all.  The only times I have bad pizza was, straight out of the fridge, Pizza Hut and Dominoes.

I went here because of the four stars on yelp but I was mistaken.

My colleague and I approached the hostess stand well after 10pm when the restaurant was closing at 11pm. We were greeted with welcoming smiles and seated quickly, which is rare when a restaurant is about to close. The menu had changed since my last visit but they still accommodated my request even though it wasn't an option anymore. My waitress was pleasant and very attentive. Then all of a sudden you could see a lot of movement of the staff and the gate of the restaurant went down. That's when I noticed something was wrong but the staff appeared cool, calm and collected. I asked "are we locked in here?" They provided us with all of the information they knew and said we were on lock down due to a shooting. The news will tell you the details of the attack, but I will tell you the details of my experience at Slice of Vegas. 1) the manager Joe was on top of things 2) I truly felt like we were in the safest place in the casino as other establishments kicked their guests out into the chaos 3) The establishment did not charge anyone for their meals because their priority was our safety 4) They offered their employee restroom to us so we wouldn't be in any danger or have to leave 5) They stayed with us the entire time even when they had access to their personal vehicles during a terrorist attack they stayed ensuring we made it to safety. The owner and other high level staff came to the scene and assisted the police department in making sure we were safe and could get home risking their lives for their customers. Never have I had a more positive or memorable dining experience. I will return to tip the staff and Slice of Vegas will forever have a spot in my heart.

A great place to come if you're looking for a slice of pizza and a brew. We got a make your own which the crust had the right amount of chewy and the toppings were delicious. We got a make your own, and it did not disappoint. Fast prompt help and service .Service was great and we had a great time. The entertainer was amusing. Would come back again for some pizza and brews!

Party of 8 4 kids and 4 adults, reservation was a cinch. Was greeted with very friendly staff. Food was awesome, everything was.actually great! These people really are good at what they do and they don't even have to work to hard for it coz they're just great at what they do!

They have a full vegan menu on the back page of the menu. I went with their cauliflower alfredo with Gardien chicken. So yum and creamy and garlicky that I could have licked the bowl clean, but I didn't. But I do wanted to! 

Great for eating alone at, they gave me a full booth. Had a sports bar vibe.

Great service and food. Happy Hour prices and selection of appetizers is awesome.
Portions are big. Definitely going back. Bartender was friendly and attentive.

We went to Slice of Vegas last time we were staying at Mandalay Bay.  I was really happy to see they had a vegan menu.  It's not often that you can find great vegan food and great regular food and keep everyone happy.  So this was perfect for my family.  I had the meatless meatball sub which is served with a side salad and then I ordered a vegan chocolate cake to go and it was all excellent!  My family enjoyed their meals as well and we all agreed we would like to return next time we are in town and I will have to try the vegan pizza.
Loved this place, the pizza was on point, service was top notch and they have a great beer selection

Stopped for a quick slice of pizza and a beer, that's what I call lunch in Vegas! It's located in the passage from Luxor to Mandalay and you can't miss the picture and smell of pizza as you pass by. for $4.50 you get a slice with cheese on it and then you build your own pizza using whatever ingredients on the list for like $0.50 each. Pretty large selection of beers and a lot of TVs if you want to watch some sports. They will constantly ask you if just 1 slice is enough for you - don't fall for that, the slices are pretty loaded, you won't fell hungry for the rest of the day!
Real good pizza.  My mom loved the titan veggie burger.  A little expensive or I would give it a 5.

Slice of Vegas has a lot of vegan options (a full page of the menu) that range from appetizers, salads, pizzas, sandwiches and pasta dishes so you will surely find something here if your vegan and hungry. This location is located inside Mandalay Bay, in their forum shops across from the Lush store. This is a bar restaurant and they have tons of tvs so you can watch whatever sports games you desire, but it is a loud environment so take that into consideration before you bring grandma down here, unless she likes to party. Haha 
We decided on the fries with vegan ranch and ketchup, the vegan garlic bread, and the vegan BBQ "chicken" pizza to share. The fries were the skinny cut fries but cooked perfectly and not overly salted. The garlic bread was served with a full head of roasted garlic on the side to smear over the bread which was toasted perfectly and had a pesto spread on top. The BBQ chicken pizza was actually delicious even though daiya cheese is not our favorite, the crust was crispy but not burned, the onions and the micro basil on top made the pizza. Our server was awesome, attentive but not overly annoying and even though she was busy, we had all we needed. This was a great place to discover while out and about. They also have happy hour from 3-6 so half price appetizers!!

Got the BBQ pizza special and some soup. The soup was very yummy. loved it!

The pizza was nothing special IMO and i was starving. But we got a groupon for it and it was the cheapest lunch choice for us on the strip.

oh and tried some of my brother's cajun fries. they were pretty good.

This place has a nice atmosphere. It's good that they have a menu for vegan/vegetarian but... The food is not good. The pastas have a sauce that contains Flour and water. No spice at all and just basically bland food. Really nice staff and hospitality!

The pizza and calimari are to die for! Best calimari I ever had, full of flavor. And the drinks are nice and strong! A little on the expensive side for pizza, but worth every penny! Oah and there is free valet parking

This place was OK. $30 for a whole pizza. Service was slow to get seated when there were plenty of booths open. Service was also slow to get the check. Both were annoying because we needed to get going. The first time I went here was just to get a slice of pizza and service was fast. I think I will do that next time if I go there.
Pizza new York style. Service is not so hot. Beware they bring all food at same time. Vegan items were pretty good.Locals beware Mandalay bay charges $7 for parking! No validation.

There seems to be some sort of hype around Las Vegas pizza joints this month, Slice of Vegas included, so my Mom and I decided to try this one out.

There was a small wait when we arrived because the place was actually pretty busy, which in my book is usually a good sign. My mom can't eat dairy products due to a food allergy, so she was asking the manager if they had a Vegan cheese they could put on the pizza. The manager actually went to the kitchen and came back with a piece of what she called "tease" cheese for my mom to try to see if she liked the taste before she ordered a pizza covered in it. Mom claimed it was the best Vegan cheese she has ever tasted.

We were seated and the waiter came up right away and took our drink and food order. He was a nice guy, but it was so busy that he forgot the drinks, so we flagged down another waiter to bring them for us. 

We ordered a 10-meat pizza and a dish of Pappardale pasta with spicy marinara sauce. Both of the items we ordered were excellent! The pizza had a nice thin crust and wasn't overloaded with toppings to the point where you couldn't pick it up...it was perfect! Plus, they made half of the pizza with the vegan "tease" cheese and the other half with Mozzarella, so Mom and I could both enjoy it :) The pasta had a great flavor as well, and though it wasn't the best pasta I've ever had, it was pretty damn good.

To top it off, I had a cannoli for dessert, which was just about average :)

My major gripe with this place is the SUPER inflated prices. I understand that we're on the Strip and everything is more expensive, but $18.95 for a 12-inch pizza is pretty outrageous. The pasta dish was $14.95 and the cannoli was $6.95. Way too pricey, although the food was good and the staff were extremely nice...especially the manager!

Vegan offerings include gooey pizza and the best chocolate cake ever!

Also, there is a giant cocktail bowl for 4 normal people--or enough for me and a date :)

They have a fun setup with the menus on cans that double as pizza stands. I brought the whole family and the kids loved the zeppoli!

It was somewhat busy but there was no trouble seating our party of four for dinner.

Meh. Nothing memorable about the food though except that the meatball sandwich was bland. The mozzarella cheese and the sauce didn't do much for it. The sprinkling of parmesan helped but there still wasn't much flavor. The spaghetti with meatballs was insipid and lifeless too. 

Service was okay and the food did come out quick, but please do something about the flavor of the food.

Forget all the glitz of the strip when you decide where to go to get pizza in Vegas. I mean Wow. We ordered the meatball appetizer and the build your own pizza.  Both were awesome!  This is some of the best crust we have had on a pizza in a long time.

This was OK pizza, we ordered the 10 meat specialty pizza and it was super salty; the crust was perfect though.  I ended up scraping most of the topping off to cut the salt and then it was edible...the waitress knew it was salty, she brought us water and told us a story about her 10 meat pizza experience, I wish she would have warned us. The restaurant had a great sports bar atmosphere and our waitress was attentive.

The staff and service was fantastic! The pizza is above average but a bit pricey for what you get. My wife had dirty silverware and I had a dirty plate which got exchanged for another dirty plate...seems like the dishwasher should be fired.
Great experience @ Slice of Vegas!  Thank you for offering gluten free pizza!!!  Delish!  We'll be back!

So happy we found a great place to feed hungry kids after a long day at the pool.  Perfect spot when you are staying at the Mandalay Bay hotel. Johna was our server - she was great.  Had to wait a little so she gave the kids pizza dough to keep them entertained.  We ordered a Caesar salad to share and family size half pepperoni and cheese. Garlic parmesan fries came free with check-in (score!). Food was really good. When ordering the Caesar, my niece tasted something crunchy so she asked if there were any nuts because she has an allergy. Johna assured us there were none. Later when we ordered the cannoli for dessert, she remembered my niece's food allergy! They come with pistachios. So thankful she was paying attention, I did not notice.

Definitely recommend trying this place out!!
Great pizza joint that is great for families. Beer specials are only $4. We had an 18 inch pizza for $30 and it was enough to feed our family of four.

It was a Sat. evening, so it was pretty busy. First time here, so unfamiliar with the rules of this place. They have two sides...A takeout side when you order and seat yourself and a side where you are seated and then order.

We ordered a slice of pizza from the takeout side..not really thinking...and after deciding we would rather sit at a table...we waited to be seated. After being seated we informed the hostess that we ordered from the togo side, wherein we were told by a manager I'm guessing (who was very pleasant) we would have to order more food if we wanted to sit at a table. Okay, not a problem :) let's do it...and she left.

Then the waitress came over and ...if looks could kill...we would be dead...lol. She was extremely rude and refused to hear the fact that we were going to order more food. Once my date left the table to check on why the food was taking so long, she walked over and demanded I leave....and at that point I lost my appetite and didn't want to even bother causing a scene or addressing the manager... there was really no reason to ruin our night over whatever issue this waitress was having. Customer service is not a priority here.
Absolutely the best pizza I've ever had in Vegas. The all-meat pizza does NOT mess around. Pure awesomeness.

Worst pizza in the world! I wouldnt take there pizza for free let alone 30$ for it. Much better choices in town. Service is not professional and lacks attention mid week afternoon shifts. The bartender has to serve you because theres no waitstaff on floor. The place is so dead, they dont staff and it effects service.

Food was good.  I got the lasagna.  Amazing. Wife got fettuccini and was brought out luke warm at best.  Kids got pepperoni pizza and sauce was awful.  Our server was super nice but not attentive to say the least.  Drinks are strong and worth the money.  Would com back again but not my favorite.

Except for the pizza, prices are highway robbery. For a shrimp and mushroom pasta with hard garlic bread and a bottle of water, it cost me $28. I know this is Vegas, I don't know what I expected...but I do have to say the pasta was really good. The shrimp were ginormous! Would I pay this again for this same meal? Absolutely not. But it's a decent Italian joint.
The pasta is fantastic here! So flavorful. I had to share but wished I had my own plate. We are here twice and I hope to come back again solely for the pasta. Service is also great as well.
I would not and did not hesitate to return to have lunch or dinner. Their vegan menu is delicious and desserts too!!! Their pizza, veggie burgers, and meatless ball sandwich was

I got Hawaiian pizza, it was thin crust with 6 slices in a 12in. The pizza itself was neither good nor bad, just average.

They don't have cheesy bread so they offered to make us some. It was 4 slices of sourdough garlic bread with mozzarella cheese on top. I appreciate that they waned to accommodate but it wasn't great. 

Probably not worth the $36 we spent but definitely helped the hangover

Love this place. We are vegans...and we are always pleased with their menu. When we are in Vegas, this is our first stop. We love the vegan menu and will continue to bring our business here to this spot. The staff is friendly and they always make us feel at home. Kiddos.... keep this place in mind when you visit Vegas!

Our waiter Daniel was great!!  Side salads are not listed on menu but are $3.99. Buffalo chicken pizza was good. I ordered the Romania  chicken salad. The chicken was dried out,  but Daniel & the mgr were quick to bring out new chicken. Maybe stick to the pizza imo.

No problem with service , friendly hostess, sat us immediately. food quality was below par.  Our group, 6 adults, all ordered pasta and appetizers, and several bottles of house red wine. Spaghetti and meatballs, lasagne, chicken parm....pretty much every pasta featured and we ordered garlic bread, toasted ravioli appetizers. Maybe their pizza is better.  I would never go back, the Burger Bar next door is very good.  Las Vegas is stupidly expensive and often the food quality is disappointing.
Great food and fast service! The buffalo edamame was sooo good!!! The hot wings were great, too!

Super easy to sit at the bar and order drinks and food. Definitely like that you can order by the slice at the bar. The pizza is VERY good, thin crust, crunchy, chewy, and fresh. Would like to try their garlic bread at some point...when I'm feeling a little lighter than I presently am :P

Had my first dinner in Vegas here and it was my late-night go-to throughout the rest of my stay at Mandalay Bay. From the specialty pizza to the pasta, garlic bread, and wings, everything was good... not AMAZING, but def good if you're looking for a reasonably priced menu of comfort foods. The take out was also a life saver for when I just wanted to relax in the hotel room for a bit!

Other than that, the ambiance is fun and if you're into that sort of the thing, they have plenty of vegan options!
The four-cheese truffle pizza with alfredo sauce was good.  I had the chicken sandwich with avocado and the chicken was really dry.  Friendly service though.

Came here late at night to satisfy my pizza cravings. They have an option for take out and different types and sizes. I had the margarita pizza which was delicious. Service was quick and they were friendly, I'd go here again.

Taste-wise, this place deserves 3 stars, I've definitely had better. However, since it's on the strip, the price was very decent and the service was excellent.
It's located next to Burger Bar and Hussongs in Mandalay Bay. The have a sit down restaurant as well as take away, where you can order 1 slice. If you sit at the bar, it's a 2 slice minimum and slices are $5 each. If you order from either of these places, the pizza slices are not necessarily fresh. Sitting in the restaurant will guarantee a freshly made pizza.
We sat in the restaurant and ordered a 12" pizza, plain. The menu has some sandwiches and salads and a design your own pasta choice. It was Sunday and they also have a brunch menu.
The service was excellent. Our server was attentive and gave us some free dippings for our pizza, Parmesean cheese, ranch and blue cheese dressings.
The pizza was eh. I am not a fan of dried oregano and man, they use A LOT of it. I like a sweeter sauce and no dried spices. But, the cheese was good and it wasn't greasy at all. 
It was $16 and change for a decent size pizza on the strip, not to bad. Just wish it tasted it better.
I dont know that I'd go back, but I wouldn't say never.
If you dont want to spend an arm and a leg and dont mind dried oregano on your pizza, you might want to try this place.

This is for the express side only

We ordered the vegetable slice and the hawaiian. The toppings were really scarce and the vegetable slice I got had one piece of sausage on it. I'm not a vegetarian so I didn't mind but I can see this being a problem for someone who is.

The crust is actually not bad but overall the food was just "Meh" 

I did like the fact that the caesar salad came with broccolini which I haven't seen before. I always like more vegetables in my salads so this was a welcomed addition.

It will do if you want something quick and cheap(er) - but other than that there is no reason to come here.

VEGAN REVIEW*

I love this place. It's a must go to for any Las Vegan. There's a full vegan menu containing chikn wings, pizza, pasta and dessert, friendly staff and decent prices. I've had all 4 of the vegan pizza options as well as the chikn wings, pesto pasta, and the zeppolis. Everything I've tried has been perfection! The staff is always extremely friendly! If you're staying in vegas, this place is DEFINITELY worth visiting.
Great place to grab a great Italian meal. In town for the Vegas Marathon great place to "carboload". Very friendly service. Highly recommend this place for a great delicious quick meal.

OMG! RUN to Slice! Food is legit! If you want fresh, delicious homemade Italian dishes & pizzas, this is the place! You can taste the top quality ingredients in their dishes. We had homemade meatballs, Caprese salad, cheesy garlic bread, calamari, chicken parmigiana, BBQ chicken pizza and REAL cannolis! (Hey, what can we say-we're Italian-we like our food!) 
Servers are friendly and fast! Great food, great atmosphere & great prices! I will be back!

Meh. I've DEFINITELY experienced better...

Food was extremely greasy. My friend got the pesto pasta with chicken and mushrooms and it felt like olive oil pasta. The noodles were DRENCHED in oil, it was kinda gross. This is the only time I have never liked pesto sauce!!

I ordered the blue cheese burger with sweet potato fries. The sweet potato fries were yummy and the burger was alright. The meat was kind of dry but all the other addings made it a pretty tasty burger.
