The one cool thing here though is the big glass beer taps you can order and have placed on your table! It is a glass tube that's probably yard size with its own tap on the bottom so you can pour your own glass. Very awesome if you want some beer to go with your pizza or burger!

I'd really only eat here if I was staying in the Mandalay Bay and wanted to eat somewhere convenient. Otherwise, it's kind of pricy for the quality but they do give you huge portions! However, they're not to die for leftovers. There is no 'wow' factor with the food here but it's decent Italian food for a decent price. There's soo much better in Vegas though. If you're only here for the weekend, I'd try something else!

Excellent vegan options. I recommend the vegan buffalo chicken pizza. Amazing!! Also the Not Your Mama's garlic bread is a must!! 
For the rest of the group, the il Mangino pizza is great!! 
Service has always been on point and the restaurant has a great atmosphere!

Wasn't as advertised... 'Slices'.

Might as well buy a whole pizza instead of individual slices.

they do have happy hour and different deals throughtout the week. I've uploaded them... See photos. 
You're paying for rent for the prices of these pizza. 

Common food and strip prices.

Came in here for lunch as we were hungry and in between the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. This place is closer to Luxor.

Ordered soup, pizza and 2 drinks. The soup was okay, but sadly had a beef stock when it didn't need one. Ordered the veggie pizza. It was very soggy and laden with cheese even when we asked for light cheese.

The server was nice, but for the price and quality of pizza at a pizza place, I'd rather go somewhere else.
A comprehensive vegan menu with appetizers, entrées, and a desert. The food was great and the servers were very helpful and friendly. A must visit for vegans in Vegas.
Wonderful list of vegan options for anyone in a jam! The garlic bread is delicious and the staff are usually on top of things

I  lived in Germany for 3 years and I've been to the Hofbrauhaus in Munich.  When I came across this place I decided to try it out.  The first thing I did of course was to order a tall glass of beer.  After taking a gulp of the beer, I was completely shocked.  It taste just like the real german beers in Germany.  You tend to develope a taste for their beers after living there for 3 years. Not the import brand but the real deal.  The manager was walking around the place and I asked him that the beer taste just like the one's in germany.  He told me that the beers themselves are shipped directly from Germany and not the import brand.

Awesome vegan options! Totally loved the food and the service! I will so be back...even though I was the only Vegan at the table--- all the non Vegas LOVED their food--- Pizzas and fettuccine Alfredo... Wonderful family dinner... Thanks Slice of Vegas!!

Dined here with friends on Sunday night, and due to slow service/food arrival thinking 2 stars is fair.  Our server was good until he had taken our food order, after which, he pulled a Copperfield and went invisible.  While waiting for our meal, one of our party finished their drink, and we had to ask another server to help us out as our guy was MIA.  My friend had the lasagna and was happy, I had the chicken Parmesan, and was happy with the size of the chicken breast, but the food was warm at best. My wife had the fettuccine Alfredo, and liked the flavor but was also disappointed in the heat of the dish when it arrived.  After waiting a more than reasonable time upon completion of our meal, we again had to ask another server for our bill.  Would give it a shot again, but very hesitantly.

This is only a review from the take out.

Short: Pizzas were okay and great when you've been drinking, but not Cosmopolitan Secret Pizza great. Crust was a bit bland. Service was spotty. A bit pricey too ($23) for a 18 inch pepperoni 

Came here at 11:15PM or so I believe and they we're half way closed, but no problem could still buy the pizza by the slices!

I could not order any new pizzas, but in case you wanted to, it is $18.95 + $1.95 per topping for a large (18inch), 12 inch was $9.95 + $1.95 per topping and have specialties already made that range something like $25. They had some interesting ones like prosciutto and pesto, but I suppose I will have to try next time. 

The girl who helped us was nice, but did not really listen well. My friend asked her to double slice the pizza and with her verbal reply we believe she understood. Unfortunately we walked quite the distance already to realize that she didn't, nor did she reheat the pizzas. I suppose reheating is a personal preference as the pizza was still warm, but to me, if I'm paying $23 for a large pepperoni, I expect it to be hot. 

In the end, a good spot for drunken eats, but many better options on the strip.

Once I heard that Slice of Vegas has a Vegan Buffalo Pizza, I knew it was only a matter of time before we would wind up here once our plane touched down in Vegas.

Located in the Mandalay Bay along with another Vegan-friendly restaurant by the name of Hussong's Cantina, Slice of Vegas offers a full on Vegan menu. It mostly consists of Gardein and Daiya based recreations of their regular menu. Hey, this is Vegas damnit! Nobody comes here to eat salad.

With so many options to choose from, I skipped the Buffalo Pie in favor of the regular version so that my babygirl would be able to share the pizza with me as she isn't too keen on spiciness. The thin crust was so so, but the rest was Daiya & faux meat heaven. I'm not the biggest Daiya fan, but it is great substitute for pizza.

I ordered a side of Vegan Buffalo Strips as an appetizer for myself. If I had known they wouldn't be very spicy, I would've went with the atomic sauce instead. It was odd they put the sauce on the side, rather than smothered into the strips. Perhaps it would've given it more flavor as well as the joy of getting your fingers messy as you much away on Buffalo sauced goodness. I enjoyed this but at $10.95, it's a bit pricey. Even for Vegas...

I wish I was hungrier on this visit as the menu had so many options to from. Various appetizers, pasta, soups, salads, desserts and more. So many pastabilities, so little room in my tummy. The prices could be lower for the quality of the food, but I can't complain too much. Even though I'm rating this 3.5 stars, I'm rounding up for the simple fact that this type of Vegan food in Vegas is a rare find, and the simple fact that I will be back again to try out more things. Oh, and to get that atomic sauce.

This place is good if you're craving pizza especially as a vegan. Service was good, every employee was really friendly and smiled.

Ordered cauliflower, vegan wings, chicken parm and the vegan hot sauce with ranch pizza (forgot what it was called)

About $70 with iced tea. 

Everything was awesome just the prices dig a little deep in your pockets for a small portion.

My family was staying at Mandalay Bay for my son's wedding in the Vegas area so we decided to have the rehearsal dinner in the Marquee Room in Slice of Vegas restaurant.  We loved the casual decor of the room and and the convenience for all the guest because it is located right in the hotel.   When I called to reserve the room I spoke with Tiffany Easton, the Group Sales Manager, who was wonderful to deal with.  I contacted her about 3 months before the dinner by phone (I live in NY) and she couldn't have been more helpful.  If she wasn't available when I called she always quick in getting back to me.  There was an extensive menu to choose from (much more than the  menu in the regular part of the restaurant)  and the food was very good (we had several appetizers, pastas and entrees and everything was good except the shrimp scampi was too chewy) .  The servers were excellent and very attentive.  When the dinner was over they let use use the room for another hour over what was contracted for so that other friends and family could stop in and spend some time with my son and his bride to be.    We had a wonderful time and I just want to thank Tiffany and the servers for making it a great night.

We will definitely be coming back here. It's has food options for everyone. We had the vegan buffalo pizza. It was one of the best vegan pizza I have eaten. Save room for the vegan chocolate peanut butter cake. The staff was great. It is located in the shopping mall between Mandalay Bay and Luxor.

08.10.2017

Hubby and I stopped here after hanging out at Luxor for a couple hours. 

One slice of pepperoni was actually two slices. With a soda = $9.20. Not a bad deal! 

The crust was thin, crisp on the outside with a little bit of chew in the center = yummy. The pepperoni had a strong great flavor but I think it needed just a little more sauce and cheese to help the flavors marry. 

It would definitely be a place to come back and try a whole, freshly baked pizza.

Food was great service was great. But one HUGE problem. 
Came with a birthday girl who has a gluten allergy. 
It's mild enough that cross-contamination wouldn't have been a huge issue. But she ordered gluten free penne with marinara, which was one of the GF sauces. She loved the taste. "Doesn't even taste gluten free!"
One hour later, she has a major reaction. Based on what she went through, it was not a mild reaction that would come from cross-contamination. They definitely gave her the regular penne, after specific instruction of her allergy. 
Not happy. 

I can only wonder what would have happened if this had been a person with a more serious or deadly allergy.

I visited here at the end of my Vegas vacation because I had heard they offered vegan cheese for pizza. I was so surprised when I turned the menu over and there was a whole separate vegan section! They offer meatless meatballs and chicken strips (both gardein) as well as Daiya cheese. They had a number of appetizers, pizza selections and even desserts! I ordered the bbq chicken pizza and it was delicious!! I wish I could have ordered more (especially dessert) but I had a flight to catch.

Subpar pizza slices. The services was good though. I only ordered a pepperoni slice and garlic bread with mozzarella cheese. My order was ready in about 8 minutes. The pizza was average. The garlic bread had a hair on it so I can't advise on the flavor.

The bottom line: STAY AWAY

Over priced, middle of the road, food even with restaurant.com certificate.

Horrible service! Waiter was NOT interested in waiting on us. We're not demanding with special orders or extra things either.

Waiter helped himself to a 20% tip (suppose to be 18% per cert) and over charged my credit card by $10. After I got home I called and spoke with a manager and he corrected the credit card charge. When I told him about the tip he gave me his email and said he would mail me the 2% back. The tip issue isn't worth my time. 

I recommend staying away from Slice of Vegas. There are WAY too many other better places to eat. If you have eaten here check your credit card statement.

Eh ... I'm not entirely sure how I feel about this place. I've been to slice of vegas twice now. Both times the wait to sit was entirely too long, so I opted for the to-go bar area instead. I will say that having this little bar area is great for people who want their food without waiting for a seat. 

The quality of the pizza is only so/so (it's a bit too greasy for my taste), and the ready slices taste kinda stale. Definitely opt for making your own pizza if you have the time/money/friends to eat with you (because the pizza size is actually decent). 

As far as trying anything else, I've only had the 'Not Your Mama's Garlic Bread' - which was a let-down (not very garlic-y). 

Oh also, this place isn't cheap - but where in Vegas is?? But there is a saving grace - it's right next to a Fat Tuesday's - SCORE!
Incredible service and food, very cool vibe and really nice servers! Would go back for more !!

Local discounts!!!! Very good pizza also had the garlic Parmesan fries  and they were very good. The service was quite excellent as well very fast, would come back highly suggest locals to come here if they are in the area

The vegan options at Slice of Vegas are absolutely delicious! My hubby and I shared the chik'n wings and roasted cauliflower and I had the Romelia's salad as an entree while hubs had the meatless meatball sandwich with Cajun fries. While an amazing dinner, our sever Bianca made the experience memorable (especially since it was my birthday) and made me feel like we were her only table. Also, Katie the bartender knows her stuff! Go see these amazing ladies for a delicious meal and fun time!!! We can't wait to come back.

Walking from Mandalay Bay to the Luxor, we were hungry and saw this Pizza place.  There are two options, sit-down or quick "order by the slice" counter seating/to go.  We decided to stop by the quick side and order a couple of slices to dine at the counter.

It's a typical "order by the slice" joint....you select your Pizza slice and they re-heat it and call your number to pick it up.  We ordered 2 slices of Cheese Pizza.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/slice-of-vegas-las-vegas?select=e7il4LoTHrBJ4bjvybT2CA#e7il4LoTHrBJ4bjvybT2CA

It didn't take too long for the Pizza to be ready.  The Pizza itself was forgettable though.  It was a little Salty and lacked flavor beyond the Salt.  The Crust was a bit like cardboard, very tough.....there's a difference between chewy and tough....I like chewy, but dislike "tough" dough.

Overall, we felt like we wasted calories.

Return Factor - 10%

My group is staying at Mandalay Bay, so naturally we ended up checking out the shops.

My brother and I stopped in here for happy hour since we needed a snack to tide us over until dinner time.

We sat at the bar and a nice young lady showed us the specials. One thing that really impressed me was the beer selection. TONS of craft beer. Most of it was stuff distributed out to the east coast, so I've seen or tried most of it before but there were enough new things from out west for me to try.

We each ordered a slice of cheese pizza and the garlic parmesan fries to split. The pizza was pretty sad. Dried out, overcooked, not very cheesy. Reminded me of something you'd get in a high school cafeteria or gas station. The fries were good, and I really liked the pesto aioli. 

The crappy pizza is the real reason for three stars. Everything else was good. Even for the cheap price, it seemed pathetic. When your logo is a damned pizza slice, you should make an effort to make a better pie.

Maybe we were there on a bad day, but at least the happy hour prices were good!

The Caprese rocks! 
Gluten-free spaghetti with bolognese sauce and meatballs was the bomb. 
The Irish Mule is a must have drink.

What a perfect spot for Vegan options! The menu was so good their was too much to choose from and how delicious it was! We personally got the sweet potato fries with vegan ranch, the mushroom spaghetti and buffalo edamame!

Dying for a slice of pizza and the bartender was a complete jerk.  Too busy talking to fellow workers.  Had to get up and ask for service. Then she had and attitude. TOO many places in Vegas to have a bartender have an attitude.  Manager was nice. Wanted to help.  Her name was Angie and she needs to go.  TOO many other places to put up with that!!!

This sweet elderly woman asked me for help. I thought I would be doing her a favor by taking her $100 restaurant.com coupon off of her hands since she didn't have a smart phone or access to a computer/printer.  My bad...

First,  I tried a really nice restaurant,  but they would only let me use $25 at a time. Next,  I drove to 2 Japanese restaurants,  but they both didn't accept the coupon.  Then I drove to a diner, but they closed at 3pm. I should have checked my Yelp app since the restaurant.com app didn't update the diner's hours. 

Finally,  I called A Slice of Vegas and made reservations with the friendly receptionist.  I walked all over Mandalay Bay casino,  but could not find the restaurant.  By this time, I was at the fainting/exasperated point.  I called the receptionist again and she patiently guided me through all of the shops to her smiling face! 

The energetic and helpful server, Pete,  called his manager to help me figure out how to use the restaurant.com app where I had to order $75 worth of food to use $50 of the coupon. It was so worth it!

The "Choked Pig" pizza had a fantastic thin, crisp crust which went well with the bacon,  artichoke & whiskey sour cream topping.  The Salmon Portofino was seared perfectly with the moist, fresh, firm fish salted & peppered just right!  I ate the Brownie Sundae with gusto and took the cannoli & tiramisu to go with my doggie bag. Am enjoying the leftovers now as I compose this review. 

Everyone at A Slice of Vegas was attentive and understanding.  I really appreciate their help and their amazing food!  I learned a lot and will return again for the sandwiches and salads or maybe another pizza!

Alicia is legit and made great recommendations based on our table and their different preferences.  The pizza is delicious and it's a great break if you need to chill and take a break from the non stop hustle and bustle of Vegas.

I would give this place 0 stars if I could. My husband is gluten and dairy intolerant and can not eat these items without getting violently ill. He even throws up blood from time to time due to the severity of his sensitivity. I wanted to treat him to a nice lunch and got very excited when I saw that this place was advertised as gluten free and vegan. Upon ordering we were informed that the pizza was cooked in an oven with other items but that it was still gluten free so we proceeded with the order. The waitress then informed us that the pizza was very small and we would want to add something else to our order. I asked which items were gluten free and she informed me that the wings were gluten free. Upon receiving the appetizer we were told they were cooked in the same fryer and were not in fact gluten free after we had started eating. After leaving my husband got violently ill and called to complain. We were informed that it was our fault for ordering the items because of cross contamination that we should have been knowledgable of. 
We only went to this place because it was advertised as gluten free. We would not have ordered if we knew that NONE OF THEIR ITEMS ARE ACTUALLY GLUTEN FREE
The customer service after this mistake was just added insult. The manager was unapologetic and uncaring of our situation. He claimed that they ask about celiacs disease and give warnings about cross contamination which was not even slightly hinted at. He also said that there was a miscommunication when in fact we were blatantly lied to. We specifically asked questions regarding my husbands allergies and were instructed to purchase items that conflicted with these allergies. If you advertise that items are gluten free they need to actually be gluten free. 
YOU WOULD NEVER SERVE SOMEONE WITH A SEVERE NUT ALLERGY A DISH CONTAMINATED WITH NUTS

I came here on a recommendation from a fellow vegan friend. After reading the reviews, I was unsure what to think. We were immediately seating and helped fast by not only one waitress but 2. Service was impeccable. 

Food. There is a whole back side of the menu that has vegan options. And here's a tip: from 3-6 they have vegan happy hour appetizers. Yay us! The menu is plentiful with so many options I had no clue what to order. Normally I have 1 option to choose from and that makes it easy but I had about 20+ options to choose from. 

We started with the vegan hummus which was very good. The roasted peppers and crispy chick peas on the center were the best. I ordered the vegan hamburger and sweet potato fries. The burger was amazing! It had all the fixings. Vegan cheese and mayo as well as everything else on a normal hamburger. The taste was great, I only wish I hadn't scarfed down all the hummus because I was kind of full. It was a lot of food! 

My coworkers ordered a pizza and chicken parm. Both seemed pleased with the options. It not over the top about them. 

All in all, great place to enjoy! I will say that the options they had on the menu are great but all things I can make from the comfort of my own home and when I got out to eat I like to eat things new. Restaurants that have only 1 vegan option usually have a good choice and something you wouldn't normally have. So although there is a lot of variety, these are things you would have access to at the grocery store or home. 

Happy to see more restaurants offering vegan options!!

A FULL VEGAN MENU!!! I ordered from the vegan menu and my friends ordered from the regular one. I got vegan meatball sub and my girl got the traditional one. It was amazing. This place is great if you have a group of vegan and nonvegan people looking for a great place to eat. The price was just right too.
Excellent food and an awesome happy hour! We got the pesto hummus (amazing) and two giant slices of pizza for $12 with tax and tip. Best deal we had in Vegas! Service was great too.

Omg!!! me and my ex went there yesterday for dinner. This was the best food ever the garden salad the dressing was so yummy. Then the thin crust pizza was to die for. Then i got the fish bowl drink which was also awesome. I will deff have to make a stop here again when im in Vegas!!!
My husband and I came here for a casual dinner the chicken parmigiana is delicious and the immortal burger was perfect. The server was friendly and quick. Highly recommended for Italian food

This is a review for the carry out.  There is a whole dine in restaurant which looked OK in the Restaurant Row area.  It is very easy to get to while at Mandalay Bay and it appears to be open late night.
The pizza is ready to go - just pick your slice and they will heat it up.  It is decent quality and size, but not a tremendous deal.  My slice of meat lovers had plenty of meat and a nice crust.  I bought a slice, a water and a coke and it was like $20.  I am guessing the slice is like $10 at that total- not much for what you pay!

I think the main thing this place has going for it is its proximity to Fat Tuesday. Nothing like late night greasy pizza to go with your alcohol. I keep coming back for 2 reasons: it's open late and it's walking distance for me.

Their pizza is thin crust, but I've never been satisfied by their crunchless crust. It's never crispy. The portion sizes are huge, but that comes hand in hand with their high pricing. I mean, $30 for an 18 inch with sparse toppings is a bit much, isn't it? Even by Vegas standards? Plus, their little wings are $12! $12! For 7 pieces! (Side note: 7 is a weird number, so they either gave me an extra or I got gypped.) Sure, it came with like 5 sticks of carrots and celery, but $12?!

Service is okay. I tried to redeem the yelp check-in for free fries, but they told me it was for dine-in only. I didn't read the offer carefully, so it was my bad. They gave me a free cup for water (normally $.50) while I was waiting though.

Will I be back? Probably, and I'm still going to be complaining to myself the whole time.

I was not expecting a lot when we randomly stopped at this place for lunch on Saturday but it did not disappoint! Very kid friendly,  they even give kids a ball of pizza dough to play with which equaled at least an hour of entertainment for our 3 year old. We ordered the lasagna with a side salad, truffle parmesan sweet potato fries and garlic bread and everything was fantastic. Do yourself a favor and get those truffle fries OMG. Even the side salad, which at other places would just be lettuce and dressing, was chock full of edamame, red onions, cucumbers with dressing mixed well within. You really cant go wrong ordering from here.

Came here in a pinch with my cousins for a quick and affordable bite to eat.

The calamari we ordered wasn't fried and crispy. It was also served with marinara sauce, which was unexpected. It wasn't horrible but definitely needed to be more crispy.

We ordered the 12" personal size Hawaiian 5-0 pizza to share. We each ended up with 1.5 slices each. The dehydrated pineapple made it the saddest Hawaiian pizza we had ever seen. Again, it wasn't horrible, but was definitely unexpected.

Lastly, we ordered Mama's Garlic Bread. We opted to get cheese with ours and all I could taste was cheese. At least the order came with 4 slices. It also comes with a roasted garlic for you to rub the garlic on yourself. That was different...

Overall, the food isn't horrible but could have been better. Quite average. The service was decent.
Food outstanding service was terrific waiting to see Michael Jackson awesome experience
The best pizza on the strip hands down! Reminds of a New York pie. Great staff and great food. Tell the Big Slice I said hi!

We had a simple 12' pizza and a 32 ounce beer, which they let you keep the class. 
The pizza was super thin crust, we had mushrooms, garlic and green peppers on it. It was hot and very fresh and tasty, can't wait to go back here again. Delicious, and our waiter Brent was really welcoming and helpful, thank you, Brent.
Ranked among the best pizza I've ever had. Will stop there on every trip to Vegas. Loved it!!!
I really enjoyed my gluten free meal here, and they take all allergen request serious, which is refreshing. Very delicious spinach Alfredo with chicken!

Great place to grab some vegan eats with a vegan or non vegan alike! They have a great vegan menu, and an awesome omnivore menu. I love their vegan cheese cake and pizza! The fish bowl was a fun drink to try.

We happened to walk by this place looking for pizza and so glad we did. It was national beer day so only $5 beers and we ordered just a cheese pizza and it was great. Melissa was our bartender and she was so friendly and gave us lots of great ideas for where to go. I would definitely recommend this place while in Vegas.

We ordered the margerhita pizza.  I am not sure this establishment understands the concept of a margerhita pizza.  The crust was SO dry.  The sauce tasted old and way over seasoned.  The "micro" basil had no flavor.  I expected a  tomato-y marinara with sliceds of fresh tomatoes and bright whole basil leaves.  Nope.  Dark and dingy brown sauce with thin slices of melted cheese (the quality was worse than little ceasars- which I would have preferred at this point considering the price). We also ordered garlic bread with cheese.  9 bucks for 4 slices.  You know the garlic bread you get at the grocery store bakery in the silver bag for 2 bucks? Well...that is better.  Slight redemption for the roasted garlic served with the bread....because garlic. Yumm.  The service was acceptable.

I took my family there for dinner and really enjoyed the experience. The atmosphere was casual and friendly. The service was very efficient and quick. From salad to pasta, we enjoyed
the food very much. The marinara sauce was delicious.  Being a former New Yorker, I felt at home...in a  good way. So glad I found this place !

Excellent!

I love Groupon deals because it allows us to try restaurants that otherwise we won't care to visit. This was a Groupon deal that did not disappoint and I would come back and dine here again because of what I ordered the first time. I had the Salmon Portofino and it was delicious!  The filet of grilled salmon was tasty and fresh and served with angel hair pasta tossed in garlic and olive oil with cherry tomatoes and fresh basil. My husband had the Bisteaka, chef's cut of steak grilled to how you like it and came with potato hash and red wine mushroom sauce.

It was a little crowded that evening so the atmosphere was a little loud. Dimmed lighting. As crowded as it was, though, we were seated immediately and our server was very attentive, always checking on us if everything was alright. This restaurant is located in the Mandalay Bay shopping area. Great experience!

Review #0159

My experience is based solely on the walk-up counter, I did not dine in.
Had to be down on the strip to fill out some tax paperwork, and thought I'd visit some former co-workers at the restaurant I used to work at next door to this establishment. After I left, I thought I'd grab something quick and easy, and relatively cheap, so I chose Slice of Vegas. 

PROS: 
-The young lady working the counter was extremely warm and friendly, and even complimented my makeup. 
- Considering it's on the strip inside a nice resort (Mandalay Bay), it was only $4.50 for a HUGE slice of pizza. Pretty good value in my book. 

CONS: THE FOOD. I now see WHY it's a good value.. I ordered a slice of cheese pizza (no drink) which came out quick and hot. I am not some super-duper health freak; I've had pizza before that had some grease on top (Chuck E. Cheese comes to mind..) and I'm totally ok with it and i eat it.. HOWEVER, there was SO much grease, it took 2 napkins just to get MOST of it off. There was barely any cheese and the sauce tasted funky. It was burnt underneath, and the crust was so hard I could barely bite into it.  Even after my attempt to drown it in parmesan cheese, it still was.. well.... disgusting. I can count on one hand in my entire life the times I found a pizza inedible,  and this was one of those times. I choked down as much as I could because I was starving,  but I would NEVER recommend this place for the pizza.
Great people working there! Thanks Gary ( bartender) and Monica (manager) you guys were awesome! We had a fabulous time having drinks and talking. We enjoyed our dinner, thanks Monica!

Michelle was a very offensive waitress. When she came to our table she offered soda and water and then proceeded to say "idk, are you old enough to drink?" when I asked about any drink specials/for a drink menu. I am 21 and definitely look old enough to drink so when she assumed my friends and I were underage we were all very offended and didn't like her judgmental tone. She was sloppy, unfriendly and brought checks without asking if we were finished or if we wanted another round of drinks. So rude and made my friends and I feel unwelcome. Would not return. As a waitress in a the past, I always tip 25%. I still tipped her okay in case it was a fluke but I was very unimpressed with the service.

So from Mexican to Italian what could be better? Oh my I know both! With no real food today, except what cows eat I was really craving something that was a main staple that was packed with protein and carbs too! Been working it so good that it will not even hurt the diet. Or if it was I can work it off on the treadmill tomorrow morning. So it's all good.

Pizza is a main staple of any good diet. My relationship with pizza goes back to as far as I can remember! Now with a new pizza joint that when I walk in is playing Saturday Night Fever, who could go wrong. Everyone is staying alive! Not able to get on the John Travolta moves I can sing in my head and tap my foot to the wonderful beat. It's entrancing too!

The bar is where I chose to sit and enjoy my food. The bartender was very helpful and attended to my needed. The bartenders name was Caitlin, she was absolutely fabulous. She kept such a clean bar, and was able to even keep the dishes right behind the bar clean as she went in the dish washer. The Slice of Vegas rewards the customer for their Yelp check in too. Woo-hoo with Parmeson Fries. They were so good but with a side of ranch of course. I also had a slice of cheese from the happy hour menu. For only $3.00, what a steal! The cheese slice hit the spot since I have been craving pizza. Deciding dessert was a must I ordered the Cookie Skillet. It combine chocolate and Carmel sauce on vanilla ice cream with whip, nuts, and a cherry all made to order. Are you getting hungry yet? The cookie is warm so its sort of like a hot fudge sundae but way better. This dessert is orgasmic. Sorry for the reference but us ladies will understand; its that fabulous!

I stopped by this place because there food seems and looked good, but I was disappointed.

For a $21 chicken Alfredo pasta I'd expect it to be good and instead I got a flavorless stale cold pasta. 

Then for the slice of cheese pizza there was nothing good about it, it was just as flavorless as the pasta I got.

Good employees, good atmosphere, flavorless and overpriced food.

The pizza was ok. Thin crust style pizza. Very crunchy. Crust was way too crunchy to chew. I would have liked it softer. We had meatball n green pepper toppings. Meatballs were really good. 

Had their calamari was really good. Nice and soft, nut chewy or tough. Sauce was really good. Can't out faster than expected. Pizza took a little longer.

The service was good. Happy hour was half off apps and single slices. Calamari was $6, 12 inch meatball n green pepper pizza was $14. We visited on Wednesday around 5pm.

I would not come here again for the pizza, but I would go back to try other items on menu, because the app was good. Got three stars for app.

We were looking for food that would satisfy our vegan, vegetarian and meat eaters. This was an excellent choice. It was nice to have a vegan menu to choose from and there were plenty of options for the meat eaters. You have to try the Mama's Garlic Bread (and Not Your Mama's Garlic Bread for the vegans). It comes with a cooked garlic head you spread on your bread and it is so delicious. We ordered pizza and burgers and they were all excellent. The staff was friendly and provided great service. We ate here twice during our short stay in Vegas and will come back again next time we visit.

I wanted some pizza and I remembered seeing Slice of Pizza while walking through he other day. So I stopped in and sat at the bar...the place wasn't empty so that was a good sign, then again it was Football Sunday lol. Anyway I  sat down at the bar and someone had the Buffalo Chicken Pizza that really looked good. I asked how was it and she said excellent. I ordered the Margherita Pizza and it was awesome. This place style of crust is very unique and crispy. The bartender was outstanding and attentive.  The atmosphere was great. I highly recommend and I'll be back the next time I'm in Vegas!!! Btw they had other good looking options to decide from on their menu if Pizza is not a must.

It was a nice little Sunday afternoon of sightseeing but it was time for some football. The Bills/Raiders game just started and I was looking desperately for a decent bar that was showing the game. I had previously visited 3 bars but the TV's were either small or scarce. As I walked into Slice of Vegas, I noticed that it was impossible to have a bad seat so a friend and I decided to have a seat at the bar. I asked if one of the TV's in front of us could be changed to the game and the bartender kindly obliged. I checked in via Yelp and received a 15% discount. I knew right then that I was at the perfect place.

When I found out they offered pizza by the slice, I decided to order a pepperoni along with some Stella. It was a blissful 3 hours. The bartenders and manager were really friendly and funny. If I lived in Vegas, I would definitely return for some yummy bar food, beer, and football.

Not the best nor the worst dining experience that I've had in Vegas. This restaurant is located in the Mandalay Place right on the Strip.

I have been to this spot two different times and have experience the good and the bad that comes with dining out. First time I came here, I was here with family during dinner time.We came here to get a bite to eat as we had been drinking and needed to sober up.

We shared a pizza and a Caesar Salad. The Caesar salad was different from any other one of its kind that I've ever had. Made with romaine, broccoli, croutons and their house Caesar dressing, which in my opinion of of the best tasting dressing I've had!!! Topped with fried anchovies, grilled lemon and fresh Parmesan. Cost $11.95. The portion was big enough to share among four adults. We also shared a 18-inch Nonna's Margherita pizza, which is made of fresh mozzarella cheese and fresh basil. Not the best, but not the worst. Flavor was good, but it was dry. This cost $29.95.

Second time I came, I came during lunchtime. This time, we had to wait as there were so many people. I waited about 20-25 minutes before I was seated. I was seated toward the back at a tiny table with hardly any elbow space. To make things easy, I and my guest decided on just getting waters as it took forever for our waiter to get to us. Upon looking over the menu, my guest decided on the Delitalino sandwich, which is made of imported Itailian meats of cappicola, salami and ham. Along with provolone cheese, tomatoes, onions, pickles, romaine lettuce and seasoned with dried oregano and Italian dressing. It came with a side salad of their choice. Cost $14. I ordered the Scotty's Chicken sandwich with a side garden salad. The sandwich was made of a grilled chicken breast, which was so tender and moist. Topped with a roasted tomato, pickle, basil pesto, fontina cheese and jalapeño bacon. The garden salad was made of spring lettuce mix, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions and edamane. Seasoned with an Italian dressing, which I replaced with ranch. Their ranch dressing here is so delicious!! This also cost $14. Both sandwiches and salads were amazing. Which almost made up for the lack of service we received during this visit. 

Con's:
1. This place is so popular that there is always a line of people waiting to eat here. The tables don't get cleared off quick enough to accommodate the the customers.
2. It is always so loud. Don't come here if you want an intimate experience or want to be able to actually have a conversation with your guest without having to yell.
3. During popular hours, don't expect to get great customer service. I feel like for the amount of people that come thru here, they never have enough staff working. Our waiter had a huge section all to himself and was running around crazy trying to take orders and make sure his customers were satisfied, but in the process, I had to wait forever to get my lunch and for him to bring my check to me. 

I would come back again, as the food is really good here.
Amazing pizza!!! Went there twice in one week. Really enjoyed the Helldorado and trying the local beers. Parmesan Garlic French Fries were really good as well.
Their stuffed shell pasta was really good. I don't think their lasagña was anything special neither was their garlic bread. Servers here are very friendly.

After 6 days in Vegas (for work), all I wanted was normal food. Ingredients I understood with familiar flavors. Slice of Vegas is exactly that. 

The Not Yo Mama's Garlic Bread really does come with an entire garlic bulb on the side. Great for you, bad for your neighbors and any surrounding vampires ;) 

The spicy marinara has a good kick too it. Not overly spicy, but enough to satisfy your taste buds. Restaurant has a sports bar vibe with TV's in every direction and an impressive beer menu. Worth eating at when you want a relaxing, casual evening.

Overall, the food was good, but I didn't feel that it was worth the price we paid. A bit over priced. My favorite was the Romelia's salad. The citrus Italian vinaigrette was the perfect dressing. Their homemade croutons were so crunchy and tasty. We also had the il Mangino pizza which wasn't bad, paired with their garlic bread.

It's located in the Shoppes at Mandalay Bay, and you could walk right by it and not realize. I almost did and a few others in our group did too. It has a sports bar vibe to it and the front of the restaurant is completely open so you can see into the mall walkway and folks can see in. I'd had breakfast not too long before so I didnt want anything heavy. Luckily they can do pizza by the slice, and they also had a check-in offer for a free side of garlic parm fries.

Ordered an Ace Pineapple Ale (bottle), pepperoni slice (thin crust) and the garlic parm fries for the check-in offer. Loved my drink, and the pizza was pretty tasty, but the star of the day were those garlic parm fries! And to think they were a check in offer!! Those things will have you ordering another helping! I mean it's a really good size serving, but they are deliciously crisp and fresh and they somehow are able to get garlic AND parmesan cheese all over each fry without getting them soggy! I could not stop popping those delicious little slivers in my mouth!

Stopped by for a late night slice of pizza.  Not exactly east coast quality, but still a very good slice.  Crispy crust with some elasticity in the edge, nice and cheesy and the pepperoni was thin and crisp with lots of flavor.  Will definitely grab another slice when I have a craving while in Vegas.

We were seated right away, and the service was great, but that's about it.  The food was just ok, we both ordered pastas and neither of us were impressed.  The garlic-parm fries were the best part of the meal.  We ordered dessert, but even that was lackluster.  Sorry to say, we won't be going back.

Vegan in Vegas isn't always an easy one! Walking Mandalay Place shops my friend pointed out that this place has a vegan menu. Monday night I order the meatball pizza which was amazing with the NY style crust!  I love the fact there is a full menu dedicated to us non meat eating individuals and those of us allergic to Dairy.  I did inform the waiter I had a dairy allergy and he made sure the kitchen staff was fully informed. I was highly impressed and next trip to Vegas will come back and try something different and maybe a dessert.
Pretty good... not great but good. I had the chicken parm... The lasagna is supposedly really good. The pizza looked really good too
Two slices filled the spot.  Watered down expensive drinks.   Love the big bottle of Jack on the counter.  Service was fast but was a quiet night

Excellent food. Portions are really big. Pizza is really big for the small personal size. Staff is super nice and attentive. 

Drinks were really weak though and the ticket times for the food took 40 mins. Restaurant was half full. Other wise I would've gave this place a 5 star.

So I have only been here 2 times and I think it's pretty good. I'm a vegetarian and I shared a (what I think is) vegan cake with my vegan friend and it was pretty bomb. Had the vegan "chicken" wings and they were really good... but a little bit too small for the price. Had the "meatball" vegan pizza and it was to die for. I absolutely love their "meatballs". If you are a vegan or vegetarian that likes to eat vegan food, I definitely recommend this place because it has a good vegan menu.

The 10-Meat Pizza was actually really good and the atmosphere and music were nice. It's got a decent beer list, with some very different selections. No microbrews, but still some unique beers. 

The service, unfortunately, was terrible. Our waiter must have been a ghost, because we never saw him. When he did finally appear he brought my wife the wrong order and then had his thumb in her pasta when he finally brought the right order out. Later he took her Diet Coke for a refill and brought back an iced tea. We gave it back to him, but we were ready to pay and go by the time he finally showed up again. 

I hate when a restaurant takes your glass away from the table to do a refill. Just bring a new glass!!!

I thought the food was ok here. We waited for ever (over an hour) for a table to get seated. Our server was very diligent, quick, and friendly. I would not recommend going with a big group (over 10) because they just don't have that many tables to accommodate large groups.

At 4:00 on Sunday 1-26-2014 the young woman at the take out slice was occupied by whatever was on her phone and acted put off by me trying to order. After ordering two two topping slices I was told that the price was fifteen dollars. I stated that a slice on the menu was less than that. This scholar hunched her shoulders and told me the prices were on the menu. After looking at the pool of grease on the display slices and considering her attitude I left. Then, as if I couldn't eat anywhere else, she shouted "next!"  Maybe it would have been effective if someone had been waiting. Too many options to have to put up with stupid. Come on folks, teach your servers the basics of customer service. How many bad reviews before people stop even giving you the chance?  And if you are having relationship problems, call in sick. It should not be your customer's problem.
I stayed at Mandalay Bay and was disappointed at my limited and pricey vegan options until I found Slice of Vegas. I appreciate the variety of their vegan options and the quality.

Customer service was horrible, the food was gross i found out that most of the chef and the servers do not wash there hands after in the bathroom which was nasty! Not to mention I asked to speak to the manager and the manager took a long time.

We went there because the lamb sliders looked good. After rearranging schedule to make it possible to eat there we find out that they don't have the lamb sliders on the menu. They didn't bother to remove it from the online menu not the physical menu when we got there. After sitting and ordering drinks they finally let us know they don't have the sliders any more. There was no other indication anywhere they no longer served he sliders. Apparently it was just sold out but actually removed from the menu. 

You may want to call ahead to confirm they actually have the food on the menu!!

There are vegan options on the menu, but if you are a plant-based eater...ask for the vegan menu, which has more options.  The salad and pizza we ordered were both great.  They also have a delicious chocolate cake - it's the only chocolate cake the restaurant serves and it happens to be vegan (shhh).  We will return next time we are in Vegas.

Service: Excellent and efficient, super friendly hostess and servers. 

Price: Its high for what they offer but it is conveniently located near the Luxor. 

Food: They have a nice variety of salads and pizzas, and a variety of beers. I enjoyed there 10 meat pizza. It was really good and enjoyed it. The crust was not soggy and it had the right amount of meat and sauce. I also ordered a salad and it was okay but it did lacked dressing. I would not recommend the soup. Both soups were salty and not that tasty. 

Overall: If you are in the Luxor this is a good option. I had 2 groupons and went there twice. I would not go out of my way to eat here otherwise.
It was a very good place to eat for a full sized meal...it didn't have that "wow" factor flavor i was hoping for...but the bread appetizer with a roasted garlic came close and is a must try

With so many pizza choices in Las Vegas, it's hard to distinguish them all.  Even with that said, this was definitely the best thin-crust "NY style" pizza that I've ever had.  I love the atmosphere and the fact that you can control the music with just a simple app on your smart phone.  It's a fun, casual place to hang out, watch some sports and enjoy delicious Italian cuisine.
An Italian restaurant that offers something for everyone. I had a burger and it was fantastic. Price is high but normal for the area. Burger and fries was $15.

Great pizza/Italian spot in Mandalay Bay.  We tried the fried ravioli as an appetizer and it was the best I've ever had!   The pizza is very good as well.  It's more of a thinner crust that has a crisp bite to it.  I have ate here many times and it never disappoints.  The staff is always friendly and the service is quick and easy so you can get in and out and get back to gambling in the casino!   Keep up the great work CHEERS!

Delicious food and friendly staff!  I love the "It's All Greek To Me" pizza and the Caprese salad.  I also suggest the meatballs as a starter.  The staff is always happy and ready to help with any questions on the menu.
Convenient location with ok italian food. The spaghetti were super bland (cooked without any salt), the salad was fresh. Loved the takeout counter.

Good pizza, good draft & bottle list w/a great selection of local beers. Real good service at the bar, can't say for tables.
Over all, a decent stop for a slice or two and a beer.

Slice of Vegas is a hidden gem at the shoppes @ Mandalay Bay. The pizzas are amazing and they have a huge selection of local craft beer. The edamame and 10 meat pizza are soooo good. 

They have happy hour Monday through Thursday from 3pm- 6pm. 

This kid friendly restaurant is our go to spot when we are at Mandalay Bay. 

The staff is really friendly and attentive and they always take care of us when we come in. 

They have free Valet downstairs at the shoppes valet, which is perfect because I'm a local and go out of my way to come here a few times a month.

Kids meals good deal..entree or pizza, one side, beverage for $10.95. Mac and cheese kid entree was good. Fruit bowl as choice of side dish was huge and fresh. On adult menu, skip the Il Mangino. Prosciutto was super salty and over baked making it hard. Ricotta was sweet. Weird. Overall flavor was just not right.

Great restaurant!! Food was fresh and delicious! Kids pizza wasn't frozen or if it was they fooled me.... such good flavor! My kids LOVED it!  The healthy selection of sides for the kids meal was thought out so well!!  I had zero negative remarks!! We will be back!

I cannot believe the high ratings this place had. Granted, I got it to go by the slice, here is my story:

I was nursing a pretty sick hangover. It was around 3pm. Staggering back to my room at the Luxor, from my friends room at Mandalay Bay, I passed by Slice of Vegas, and was drawn in, if by nothing but the fact it would be quick and to go. There was no one in line. I placed my order, as did about 10 people that lined up behind me. It wasn't until all 10 had been placed that cashier started to dish out slices from the case which I had until this point figured had been for display only. I mean why else would it have not been served as soon as I ordered it? About 20 minutes later, everyone's orders placed she began throwing the slices out. my room was a brisk 3 minute walk away, and by the time I arrived the slice was cold. It didnt even look appetizing. Didnt taste any better than it looked. It had that concession stand pizza taste, only older.

Much better options for a quick bite to eat, maybe you have to get the whole pie to not have a horrid experience?

It wasn't the pizza to fit for but what to expect around midnight where most of the food places is ready to closed inside a casino. And little overpriced I think but again this is a Vegas casino and people will pay to have a bite

Wow. I'm actually kinda shocked this place has a good amount of bad reviews. 

This is one of my more favorite places to go out of my way for in Vegas for many reasons:

- It's easy to get to. Since it's on the Luxor side of the bridge to Mandalay, don't even bother with the nightmarish Mandalay Bay parking lot, and opt for super easy parking on the Luxor upper parking deck. It always seems to be a shorter and easier walk.

- They have an AWESOME VEGAN MENU with so many amazing offerings. I'm so glad they are advertising this now because before it was kind of by word of mouth only.  The vegan meatballs are a must! You can also get GLUTEN-FREE pizza, although it's only offered in one size (I believe 10") and does take a bit longer for them to make. They use Daiya Cheese, which is the best! They'll also add it to your vegan salads and other dishes if you ask nicely.

- Great beer selection. Lots of imported stuff. Lots of good stuff on tap. Read the blackboard for the latest.

- They have a to-go window. Convenient!

- Wait staff is friendly, but yes, a little slow. This place gets busy though, and there is a back room where they have a lot of parties from the conference goers. So most of the available wait staff is stuck having to deal with that. No completely their fault. They could do with one less person at the front.

NEWS ALERT FOR THE VEGANS: was told by the waitress last night that the chocolate cake, cheesecake, and the zeppoli (from the normal dessert menu listed on the coffee cans at your table) are all VEGAN! Don't miss out on these.
Been here a few times, always a good experience.  Food is excellent, not as over-priced as most strip places. Not a vegan, but love the roasted cauliflower. Great location in Mandalay Bay Place.

It looks like this place has mixed reviews, which is understandable. It's Vegas, it's on the strip, people are drunk or hungover, what do you expect?

I kept walking by this restaurant when going to Luxor to Mandalay Bay and back. The smell of the pizza got to me the first day. Once someone suggested we eat it for lunch before heading back to LA, I was all in.

For 3 people, we ordered the 18 inch Helldorado. Let's just say, it was hella good. We all love a little spice and the jalapenos definitely helped, but it wasn't very spicy. Us Koreans love our spice, so we all added chili peppers to our slices. What I enjoyed the most was the whole crust. The bottom of the pizza was cooked perfectly; it had the best crunch that added great texture to the pizza. Plus it wasn't too heavy. It seemed like it was thinner than normal pizzas that I usually have, which was perfect for me.

The only thing is that you can't order by the slice when dining in, only whole pizzas. At first, that was a downer, but honestly, we all enjoyed the Helldorado so much, it turned out to be for the better.

This is a decent casual dining option.  The prices are ok and you can get in and out quickly.  The service is ok as well.

I ordered a 12" Miles' Ten Meat pizza.  The crust, sauce and cheese or ok.  The pizza comes covered in several different meats.  You get a good amount of toppings.

There are other options as well if you are not in the mood for pizza.

This place is realistically a three star.  I am taking away one star for one petty thing that annoys me.  They offer a 10" pizza as well.  That would have been the preferred size for me, but it is only available in gluten-free.  I am not sure why I cannot get what I want just because hypochondriacs found a new "allergy".  Evidently lactose intolerance is no longer in so they needed a new go to issue.

I found Slice of Vegas by accident when I was on groupon looking for some discounts on food. read reviews about it, and lots of people have been bragging about how good the service and the pizza is at this place. Slice of Vegas is located in Mandalay bay, just right next to Burgr bar. The place is big for a pizzeria but there is always a lot of people waiting to be seated.  

The menu contains a typical selection of pizza, and my favorite pizza is the "miles 10 meat" pizza. like the name implies, the pizza has 10 different kind of meat on it. good thing about slice of vegas is that, the pizza was never frozen, u can really taste the freshness of it. The pizza slices were thin. it has that crispiness that I really like, with a perfect amount of chewiness. and the flavor is really good. 

I have only tried 2 of their pizza at this place, the miles 10 meat and the 4 cheese truffle. The sauce on the pizza was good. its the perfect amount. on the miles 10 meat, the sauce was dark red, and a bit sweet. u cant really taste the tomato flavor of it, which is a good thing for me, since I hate tomatoes. The amount of cheese on it was in good balance. All the ingredients on the miles 10 meat were tasty. The 4 cheese truffle is good, but tends to be very oily. 

Overall, the pizza were really good and I would really recommend it. its not really a wow factor but we are in vegas and not nyc. I think the pizza really taste good. it has the perfect balance of sauce, toppings and cheese. it has that perfect crispiness with every bite. ull even lick ur fingers, coz its that finger lickn good. lol.

We came here with a party of 15 and got seated in about 10 minutes on a Saturday night.  This place wasn't our first choice, the Burger Bar next door was our first but wasn't able to sit our party.

Prices are decent.  I shared a large Pizza with 3 others and it came out about $20 bucks.  Pizza was thin crust, don't remember seeing any choices for thick crust on the menu.

They also have a nice tap selection and the service was good.  We also got lucky and got some NFL drink specials while the playoffs were on.

Had dinner at Slice of Vegas last night and it was ok.  The pizza was good, but nothing special.  The muscles were DELISH though!!  I also felt very rushed to hurry up and order.  The server was nice, but before we even had a chance to look at the menu, he was already back asking if we were ready.   To add on top of that, they weren't even that busy...
Not sure if we'll return.

Very friendly staff at dinner last night and lunch today.   The pasta was pretty good.  It was great to have a vegan cheese option for the pizza.  Unsurprisingly for a strip restaurant it was pricey.

I would have given it another star but for the utter lack of attention I received at lunch.  Sat at the bar for 5 minutes without a bar tender coming over.  Then I sat at a booth.  The waitress promptly took my order and brought my soda.  That was last time I saw her until my lunch was finished.  The restaurant wasn't that busy so I don't understand why I was ignored.

Good place to go with the family! Tasty pizza and nice staff!
Prices are on the high side for pizza but it's Vegas! 
Overall it's worth going to this place. Will go back again!

The service is excellent here.  Last time I went I had 3 servers helping my table. The food is good for the price considering we're in Las Vegas and not NYC.  
Good beer choices as well
Pretty good pizza n pasta and prices are reasonable! Order the chocken wings there a 10! Yummy

I've been to Slice of Vegas 2 or 3 times and have never been disappointed. They have a great vegan menu. I've tried the barbecue "chicken" pizza and the vegan burger with a heap of sweet potato fries, which were all excellent. I finally managed to save room for the vegan chocolate cake (with peanut butter frosting!!!) the last time I went, and it was AMAZING! I want to eat it every day, for every meal, but then someone would have to roll me around like Violet Beauregarde.

Our server on this most recent visit, Brent, was super nice, too. He got a big tip. :)
The bbq chicken pizza is a bit too sweet for my taste but I'm sure a lot of people would enjoy...

Service was great, everyone was very nice and attentive. Which is always a good thing at any restaurant. 

They had a Sunday brunch special, so my husband and I really wanted breakfast food because for those two days in Vegas we were NOT able to get up early for breakfast, must be the Alcohol! 

We order steak hash, pieces of steak toss with season potato in a skillet topped with two over easy eggs and served with toast. This was really good and the steak wasn't chewy and nasty. Seasoned potato, good. 

We figure that since this place is called Slice of Vegas, we should try their pizza, 12 inch pepperoni. Pizza was pack with flavor BUT the pepperoni was salty and made the pizza really greasy. We had to ask for napkins to daub the grease off. The grease turned me off, it made the pizza soggy because of the grease. Ugh.

A caveat, I didn't have any pizza.  I actually had lunch @ Julian Serrano Tapas at the Aria about 1.5 hrs before coming here, so I was already full.  

The GF remembered this place while wandering from Mandalay Bay to Luxor the previous time we were in Vegas.  It was already closed by the time we wandered through, but she had bookmarked this spot for dinner next time out.

Well, we finally made it back and we came over here from the Vdara.  We actually arrived at 5:30pm so we hit happy hour, which is 1/2 off select booze and select appetizers, as well as individual slices.  This included vegan versions of some of the apps, which was great.

I ended up ordering Not Your Mamma's Garlic Bread and Sweet Potato Fries tossed in truffle oil.  Since they were half off, why not get both?  

The Garlic Bread was fantastic...thick slices of bread and instead of butter and garlic, Slice of Vegas topped it with an almond based pesto that was quite tasty.  They served it with a side of a roast garlic bulb, which you could drop a knife into and grab a clove like it was butter.  That roast garlic but this over the top.

The Sweet Potato fries weren't anything special, but you could smell the truffle oil they tossed it in after.  It wasn't a huge amount, they probably drizzled it and gave it a few tosses, but it was plentiful as a whole and delicious.

Their pies were a little pricey; 12" for $19.  I did try the crust on my GF's Vegan Buffalo Chicken pizza and it was cooked very well.  She loved it; but I didn't really taste the toppings itself so other than the crust, I can't comment on if it was good or not.  

Service was friendly and excellent.  The waitress was very patient. happy, and cheerful when assuring us that the ranch dip that came with the fries is vegan.

I'm definitely coming back, but this time I'm going to order a pizza for myself or, if I hit happy hour again, get a slice.

I stopped in for some appetizers during my conference break and it was amazingly delicious! I ordered the calamari which was on point. I was surprised how delicious it tasted because deep fried calamari is not easy to cook. I also had a side of the garlic fries. It was some of the best fries that I've ever had! I love how it comes with the dip on the side. I wanted to try the pizza but I ate alone so appetizers were enough for me. Great customer service!

When we were making last minute plans to take my cousins to Vegas, I prayed and I hoped that we could find an affordable room at the Wynn (vegan paradise!), but with the cheapest clocking in at $900/night (*SOB*), it just wasn't going to happen this time.  So we booked at the Mandalay, knowing there'd at least be the best pool in the world to soothe the pain of not being at the Wynn.  What I didn't know was that there'd also be Slice of Vegas to make me SO SO happy!

It's a casual Italian eatery, and coming from the suburbs of Philly, I felt right at home.  Nothing fancy, not too much hoopla, just standard American-Italian fare that fills your belly with a warm light (and maybe acid reflux) that you'll carry with you for the rest of the day.  This, my friends, is comfort food.

What sets Slice of Vegas apart from the pizza joints of my youth is their amazing vegan menu!  Not even kidding you, it has everything you could possibly ever want at a place like this.  Pizza, pasta, salads (really? you're eating a salad?), appetizers, sandwiches, DESSERTS.....oh lordy, they thought of everything.  They left no stone unturned.

I was lured by the meatball sandwich, and went high to hog heaven with the first bite.  A great roll (they even call it a hoagie roll, like my people back east!!), a rich balanced sauce, the perfect amount of daiya mozzarella, and gardein meatballs, which are probably my favorite outside of homemade.  It came with sweet potato fries, and our darling waitress said the magic words, "Would you like a side of ranch with that?"  WOULD I?!  Gimme gimme gimme.

Sam was perfectly content with his spaghetti and spicy marinara, and would've come back for it every meal if I'd let him.  We stuffed ourselves silly and had no room for dessert, which was the saddest thing.  I even tried to come back later after a night of dancing, but they were long closed.  Alas, I can add this place to my repertoire of super vegan friendly restaurants in Vegas, and I'm very happy that I don't absolutely have to go to the Wynn to be well fed (to the point of bursting).

Being a Saturday evening, it's hard to find a good eatery without the long wait.  This place, located in the mall between Mandalay and Luxor, was still half empty around dinner time so we sat down right away.

My BIL got me an Italian Creamsicle to start with, as I needed a drink (one of those days).  Pretty yummy if you like sweet drinks like me.  I ordered the Bowl of Pastabillities (create your own pasta) with rigatoni, pomodoro sauce, and shrimp ($14.95 pasta/sauce + $5.95 shrimp = $20.90).  One of my kids got the spaghetti and alfredo sauce with sausage and shrimp (+ $3.95 sausage = $24.85).

The pasta was just okay, nothing special.  My hubby's meatball sandwich ($12.95) was okay too.  My mom and sister shared a Caesar salad ($11.95) and an 18" Choked Pig pizza ($29.95), which had pesto aioli, mozzarella cheese, bacon and artichoke mix, topped with chopped basil and whiskey sour cream (they wanted to try something different).  They said that the taste of anchovies in the Caesar salad dressing was strong, and the pizza was eh (I tried it and I didn't really like it).

Overall, the food was average at best but overpriced.  Service was nice so I gave it 3 stars.
Been here twice now. Both times completely underwhelming. Just paid 14.90 for a cold slice of pepperoni/sausage and a draft beer. Fuq this place.
Inexpensive, gluten and dairy free options. A great little find in an otherwise expensive and glutenous vacation...

Can you say HANGRY?!! Except it was more like inner white girl needing copious amounts of carbs to soak up all the drinks we downed hours before! 

My friend and I were so drunk; almost felt like this place was a mirage except when we clutched the wall, IT WAS REAL! We did the drunk girl excitement and raised our hands to the Italian Gods for creating pizza dough! 

Before the waitress said anything, she knew we needed a reservoir of H2O. We finally choose to go with the Back East Buffalo Pizza & devoured it in minutes! I'm not that big fan of thin crust because sometimes it's so thin you can't put any yummy toppings on their without falling off or the crust gets burnt, but this crust was to die for (and that's not the tequila talking)! Although the prices may seem high, it's Vegas!! I rather pay more money for quality than have a free nasty meal! 

A good side effect of a thin crust pizza is it's enough to soak up the alcohol, but doesn't make you feel all bloated and nasty and lethargic, so you can still get into your skank dress and not feel like a sausage!

Excellent pizza! Good crust to sauce ratio. Plenty of toppings. Very cheesy just the way I like it. The service was prompt. The order came out fast. It's open late to which made it perfect after a concert at mandalay bay. Plenty of tvs too with sports on to add atmosphere.

Best vegan restaurant on the strip. The also have regular food but vegan meatballs, and vegan burger are amazing. They also make a vegan chocolate cake that is unbelievable. The waitress Megan rocks. She will recommend all the best tasting food."

Making food choices while is Vegas is daunting; there are so many great places to choose from. This pizza shop is actually inside a mall, which made it a little difficult to park and find at first. Once inside the mall, it was super easy to find and it stuck out.

The hostesses were very nice, as was the female server we had. The boy and I ordered salads...just kidding! What do you think we ordered? Pizza of course! We opted for the 18 inch 'Choked Pig' which had pesto aioli sauce, mozzarella cheese, sun dried tomatoes, a bacon and artichoke mix, then basil on top. This pizza was delicious; and HUGE! I think we ended up saving 4 pieces which equated to a whole 'nother meal which was awesome. This size pizza was roughly $30 but they also have a 12 inch for $19, or a 10 inch gluten free for $17. I would have loved to try the gluten-free, and it's awesome they actually offer it.

For dessert, we order the cannolis. The best I've ever had was up north in New England, but these were a close second! You can tell they know how to make em because they only fill them RIGHT after you order them. Lots of places keep them filled and this results in a soggy outside. These were yummy with pistachios, chocolate chips, and chocolate sauce and were nice and crunchy!

Oh, I also had a Restaurant.com voucher and we were able to use it. I think we ended up having to order a coffee or something so we could reach the certain amount of money we were supposed to spend, then we got a certain amount off. Pretty cool! They are very willing to accept anything from Restaurant.com. Made the meal EVEN cheaper!
We came here after seeing One.  The food lacked flavor.  In particular the marinara sauce was bitter and lacked salt.  I think i will skip this place next time at Mandalay Bay for a show.
Great place friendly staff fresh food had fun when we went to eat there. Pizzas were big but good and chicken tenders are great I like the pizza and beer with sports theme

If they had used the word, "pizza" in the name of this establishment, it would be a food felony in any jurisdiction.

I'm pretty sure the waitress silently mouthed, "I'm sorry" as she placed our large pie on the table.

If you regularly eat disgusting pizza and aren't bothered, you will not have any problems and will enjoy the high quality pizza they serve here.

This place is inside Mandalay Bay Hotel . Its nice . They have a music player you can request music to listen to . The server is helpful . There pizza is good and really big . The alcohol drinks are pretty strong . The kids meal is good came with meal and a side order and drink for 10 .  Are bill  came out to 100 with food and appetizer and drinks . The food is good but can be pricly

A rarity in Vegas: A fun spot that's not too spendy and a damn good value. Had the angel hair with salmon and the piece of fish was as well cooked as you'll ever find and it was high quality, too. Nice, casual beer and wine list. The kind of place you run out to for a quick bite if you're ever on a three-hour layover ... and a place I'll get to on every trip to Vegas from here on out.

Slice of Vegas became our regular visit while in Vegas. We were fortunate that they were at Mandalay Bay - it made the visit a quick one! 

Over three visits, we had Mama's Garlic Bread spread with pesto, Buffalo pizza, Barbecue pizza, basil pesto fettucini, the pomodoro rigatoni, and the chocolate cheesecake.

All Vegan.

All prepped on a separate line from their other items with meat.

All really, I mean REALLY, good.  

Oh, and really great moscow mules.  

We are so grateful for this spot since it made dining in Vegas very pleasurable. 

Aside from the food and their specialty menu, the comfort here along with the engaging staff makes SOV a favorite Vegas spot in my book!

Before leaving for Vegas last week, I did a quick Google "Vegan in Vegas", and am really glad I did.  This little gem is in Mandalay Bay up by the shops.  They have a separate vegan menu that does not limit you to just pizza.  As I am a die hard pizza fan, I had to have the personal pan.  This is one large pie! The crust is paper thin and to die for.  They put on  just the right amount of garlic and Daiya cheese. Since I polished off the whole thing, its a good thing I had to walk back to my hotel. 

I have been to Vegas before and ate a lot of Subway. This time, I had better options almost everywhere I went.  I saved a copy of the menu so I can reminisce!  I did have to laugh when the waiter came to take our order and I ordered off the vegan menu, he actually said, "You know that's vegan, right?" Yes, my friend, that is why I plowed  through 2,957 tourists to get here before lunch!

I can still taste the garlic...

We came because we were suckered by a Groupon. I recommend checking Yelp reviews before buying. The hostess was nice and seated us promptly. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable. We ordered Wings, a 12" Four Cheese Truffle Pizza, and some Stone IPAs. The craft beer is awesome but at 9$ a pint it's nearly extortion. The wings were some of the nastiest things I've ever tasted and were left untouched without comment from the server, despite his acknowledging that we enjoyed our pizza. The pizza was good, but at 19$ for a 12 inch pizza, there are many stronger options in town. Tip, a Brita water filter cost 12$. Invest in one, your water is third world. 
Overall, this is one place I will avoid with every fiber of my being. 
Your TGI Fridays service cannot overcome your mediocre food, constant  skipping of music thirty seconds into a song and over playing of The Killers.

Very disappointing! :-(
Good food, but tons of problems!

1st, waitress almost skipped me for drink orders (she would've if I hadn't waved her down as she was leaving!)

2nd, I had to ask for a drink 2 separate times & still didn't get it until friend was like "he's still waiting for his drink!", so 3 times total!

3rd, friend ordered shrimp alfredo & it had ZERO shrimp ($2 increase!), so it was sent back only to be returned with a bunch of shrimp tails! It's in a wrap style, so shrimp tails should've totally been removed!

4th, the check was very clearly split up, but still charged wrong!

Not somewhere I'd recommend for groups. It might be ok for 1-3 people, but not sure...

I'm not a person to typically be harsh, but this was kinda ridiculous! I'd've given it a 1 star rating, but my food actually tasted good... But very overpriced!
$40 for a personal pizza & 2 martinis!

First time dining at Slice of Vegas. Love that they have a vegan menu as well as a great happy hour. Lots of options but was disappointed with our slice of pizza. We had the vegan buffalo edamame, vegan truffle fries, toasted ravioli and they were all delicious! Service was outstanding! We will definitely go back. We want to try their pasta options.

A nice stop for pizza or Italian food on your walk through the mall at Mandalay Bay. They have cozy black leather booths to have a romantic dinner. I tried the meatball sub and it was delicious! It had soft large meatballs that were well seasoned. The sub was also loaded with cheese. They added extra sauce on the side so it would not get soggy. The pepperoni pizza was also fresh and piping hot.

Fast and quick pizza at the pickup counter.  Food was reasonable.  Staff was very helpful and friendly.  For a quick bite to eat, stop by.  Not the best pizza I've had, but also it certainly was not the worst.  Atmosphere is casual and friendly.
Super good vegan pizza. They even have gardien vegan chicken and meatballs. Went back again today. Still amazing. I had a vegan meatball jalapeño onion and garlic pizza today. Delish

I was here during a family vacation with my kids.  I absolutely love this place for good, kid friendly food.  The appetizers were out super fast and the cheese with Italian sausage pizza was perfect for my family.

My waiter was really cool. He made most of our food choices. He kept the food flowing and our cups full. He helped us compare prices and serving sizes. He took this place to the next level.

We ordered Mama's Garlic Bread with Mozzarella. It was very yummy. It came as a serving of four. Four was more than enough to hold us over until the pizza arrived.

We also ordered a pizza. With the waiter advice, we ordered the 12" Sausage pizza. It was greasy as heck. It had small puddles all over it, but it was just so damn appetizing. It tasted like a oily heaven. We finished every slice of it.

We wanted to order the chocolate cake for dessert, but our wonderful waiter mentioned and recommended the Homemade Chocolate Chip Cookie with Vanilla Ice Cream and Caramel. drizzles, that wasn't on the menu. I decided to order it. It took about 10 minutes for us to get the cookie, but when we did get it, it looked delectable.

We tasted the cookie and it was so warm and gooey. We got maybe half way through the cookie before we discovered that the caramel was salted. Not only was the caramel salted, it was salty. It started to become very unbearable. It wasn't the best. I wish I had just ordered the Cake instead.

Once the lunch was over, my stomach fell. I had to rush to the restroom. Sorry, I couldn't think of a nice way to say it. My friend's stomach didn't start hurting until she got home, maybe 2 hours later. I believe it was the pools of grease mixed with the taste of the cookie.

I know it was sounds stupid, but it was worth it. We will definitely go back. Next time, we'll just  pour off some of the pizza grease and skip over the cookie.

The pizza was delish, we ordered in the short order by the slice area.  We had a slice of pepperoni and a slice of cheese.  I wouldn't say it's the absolute best, a place in Austin, and a place in Chicago take that title, but it was in the running for a solid 3rd!  I knocked off a star for price.  $5 for a slice is a little ridiculous, but I guess it's just another price you pay for a trip to Vegas, especially since a couple hours earlier I had the worst Vietnamese food in my life.  You can read that review here on yelp!

Had casual dinner here.  Service was excellent. Food was good.  I had cheese and truffle pizza - so yummy!  My husband had pasta with salmon, but salmon was dry.  Caesar salad was delicious.  Kids shared pasta with spicy marinara which was ok.   All in all a good casual meal.

Best pizza in Mandalay Bay and Mandalay Place. They are super clean and offer local and employee discounts. They have lunch specials everyday and is perfect for the convention goer. Your lunch fast is key her because they know how busy this casino is and how people want reliable and consistent food.

I might be biased because I'm from the Chicago area which is a mecca for great pizza pies so Slice of Vegas was just mediocre to me. Atmosphere was of course great being that the restaurant resides within the mall area of the Mandalay Bay. Still, food was just there to fulfill the formality of stifling hunger. Nothing real special that made the place unique.

I ordered the vegetarian pizza and it was very mediocre. I felt this place was overrated by many websites. The waitress was in such a hurry to serve and push us out. When she took the order I felt like I was taking a rapid fire quiz. Overall very unsatisfied experience for all the rave I had read about the place.

Really enjoyed this choice after a morning of walking the strip - wanted something simple and good and found it at Slice of Vegas. Was skeptical of the "NY Style" pizza advertised (I'm from Jersey).  Nonethless we ordered two personal pizzas (the meat one - and the Il Mangino). I was wholely impressed - I just loved the Il Mangino - the salad on top of a pie with prosciutto and ricotta was amazing. Our waitress let me try several of the beers on tap - recommending a few. All-in-all a great experience.

FYI, this is located in the Shops at Mandalay, across from LUSH.  It might be easier to get here via Luxor than the Mandalay parking garage..... 

I hit up this place with a Groupon in tow.  I was here on a mission -- try the vegan pizza.  Sat at the bar, ordered a (crazy expensive) beer, and ordered the 18" vegan "faux pie" pizza to share with the BF.  Pro tip: the 12" pizzas are TINY and a rip off at $20 each.  For $30, the 18" pizzas are still really pricey, but at least you can feed 4 people off of it. (Or two people with plenty to take home!)

The pizza was super tasty - good crispy crust, nice sauce, good vegan (Daiya) cheese to veg to crust ratio.  If I didn't have to fight my way through the hot mess that is trying to park at Mandalay Bay, and it weren't so expensive, I would eat here all the time! That said, I probably won't frequent this place due to those problems.
