They have a great selection of very expensive beers (I think the cheapest is a $6 bud light equivalent), but that's probably par for the course at a casino.  They have a few good quality drafts (Stone IPA!) and lots of good bottles.

They also have a few vegan/veganizable pasta options ($12+) and salads ($10).

Pizza was delicious leftover cold the next day, so if you're staying at Mandalay, just get the large and eat the rest when you're hungover then next morning.

Service was Ok, not lacking nor exceptional.  No restroom.  There are lots of TVs for sports watching (did you know there's a CrossFit Olympics?! that's what was on while I was there.  Nothing helps you work up an appetite like watching impossibly thin and muscled women doing 500 deadlifts and pullups, amirite??)

Met friends here for dinner.  I had the salmon, vegetables and french fries.  They were all great.  Service was good and the waitress was very attentive to us.  Cool restaurant.  The place was packed, but they got me seated quickly.  We spent a long time talking and eating but they never rushed us to finish and get out.  Classy place.

Food was good and price was as expected for a restaurant on the strip. Only issue was the manager was hitting on the hostess when we arrived. They appeared to be uncomfortable, they had to look around him (he was hunched over podium) to greet us. VERY unprofessional...

Slight wait for a table even though many were available. Found our server and overall service to be very good. The croutons on the salads were stale. Pizza looked to be on par with CPK, but the taste turned to be extremely bland. Bland like a frozen pizza. Again the service was good.
Good & cheap... Just how i like my pizza!! Had a slice before the show.. Perfect for on the go :)

I was SO excited for this place because I had a bad craving for pizza but I am vegan, so it wasn't something that's easy to come by! Unfortunately, I was really bummed out and disappointed by the time we left.

We ordered a few things, including the bruschetta, fettuccini with pesto and veggies (vegan), garlic bread (vegan), and lamb sliders. 

The waiter came back to our table and informed us that they ran out of lamb sliders and vegan cheese (daiya cheese). Needless to say, I didn't get my vegan pizza or cheese on my garlic bread. Apparently they get their shipments on Tuesdays, and we came on a Monday.

The food comes out, and we notice a few things. The bruschetta was a few soft pieces of bread with diced tomatoes...on the side. So that was interesting. We informed the waiter that they can take it back because we weren't going to pay $10 for what we got. The waiter replied with a really stern "That's how we make our bruschetta here." He ended up taking it back, but I'm not too sure if he removed it from the bill or not. 

I got my pesto fettuccini with artichoke, mushroom, sundried tomatoes and basil. It came with a rock hard piece of bread, maybe something that would have been better for the bruschetta if it weren't so stale. The fettuccini wasn't cooked all the way through. The pesto was really good, it's hard to find pesto as a vegan without any dairy in it so I'm glad I could get that at least. 

I forgot to mention that as he was taking our orders he asked if I wanted the garlic bread out at the same time as the entrees, I told him as soon as possible would be awesome. We got halfway through our meal by the time I realized he forgot to put the order in. We called him back to the table and sure enough he did forget. The garlic bread was good, but not $8 good. Like, good enough and probably similar prep in your kitchen within a few minutes. It came with 4 pieces of the same bread as the bruschetta. Like I previously said, soft sliced bread. There was pesto on top which had a good taste, and a whole head of garlic on the side that I must have been too dull to realize that maybe it was something that I had to put on the bread to literally make it garlic bread. 

Honestly, this place might have been really good because the menu seems awesome but I won't be going here again unfortunately.

Love this place! 

Great happy hour, happy and helpful staff, and great vegan pizza! 

Made our own pizza- vegan style :) they have an entire vegan menu and great atmosphere. 
I will be coming back here every time I am in Vegas for pie and happy hour beer.

The GF pizza is amazing!!! 
Friendly staff and fast service! 
By far one of the better Italian foods I've had. Spaghetti was perfect

We had a restaurant.com certificate so we decided to take our friend here for his birthday before the Counting Crows concert at Mandalay Bay beach. I made a reservation but I think it was kind of slow. When we walked up, it looked completely crazy but I think a big party was waiting to be sat. 

Our server was friendly and efficient so no complaints there. We ordered calamari and an 18" ham and pineapple pizza. Everything was really yum. The ONLY complaint I have is that the pizza could've used a bit more cheese. The crust though, omg. I LOVE thin crust pizza but hate how sometimes it gets too soggy or other times it's too crispy like a cracker. This crust was just perfect. It was crispy on the bottom, but soft and chewy on top. If the pizza had more cheese, it would have been AMAZING and deserving of 5 stars. I'd like to go back and next time request extra cheese.

Also, I got the berry martini and it was TINY and tasted like juice. At $10 a pop, I'd skip the drinks.

Slice of Vegas is basically an overpriced pizza joint inside a trendy mall BUT the pizza is delicious! New York style thin crust pizza that has tons of flavor. BEST time to go is during happy hour, $2 a slice for cheese and the slices are HUGE! Combine that with the discounted beer and you will be returning again!

Decent, for "NY style" pizza this far away from NY. Slice is in the Shops of Mandalay Bay (the connector mall between Mandalay and Luxor) and next door to Burger Bar. Generally, I'd say if you're trying to decide where to eat Burger Bar is way better but I had lunch there recently and wanted something different. 

The interior is nice enough, with mostly booth style seating that should accommodate groups well. For once the person seating me didn't ask "oh, just one? Do you want to sit at the bar?" which was nice, because no I do not want to sit at the bar. The menu is your standard Italian offering - lasagna, build your own pasta and pizza. Because it's called "Slice" and not "Pasta" I had pizza.

First, the crust is really good - nice and crisp with a little chew. I'll agree with a few other reviewers that their sauce is pretty bland - it's just lacking in flavor, period so plan to use the shakers of oregano and hot peppers. Overall, it wasn't as good as the slice I had at Sal's in NY but it was better than the garbage at Famous Original Ray's so a-ok.

Service was a-ok too. My food came quickly but I wasn't checked on after - the standard "single diner" treatment again.....

Located inside the Mandalay Bay Hotel (2nd floor), this place is a chic sports bar serving pizzas, burgers and other Italian food items at reasonable prices.  Menu is relatively extensive for a sports bar and certain food items like "curry pizza" sound pretty interesting!

So, 2-3 months ago (sometime in June 2013) two friends and I went in for late night and shared a truffle pizza, a burger, 2 cups of Tuscan soup, and roasted cauliflower appetizer, all of which tasted not bad at all!  I loved the roasted cauliflower, and the boyfriend loved the pizza.  The soup was sorta bland and too watery, though.  Service was prompt and friendly.  Total paid just about $70 including tax and tips, and all three of us walked out with full, happy stomachs.

First, this place is in a perfect location, right in the middle of the Mandalay Place shops.  Great for pulling in people who want a quick bite.  
For this reason, they rip you off with a charge of 7 bucks for a simple slice of pizza.  Didn't notice this until I had already placed my order and that is on me. But I also added a side salad for almost 4 bucks, which I thought would come in a nice container with it all dressed up. No, it comes in a plastic bowl, just some greens thrown in with dressing on the side. Throw in a drink, with lousy options in their dispensers, and you've got an expensive quick bite for almost 16 bucks.

The pizza wasn't too bad, though nothing special and the salad was too plain.  It was in a place to kill some time, but as much as I love this area, I will not return to eat here.

We were starving and wanted pizza. We got the bbq chicken pizza (on half, just cheese on the other half) and two side salads. The Caesar salad was bland. The pizza crust was nice and crispy but the topping was just ok. Like I said, we were starving so we ate it. And $15 for a beer with a take home glass is a bit pricey.  We won't go back. However, our server Jaqueline was very nice and friendly. She was definitely the best part of this place.

The short: Not craving pizza at this pizza place? Try their burger and meatballs.

We wanted to stop by at another restaurant, but the wait was over 40 minutes at 9 pm, and we were so very hungry. So, we decided to mosey on over to Slice of Vegas. We were tempted by the stall offering small slices, but decided that we wanted to enjoy the meal sitting down.

+ Meatballs: delicious with rich flavors doused in a marinara sauce.
+ Immortal Burger: half pound of meat. Pretty good and is pretty big for one person.

The meal was over $30 for two people, and for that price, I had hoped for fantastic food. Was it? Nah. Just a typical meal. The service was fine, and the booth was comfortable. I think it must be a Vegas thing for food to be so expensive. 

*I know, I know. We didn't even order pizza, haha

Note: there are no bathrooms inside the restaurant. They're in a hallway shared by all the other tenants

I had read some mixed reviews for this place, which is true of many places I have visited.  In town for a conference at the Mandalay Bay, we wanted to try someplace inside the hotel complex and avoid walking in the 100 degree plus heat. The menu looked pretty good, so why not give it a try?

The food was pretty good, and I would go back again if I find myself in Las Vegas again.  I had the soup with sausage in it - sorry, forgot the name - and it is a much better version that the similar soup from Olive Garden.  The cheesesteak sandwhich was tasty, although a couple of pieces of the steak were a bit chewy.  Nice thin fries with the meal.

The others had pasta, which you can build by picking the pasta, sauce, and proteins, and they looked very good.  Like any good Italian restaurant, there was more than enough pasta for a meal.

Slice of Vegas offers desserts, and they sound pretty good. However, we were too full from the meal.  Maybe next time.

I would go back again and try the pizza because the selection is fairly wide.

Loved this place! The vegan pizza was so good. My husband and I shared the buffalo one.  There is a huge assortment of beers but most are bottle, unfortunately.  We alse had some appetizers like the vegan garlic bread, vegan wings and vegan cauliflower. Delicious!  Definitely a must for any vegan in Vegas if you want some good bar type food!

This place is just ok. Just like all eateries in Vegas, it's overpriced for the did you get. One sandwich, one pasta plate and two kids meals was about 70. To make the visit worst our server seemed like he didn't want to be there or seemed annoyed at doing his job. My cup was empty for almost 15 minutes before he noticed. It was a Tuesday evening and not very busy. Will not return or recommend.

This vegan menu is so on point! No pizza eater left behind!!!! Great spot to drink and indulge in pizza , with a vegan!! Lucky this gem was right upstairs from the Luxor where I was staying and right across from Lush!, I mean really what more can a gal ask for !??!! Their beer menu is just as legit as their vegan line up! Garlic fries ! Buffalo vegan pizza ! Vegan ranch ! And not to mention they have vegan dessert!! Their peanut butter chocolate cake is to die for and you wouldn't believe it's VEGAN !! Staff is fast and friendly and very attentive. Food was hot and fresh and the over all atmosphere is cool, good music and a full bar.

Diet Pepsi. I am a Pepsi fan always..Diet Pepsi is my favorite, it was there and they made Veggie burger real nice and side fries

Service was good, but that is all I can probably say about this place, because the food wasn't.

I ordered the Tuscana Sausage Soup, the potatoes in it weren't cooked/boiled all the way, it was sort of too salty, but the sausage in there was pretty good.

Build your own Pasta seemed like a good choice besides Pizza, but I was wrong. I chose spaghetti, bologonese sauce (meat sauce), meatballs and mushrooms for my pasta. It came out to around $22 - 24 for the pasta and those two added ingredients. While the spaghetti and sauce tasted fine, it wasn't hot, it was semi warm, and everything else that came with it. The meat balls tasted like frozen meat balls from the market, it was also warm like the pasta.

All in all, I didn't like the pasta, maybe I will opt for a slice of pizza instead.

I've gone here twice. The first time, I was extremely happy, because it was Vegan Pizza Day, and their vegan pizzas were all half off! Around $10 instead of $20. Their extensive vegan pizza menu is very exciting and delicious. 
However, without the half-off deal, I'm not very excited about this place. It doesn't seem like a good deal. But to be fair it is a restaurant on the strip.

This is a hidden gem located in the Mandalay Place shops. They are reasonably priced, have exceptional pizza, meatballs and typical Italian fare, which are all freshly prepared and at an awesome price point. The staff and barkeeps are always on their game. They have a great selection of beers as well, after all, is there anything better than pizza & Beer! 

This casual establishment is a great alternative to the $200 a plate high end  Italian restaurants you will find on the Strip! Save money and eat well my friends!
Don't bother unless your starved. Fairly average at best slice. Probably good if you trying to get some filler before drinking cuz you'll get it quick. Otherwise pass.

Stopped by here randomly for lunch this past weekend and was pleasantly surprised!  The pizza was actually really good.  My 3 cousins and I split a large pizza with half/half toppings and it came out exactly as we ordered.  It was pretty greasy but c'mon... it's pizza!  It's supposed to be greasy!  

The crust was really good as well.  Nice and Crispy!  We also had the Calamari to start which was also pretty good.  

I got to try a bit of the bloody mary which was 'mehh' to 'just ok'.  Service was decent although we did have to ask for our sides of ranch twice.  

I would definitely come back here!
Good place. We really liked the free fries deal for checking in and the $30 for $15 deal on Yelp. Pizza was about a 7 out of 10. Good for the area

Great options for a gluten free diet!  Food is great and service is wonderful.

If you like spicy wings, order the atomic, extra spicy.  These will be so hot, they will make you cry.

A great place for food, fun, drinks! Great food, strong and cheap beer/drinks, and in a hidden place within the hotel. Will defiantly go back. The service was good and they offer vegan options as well for people who prefer that. Check it out!

Worst pizza I have ever had. The manager Anthony was so rude after messing up my order twice! How ridiculous, he didn't even treat any of the employees with an ounce of respect for their mistakes. Horrible corrupted company. Never returning to this establishment

This place is a must go to while in Vegas! They have a whole vegan menu that is elaborate & delicious! The truffle style fries, the Salad romelias (one of the best salads I have ever had), buffalo pizza & pesto pasta is to die for! So freaking good we went three times while in Vegas!
My one complaint was that my vegan pasta came with parmesan cheese on it. When I asked the waitress said it wasn't cheese. I looked closer & it was melting like cheese. So I asked again & sure enough. Cheese. It took over 30 minutes to get my pasta back the right way. That was a huge bummer. 
Other than that mix up, it is an amazing vegan paradise!

Looking for a fresh, laid back bar scene in Vegas without the flashy lights and cigarette smoke? In that case, definitely check out Slice of Vegas. This little gem is hidden in the Shoppes at Mandalay Bay and we wandered in during their happy hour from 3 to 6p. If you have ever been to Vegas you know that prices are all over the place and the majority of places range on the pricier end. Looking at the menu, SOV is also one of those places but during happy hour, all drafts, slices, and select apps are half off. SCORE. 

We posted up at the bar and had two bartenders during our venture here - both were lively, super friendly, and attentive. We order two slices of pepperoni and sausage plus their mild wings and a few beers. The slices were large and foldable - not quite NY style huge but close enough for me. The sausage had great flavor and the crust was just slightly crispy... exactly how I like it. The wings were fantastic. Period. Crispy outside. Juicy inside. Mild sauce had great flavor without being too spicy. In fact, there were so good we ordered a second batch and stuffed ourselves full. 

This bar had a great local selection as well - plenty of Las Vegas brews as well as a handful of domestics and other well- known craft breweries. Looking at the menu, I was tempted to order the Miles 10 Meat pizza but didn't have the stomach to do it.... seriously, I was so damn full. But the Miles 10 is cheese and 10 meats. Yes 10 MEATS and no stupid veggies to ruin the heart attack pie. Topped with proscuitto, capicola, pork, bacon, and more, this is definitely going to be a go to spot of mine next time I'm in Vegas just for that pizza. 

The place is pretty small (but hey, it's located inside shops) and I hated to see it closed at 11pm. Maybe it was just the time of year we were there, I'm not sure. But all in all, if you are looking to grab a beer and some grub, this is definitely a spot to go - heads up, be sure to go during happy hour. The wings we received, while delicious, we $5.50 for six of them meaning they are $11 normally. Holy hell. But hey, when in Vegas....

Slice! is set up like a NY-style Italian restaurant -- or at least what I think of as one -- with plush red leather cushions, lots of wood, and slate grey walls.  There's plenty of pizza and pasta on the menu, of course.  The food's pretty good, although I think the pasta soundly trumped the pizza.  The menu of bottled beer is surprisingly huge.  The staff is friendly and patient.

Server and host was super nice to us! 
We were seated right away, but it took quite some time before our orders were taken. 

I think the pizza was overrated. It wasn't, "THE BEST" but good enough!

Service: 5/5
Food Quality: 3.5/5
Cleanliness: 5/5

Watched the Super Bowl here and the food was fantastic. The pizza, lasagna, and meatballs were crazy good (not to mention the wings and ribs). We had to come back for more lasagna as well as the pizza. Hidden secret here; the Brownie Cookie Sundae. My wife has eaten these wherever she can and says this is the best ever. Take a few minutes to make but worth the wait! Don't pass SOV up!

Gary was a great server steering us to try the cannoli and it was fresh and better than most. The filling could be more dense but it hit the spot regardless. Pizza is NYC style and good. A tad expensive which is the norm on the strip. Speedy service. Would go again.

Delicious drunk food but extremely pricey even for the Strip.

Typical "American" style pizza.  Not NYC.  Not Chi Town.  The pies are, dare I say, Pizza Hut on steroids.  Chewy, bready crust slathered with sauce, generously topped with quality ingredients, finished with an almost excessive amount of cheese.   Over the top in true Vegas Strip fashion.

Sauces are bold and flavorful.  The pies are well seasoned and not excessively oily thanks to the fresh (not processed) cheeses.  The "Miles 10 Meat" pizza with its outstanding three meat bolognese sauce and toppings of prosciutto, pepperoni pancetta, sausage, bacon, mortadella and cappacola toppings is a meat lovers delight.  The "Mushroom Ragu" is another standout.  The perfect mix of earthy mushrooms paired with creamy, melted, fresh mozzarella.

All is not perfect, the crust in the middle of every pie so far has been soft from excessive sauce.  It becomes the stuff of legend if you like to indulge on cold pizza the next morning.

You can build your own pie from an extensive list of ingredients.  Slices are also offered along with salads, pastas, and sandwiches.

Service is fast and friendly.

Very good selection of beers on tap or by the bottle.  Prices are higher than it's Mandalay Place neighbors.

Strip indulgence comes at a price:  $19 for a 12" pie, $30 for an 18"; build your own starting at $15 (12"), $23 (18") adding $2 per topping.

Recommended.
Easy to access from Mandalay Bay or Luxor hotels. Thin crust pizza, but on the expensive side. An 18 inch pie runs you 34 bucks (after tax) for specialty. All in all, a decent pizza.

Pizza was pretty delicious! We built our own family size pizza. I think the personal should have a different name though because my mom and I probably could've ate the 12" easier than the 18". Service was good. It's a cool looking spot in a not so cool looking area. Beer was tasty. I went with something different on draft that seemed interesting. The plates of pasta and salads and sandwiches coming out of the kitchen looked pretty good too!
Very nice and convinient in Mandalay Place.  Pizza thin and tasty.  Little expensive.  Good menu choices of appetizers and sandwhiches.  Very good drink menu.

A side salad, truffle fries, vegan supreme pizza, vegan BBQ pizza, cauliflower alfredo, and cinnamon pizza dough balls. Phew, lots of food. 

First off, as said by probably hundreds of people already, SoV is an awesome place for dinner for a group of vegans, vegetarians, and meat eaters. Everyone seemed pretty happy with their meal. 

SoV's pretty decent. They messed up by giving us a buffalo vegan pizza instead of BBQ, but they were great about it and gave us a pair of free desserts, which they didn't have to do.

The truffle fries were super truffly and, best of all, free with check in (it says garlic parmesan but our waiter let us switch it up.) The two pizzas were good in their own ways. I can't really say which I preferred -- they were both good sizes, but the supreme was definitely more substantial with toppings. Above average tasting pizzas, but nothing earth-shattering. 

I was most intrigued by the cauliflower alfredo before ordering, and it turned out to be pretty good. I think everyone agreed it was decent (or better), but the strong rapini and garlic flavors were more reminiscent of Asian food than anything else to some who tried it. I enjoyed it, but it didn't remind me of alfredo. If you've got an open mind, give it a try. I don't know that I'd recommend it too highly with it costing $20 and giving me DEATHLY gas the next morning, but I enjoyed it. 

The dough balls were alright. They'd be really good with a scoop of ice cream. Half of the balls we got were still raw in the middle, but the ones that weren't were fluffy goodness. 

Our waiter was attentive but not overly so, and the beer selection is decent -- both winners in my book. 

What wasn't a winner was the magician who shouted for half our meal and was nothing but a distraction. My dude, we just want to eat and talk. After awhile he found some kids to entertain.. that was nice. Win-win. 

As I said already, SoV is a safe choice for meat eaters and non meat eaters alike in Las Vegas -- and it doesn't suck. Worth a look when you're staying at Mandalay Bay.

It's probably 3 star pizza, but I arrived hammered and usually pizza eaten in that state always tastes one star better to me.

We ordered the garlic bread with pesto ($8) and the family sized 10 mile meat ($29.95).

The garlic bread was decent, though I like my pesto spread a bit chunkier where you can distinctly taste the pine nuts and parmesan. Overall, not a bad starter.

The pizza was good, not the greatest in town, but worth coming back to (especially with the restaurant.com deal $25 off when you spend $37.50. Can't beat that!). I like my crust all around to be a bit more chewy and airy...the rest of the pizza was very good, ample toppings. 

The service was friendly and attentive and the restaurant was clean. 

+Bonus points for the parmesan condiment on the table being real parmesan (as opposed to the crap they hand you at a pizza chain).

I would return, not at full price, but def with the restaurant.com deal...it was a score.
Was ok pizza. The employees were friendly and helpful with their suggestions. Il Mangino was pretty tasty the second pizza which was basically a build your own margherita was so-so.
Just ok, I got the gluten free veggie pizza my buddy got the helldorado, both were just ok, not the best you've had or worst. I would recommend going to pizza 5 50 at aria!

We were enjoying the pool and beach spa and ordered 2 pizzas a pepperoni and a chicken.. pizzas are huge the slices are pretty big.. maybe too greasy but overall good pizza.. each pizza is like $23 but one is enough for 4..

Place was cool the first time we went, but we decided to go out of our way again but what was waiting for us, changed it all... 2 hostesses we're sitting, talking and when i asked about the vegan menu, i got sarcastic looks and an even stupider answer. So therefore, i will never return unless i'm starving and happen to be in the Mandalay Bay. Just cuz someone is vegan doesn't mean you should treat them different.
Very friendly service with very mediocre pizza.  THe caesar salad was fresh and yummy but the pizza was caca.

Again, yelp reviews didn't disappoint! Took advantage of the $15 for $30 and the free French fry appetizer. Service was friendly and food delivery prompt! We had Pizza, salad and the spicy edamame. Only giving 4 stars because the free French fry app was not good. It was crazy greasy and undercooked. I'd definitely be back for Pizza and the dishes that the table next to us ordered! They looked delish and the people devoured them

Touristy sports bar, but the food was tasty and didn't seem frozen and reheated, like most touristy stops. The house Chianti was good but needed to be chilled a bit. I'm sure there are better places to go on the Strip, but this works fine for a convenient meal.
Gotta have the truffle pizza!..it's sooo good. I love the location of the pizza place also. So easy to get to and not to mention we've always had great service here even just for pick up!

Stopped here while shopping for a quick bite, wasn't too hungry for dinner...
We for caprese salad, bread with garlic, and meatballs. Waitress was super friendly, quick, abd knowledgable when helping to pick out beers to try...
Caprese salad was great, and very large.
Meatballs were an unexpected treat! They were absolutely delicious!!!! The bread with the garluc5 spread was also great... 
Not a random pizza spot, the chef was on point!!!
Can't wait to come back here again....
Pizza here made my night... Good people and great pizza. They can do anything you ask with a great attitude!
I'm so hungry today I need something good , just order ribeye with potatoes . Omg the flavor was so good , the meat tender and juice , just perfect .
They get 5 stars from me just for the vegan menu.  Beyond that, the staff was prompt and attentive and the food was delivered hot and quickly.

Slice of Vegas is located in the Shoppes at Mandalay between Luxor and The Mandalay Bay Hotels.  NY style thin crust pizza is their specialty.  I must say I ordered the slice a little well done and it was cooked to perfection.  A little crispy, and just the right temp.

Lost of different beers on tap and even more in the bottle for you beer drinkers.  Nice TV's to watch games but no sound, and the location are the only things preventing this place from being five stars.  If you happen to stay at either Luxor or Mandalay, you should come here!
I didn't know Slice of Vegas has the largest vegan friendly menu in town! The food is scrumptious, vegan cheesecake is a fantastic dessert and the staff is the coolest!!!  Love it

We are here on March 27th, first night there, we got there a couple hours before eating and was preparing ourselves for a big night out! We were originally going to the burger bar next door but due to the long wait we decide to try this place. So, With the idea in our heads about eating burgers, we all decide to eat the burgers there. Everyone who had a burger threw up. 5 Of us. Also it was my 21st birthday at midnight so throwing up 2 minutes before my birthday not even able to have my first legal drink from bad meat really was the icing on the cake. 
Thanks.

Great little find during our stay in Vegas. Garlic parm fries were perfectly cooked and crispy. They were served with a killer pesto aioli that was the perfect compliment. 

We opted to share the Il Mangino pizza for lunch and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The toppings were generous, but not overloaded which made for a well balance pie. We especially like the ricotta that they use. 

Our server was excellent and attentive.  We'd definitely recommend this restaurant to others and will be back ourselves.
Best new York slice in town especially for the price. Awesome beer selection to boot.

Mmmmmm big pizza slices with huge pepperoni slices . Hot and fresh and greasy mmmmm ate before fantasy show . The 5 dollar pizza slice beats the 8 dollar popcorn at the shows . Did not have time to sit down and eat so we took a slice to go

I've been to Slice of Vegas multiple times and for two reasons: 1) it's a convenient option to eat at right before a concert at HoB and 2) restaurant.com offers up a $25 off when you spend $37.50 certificate, making Slice easier on the wallet. 

Here's what I've had most recently:

PASTA FAGIOLI SOUP ($4.95): Progresso's canned vegetarian minestrone soup packs more flavor than what Slice of Vegas is serving up. I added Parmesan cheese, pepper, and salt to my petite bowl of soup to no avail. There simply was no saving this soup. 1/5

MEATLESS MEATBALL SUB ($13.95): Dripping with marinara, the sub was falling apart before my first bite. I'm already a messy eater- I don't need help. Meatballs were tasty though. 3/5
PRO TIP: You get to add a flavor (such as garlic-rosemary) to your fries at no cost! Fries were on point.

 ZEPPOLI ($7.95): Truthfully, I enjoyed Olive Garden's Zeppoli better. The dough was thick and super chewy, giving my jaw a workout. The added Cinnamon was an unexpected flavor, but the zeppoli just failed to deliver. 2/5

PRICE: On our last visit, dinner for two (even with 2 draft beers) came to $13 pre-tip after the restaurant.com gift certificate. 5/5, especially for the Strip!

AMBIANCE: It's usually noisy here, especially when you're seated towards the back of the restaurant. Decor sticks to a red and black palette and the restaurant has fun fixtures on the wall (like a bike!). Music goes between country and low-key rock. 4/5

CUSTOMER SERVICE: Average. 3.5/5

PROS: Vegan Menu and affordability
CONS: No bathroom in the restaurant, mostly underwhelming food

Return Visit?
For now, I've had my fill of Slice of Vegas. The only thing that has impressed me are the fries.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #29

Items Selected:
Pepperoni New York Slice - $3.95 
Mamma's Garlic Bread - $8.90 with Mozzarella - Italian bread infused with roasted garlic, brushed with more roasted garlic butter and accompanied with a roasted garlic head
'Choked Pig - $18.95 - Pesto aioli sauce, Mozzarella cheese, sun dried tomatoes, bacon and artichoke mix finished with chopped basil and a whiskey sour cream
Zeppoli - 8.45 with Caramel - Golden fried pizza dough balls tossed in a mix of cinnamon and sugar, drizzled with chocolate

Located in the Shops at Mandalay Bay close to the entrance of Luxor it was largely a matter of their participation in restaurant.com's discount program that led me to Slice of Vegas and having received $100 in gift certificates to the website nearly one year prior it was with $25 towards a minimum $37.50 purchase that I sat down at a rounded booth made for four, the USA vs. Brazil basketball game and Dallas Cowboys preseason matchups playing on televisions beneath the din of some forgettable pop songstress.  Billed as a space for "Fun Italian Dining" with a take-out station to the left and bar-full of craft brews tucked behind it was just moments before 7:00pm that I took my seat and with the majority of diners tourists with small children the scene was decidedly rambunctious, a duo of servers including the young woman in charge of my table clearly struggling to keep pace with large orders despite efficient back-servers helping to bus tables and refill water.  Unapologetically overpriced like the majority of Strip-side dining it was only after a few questions regarding the possibility of a half-and-half pizza (no for specialties, okay if you build-your-own) plus  a description of the daily specials that I eventually placed an overzealous order and with an appetizer slice of foldable New York style thin-crust quickly arriving from the exterior facing window my first taste was quite favorable, the gentle crunch and pliable crumb on par with that at Pop-Up or Secret beneath a subtly sweet sauce and bubbling fresh mozzarella.  Moving next to mundane garlic bread that no Italian mother would likely lay claim to it was fast on the thick loaf's heels that my gourmet pizza would arrive and with ample toppings showing a keen eye for balance over the nearly cracker thin crust the meal was soon back on good footing, the punchy sour cream a particularly inspired pairing to mellow the marinated artichokes and herbal topnotes from the pesto and fresh basil.  At this point just shy of my gift-certificate minimum I was left with a decision between the restaurant's signature chocolate cake, a glorified brownie sundae, or balls of fried dough and opting for the later with a sidecar of caramel I'm confident to say I made the right choice - each of the seven cue-ball sized doughnuts perfectly crisp and virtually oiless beneath a hefty shake of cinnamon sugar as the duo of sauces jockeyed for position on the tongue's already overcrowded sweetness receptors.

Dramatically overpriced without the benefit of a 2/3 discount but featuring a more than competent slice along with the best Zeppoli I've yet to find in Las Vegas there are certainly worse options for quick casual dining on the strip and although neither service nor setting are likely to win any awards I'd happily come back to explore more of the menu if armed with another coupon, a distinct likelihood considering the general dearth of quality on restaurant.com ever since the rest of Mandalay Bay pulled out several months ago.

I walked by and what caught my attention was their sign advertising a full vegan menu! Awesome! My friends and I went in and there was something for everyone! I am so happy at how many vegan options they had! It was very good too, everyone was satisfied!!!

This had to be the highlight of the 'between Mandalay and Luxor' food walk.  In fairness we only took it to-go so not reviewing on table service.

Yes, it's $4-5 slices of pizza - you're on the strip, get over it.  

The food was fantastic - good size slices, excellent cook on the crust, well seasoned and tasty.  It's pizza, it's not hard to do it right and they have done that.

The setup/service at the to-go counter is a disgrace.  If it's 12 to 1am on the strip and you're one of only two places still open in this walkway you need to get your staffing right.  I mean, who isn't plowing down pizza at that time anyway!   ONE poor guy there Saturday night doing the order taking, cashier duty, grab the slices, warm the slices in the oven, box them up and get them out to the customers.  And there were at least 10 folks waiting when we arrived.

If not for poor staffing judgment, would probably be 5 stars!

If you order one thing from this place, I highly HIGHLY recommend Not Your Mamma's Garlic Bread. It comes with a bulb of roasted garlic that you squeeze out the soften cloves and spread it on the toasty bread on top of the almond pesto. Perfection for my taste buds! http://bit.ly/2kssXHi

We also got an order of the Shoestring Sweet Potato Fries. It comes with options of seasoning. We went truffle style. I'm still undecided if I like the taste of truffle oil with sweet potato. This comes with a side of vegan ranch. http://bit.ly/2jXTjNG

The Back East Buffalo Pizza sounded unique to me. Gardein chick'n, celery, carrots, buffalo sauce and vegan ranch sounds like a good combination of flavors but I don't think I was digging it in pizza form as much as I thought I would. I think it was the pizza sauce mixed with those flavors. Doubt I would order this again but I could see how others might like it. One thing I did appreciate was the thin crust. http://bit.ly/2kTQFNb

Service was great! Our waitress was friendly and helpful. Food came out quick. I'd probably come back to check out the other items on the vegan menu. I mean, their two vegan desserts sound amazing: Chocolate cake with peanut butter frosting and fried pizza dough balls tossed in cinnamon and sugar. Yes please :)

We had a free $25 restaurant.com certificate and chose to use it at Slice for no other reason than we saw it on the list of restaurants and recognized the name.  It was a Saturday night and the place wasn't too packed.  There were a few booths available but they sat us in one of those booth/chair combo tables where a bunch of tables are lined up in front of one long booth.  I explain this because it becomes an issue later on.  

We ordered drinks (good selection of beers.  My husband was happy to get Magic Hat #9).  We chose Mamma's Garlic Bread as an appetizer.  When it came out, the runner was going around to each table asking if it was theirs.  Ahh!  I want my garlic bread, come here!  Served on a small pan with a roasted garlic head.  Interesting and kind of waste of a garlic head if you ask me but I'm only a moderate garlic lover, not a garlic-loving freak who needs a side of garlic head lol.  But the bread was pretty good.  

For dinner I ordered a bowl of pasta(bilities) (haha, cute.  Yes, I'm easily amused) and chose rigatoni with the spicy marinara sauce.  The server asked me if I wanted to add a side of meatballs or a salad and I said no.  My husband ordered the meatball hero which came with fries, and he substituted regular for garlic shoestring fries.  I'm so glad he did - they were delicious.  Anyway, my meal arrived with 2 meatballs on either side of it.  I didn't order meatballs so I just scooped them off on to a side plate.  (Not a vegetarian, I just don't like things that are too "meaty".  heh.  I just walked into a bunch of one-liners, I'm sure.  But you know what I mean.)  The server apologized and offered to bring me a new bowl of pasta if I was a vegetarian.  I told her there was no need for a new bowl, but I was glad she offered. 

The marinara sauce wasn't bad but it tasted as though a lot of red pepper was the only reason it was "spicy" and not regular marinara sauce.  My husband enjoyed his meatball hero.  For dessert we had the sack of dough balls.  I thought these were going to be lighter, like zeppoles.  They could have been a lot more enjoyable if they had more cinnamon/sugar sprinkled on the outside and they didn't pour so much sea salt over the chocolate/hazelnut sauce. 

We're nearing the end of our meal and they seat a family of five right next to us... in a table of 4.  They did this on the side we were sitting on so a young boy wound up sitting RIGHT next to me as though we were in the same group.  This really didn't bother me except I thought that if I were that family I'd be pretty pissed that one of the kids has to sit in between two different tables.  We were almost done - they could have had the family wait 10 minutes to put two tables together.  And of course, I had to slide to the other side of my table to exit, which was only a small inconvenience but just made me annoyed that they would consider this setup in the first place.  

The prices were not over the top, but you just don't get enough "wow" for your money here.  A single cheese slice (which I didn't try) is $4.95.  The decor is very hip and environment is pretty chill.  There is an internet juke box and the music playing was very good.  Some classic rock and you could tell the bartenders skip over songs they don't like.  It could be good or bad depending on who's listening.  

Overall we probably wouldn't choose to come back unless we were in Mandalay Bay with others who wanted to try this place.  It was a decent one-time thing.  If you're there and you're feeling it, give it a shot.

We stumbled into Slice of Vegas after having a not so great experience while trying to get a table at Burger Bar next door. I'm so glad we came here! I got a Philly cheesesteak and my husband got the Immortal burger. My husband referred to his burger as "life changing" and my cheesesteak tasted like it was really from Philly. The service was fast and great as well, we got in and out in under an hour and 15 min.  We also took some cannoli's to go that were really good.

We came here around Midnight after attending a bday party and the Skyfall rooftop at Delano.  We wanted something quick and good.  Basically this place is so good.  For $5 a slice and the slice is huge!  probably equivelant to 2 slices of pizza.  I got the hawaiin and my bf got the cheese.  It was so good!  Check it out for cheap bite and quick eats!
The service sucked. Took forever for our pizza to come out. Not once did the server check in with us.

Pizza wasn't all that very disappointed Chicago has the best pizza. Burger was amazing tho and the jerk Fries delicious. There was a pesto aioli sauce that comes with the garlic parm fries was AMAZING threw that on my burger as well. Super surprised the pizza was horrible.

A place on the Strip with a Vegan menu?! I thought I was in heaven, alas, the vegan pizza is sub sub par. I pay extra to have the pizza veganized yet I end up with way less 'cheese' than others, where's the justice?! Don't bother with it, I'd rather have frozen Amy's from whole foods than this. Step up your vegan pizza game Slice O Vegas! Still giving three stars since at least they're trying :/

We needed something quick to eat. My husband just got off work and met me at Mandalay Bay for a concert. I remembered they put in a pizza by the slice place, so this is where we headed. It was quick but  wasn't cheap which I knew it wouldn't be. I had a cheese slice, he got pepperoni. It's pretty basic pizza that you get at any shopping mall. It was edible and works if you're drunk or hungry but I wouldn't choose to eat here or recommend it.

Pizza was excellent.  Our server, Bianca, was pretty and very sweet.   She helped us with our food allergy questions which we appreciated. The large pizza is really big, if it had been pan pizza instead of thin NY style we would have left a lot on the table.  The location is nice as well, between the casinos and lots of shopping.   All indoors to stay out of the heat is nice too.  Service was a little slow at the end of the meal but not because of Bianca, she was working her tail off all around us, I think they were just short staffed.  

We would easily eat here again on another visit.

Always love stopping by Slice of Vegas when I'm on the Luxor/MGM side of the strip. Great place to go watch the game (esp if you're sports betting) and grab a pizza pan to share. The truffle fries are so perfect, and my boyfriend and I enjoyed their BBQ chicken pizza!

They have some great happy hour deals, but unfortunately the shots aren't cheaper (or even available) without the light up shot glass. Grab a beer, pizza, fries, and stuff yourself silly! This restaurant is extremely affordable and in a hallway with other cute little shops. Gamble between Mandalay Bay and Luxor while you're there :)
Just an amazing Place To get Great Pizza , I had their Vegan Pizza and is one of the best in Vegas ,  great for Groups with vegans and non vegans to have their favorites in one place

The mac n cheese is the main thing keeping me coming back over and over! They also have a vegan menu which is awesome! Food is always amazing, I make sure to come every time I'm in Vegas. Just wish they had coke instead of Pepsi.

Was in Vegas for the weekend and ate at this place three times. Newly Vegan but still wanting to eat some good food we checked this place out... 

Where They Excel:
Service - we had a male server the first night and Franni (maybe Fani, can't remember her name) at the bar the two second times... they were both fantastic... particularly the bartender, engaging but not over bearing, attentive and made a great moscow mule... food always came out promptly and food runners did a great job... TV's are plentiful so its a great spot to just sit at the bar, drink and watch some games..

Food - awesome. We had the buffalo pizza, the bbq one, pasta, garlic bread and a  custom made noodle combo.. all vegan, all delicious... the roasted cloves of garlic on the garlic bread were amazing... pro tip, get the buffalo sauce and throw it on the garlic and pesto bread... you're welcome...

There really isn't anywhere they don't excel... this place was great... the non vegan stuff actually looked really good as well and I didn't see too many dissastisfied customers... definitely recommend..

Service was great, with friendly and attentive servers.  We had a party of 3 adults and 3 kids under 10, one a 7 month old. Definitely a kid friendly atmosphere. We went for a late lunch around 3. It was happy hour so drinks and appetizers were 1/2 off.  Calamari was slightly overdone, more brown than golden.  The family size pizza was enough to feed us all.  It had a thin crust, and we got 1/2 pepperoni and 1/2 cheese. Both halves were very greasy with oil dripping off.  However, the menu is extensive with sandwiches, burgers, specialty pizzas and pasta, so I wouldn't rule out a return trip.

Loved the food. I had gluten free and picked my toppings. I had my kids and the server was really good with them, even gave them real dough to play with. They loved it! Their food was good too. Recommend!

Obsessed with this place!!! They have a entire Vegan menu ON THE MENU!! I was ecstatic! I tried the vegan pasta and it was to die for. I followed the pasta with their decedent chocolate cake! I can't say enough great things about this place! I was in Vegas for 3 days and came back here twice! The servers were very friendly, fast and efficient! Place was very clean. They also have a great check in offer which is a plus! I can't wait to come visit again!

Came here to try their pizza and get a drink and glad we found a good pizza place! Waitress was nice and kept checking up on us which is always great. Got our drinks right away and got a margarita  called the roman and got me feeling just right for the night. I love when drinks don't taste like alcohol right away because it' sneaks up on you. Pizza was good and we also ordered a dessert too. Kinda pricey here but this is on the strip. But I will be back for that margarita!

So I'm not sure why the other ratings ware so low. I had a wonderful experience here.

Keep in mind this is a pizza joint. This isn't 5 star dining. They have a juke box, a bar, beer, and pizza.  FAN-TASTIC. It's in Mandalay Place next to the burger place.

I got the truffle white pizza [$18.95] and antipasto salad both were delicious. Friend got gnocchi and calamari both very good.  Thank God we made a reservation b/c b/w this and the burger joint next store there were 20 people or so hanging outside waiting to get in and seated.  We got there around 7:45 pm on a Tuesday night.  We walked right up, told the girl my name, and sat right down. Service was outstanding!  I can't say enough about how much they checked in on us to make sure we were doing ok. And like 6 difft people. One guy brought our apps, another guy brought our wine, another guy took our order, another person brought our food, all the while the waiter was making sure we were doing fine w/ every round of food.

Great vegan options! We were looking for vegan food, and I'm glad we found out about this place. We were expecting one vegan option, bu damn! we had a whole page! Salads, garlic bread (so delicious!), pasta, and great pizza. Perfect crust.

We had "Not your momma's garlic bread, a pizza with vegan meatballs, pesto pasta, and one of the "special" pizzas - the BBQ. All fresh, all vegan, all amazing.

Top notch beer selection and great service.

Was starving one night and didn't want to spend a ton of cash, which is a problem if you're staying at Mandalay, since there aren't any real "fast food" places south of Excalibur.   

Found Slice of Vegas by chance.  Wasn't looking for pizza, so I tried something else, and wound up having a damn good burger / salad combo.  Service was outstanding as well.  Would definitely go back again.

4 stars just for offering a full vegan menu along with a standard menu!  That's huge. Full meaning appetizers, sandwiches, pizza and dessert.  Garden salad and zeppolis are excellent. I would prefer they made their own meatless meatballs in lieu of purchasing from a manufacturer.

Service is on point. Located along The Shoppes at Mandalay Bay.

Service was excellent.  I just went to the deli part to get a slice of cheese to go.  The gal was sweet and they put them in a brick oven to reheat each slice.  Bonus!  

Pizza was just, eh.  Maybe the fresh, made to order pizza is much better.  Very well priced and if I ever need a quick bite I will be sure to return!

Heeding our fearless and awesome CM Misti's advice, we opted for dinner before the "Welcome to Yelp Vegas" party at the Cathouse later that evening.  

The plan was to get a slice but when that was $6, we decided to sit and have a whole pizza instead.  A small specialty pizza with a ton of toppings was $18 opposed to 4 slices for $24.  You can't get any more toppings than their ridiculous Miles 10 Meat pizza.  That's "made with a bolognese mix of veal, pork, and ground beef, smothered in mozzarella cheese, and topped with prosciutto, pepperoni, pancetta, sausage, bacon, mortadella and cappacola."  No pizza could possibly be bad when it has all this.  It was really good.

$18 for a small pizza is a little more than I want to spend but this is probably one of the cheapest places to do dinner at Mandalay Bay.  I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here but it's not a bad option for something casual.
Extensive vegan menu with excellent food and atmosphere. Staff great. Highly recommend!

Found this place on happycow.net while searching for some good vegan food to eat in Vegas. Lucky for me this places has a new vegan menu with many delicious items. They may still be getting the details worked out as my garlic fries did come with parmesan cheese on them, but it was immediately taken care of. My veggie meatbull sub was pretty delicious. Prices on many of the items seemed a bit high, but they all sounded amazing. I couldnt't bring myself to the try the nearly 20$ vegan 12 inch pizza, but it sounded great. Service was above and beyond as well. My boyfriend enjoyed his non veg sandwhich as well, even eating all his peppers which he normally does not enjoy. I do think the beers on tap could be expanded, but they do have a large selection of bottles available.

Three stars for so-so Italian food. One extra star for excellent customer service. I came here with a big group, and we had the back room to ourselves. I was really impressed with the service we received. The servers did a great job of checking up on our table - refilling drinks and bringing extra napkins or utensils as needed. I wasn't particularly impressed by the food but it wasn't bad either. And it did come out very quickly which I always appreciate. Based on the overall experience, I'd definitely give this place another try the next time I stay at the Luxor or Mandalay Bay.

We were at Mandalay Bay for a show and wanted to have a late dinner afterwards.  The Slice of Vegas was busy but was able to get us a table pretty quickly.  Our waitress was good about checking on us often.  It did take a bit to get the final bill from her but overall she was good, very friendly.

I had the Choked Pig pizza.  Toppings included Pesto aioli sauce, Mozzarella cheese, sun dried tomatoes, bacon and artichoke mix finished with chopped basil and a whiskey sour cream.  It was very tasty.  The Pesto was delicious but not overly strong.  The other toppings were great.  My mom had a basic pepperoni pizza which she enjoyed.  I ate both pizzas cold the next day and they were still good.

This is definitely a great place to go if you are looking for a really good thin crust pizza.  It looks like the place gets pretty wild with music and drinks on some nights.

A 12 inch pizza for twenty bucks? I guess...

I ordered the hawaii 5-0 pizza, with canadian bacon, bacon, nori and dehydrated pineapples.I thought the nori was a unique touch, gave the pizza more depth of flavor. I also liked that the pineapple was dehydrated so it didn't make the pizza soggy like pineapple usually does. It also gave a nice tang, which balanced out the saltiness of the bacon quite nicely. I would say it was an enjoyable pizza, but pretty typical.

This place has vegan menu! How awesome is that we got the pizza with fries on the side food was delicious. There was also a guy that works there he was putting on a mini show for us spitting fire and putting it out with his mouth how cool

We have YouTube channel (TBVEGAN) we review vegan restaurants/ and restaurants that serve vegan options check us out for more reviews!

Oh. My. God. 

Located  in the shops that connect Luxor and Mandalay, I ate at this place TWICE in one day. Ordered the vegan pie, garlic pesto bread, garlic fries and chocolate cake with peanut butter icing on the lunch visit. 

Lets start with Mama's garlic bread. Holy hell. This is probably the best garlic bread I have ever had. They give you a roasted head of garlic and the pesto on top is life changing. We ordered ours with Daiya as well. I just scooped out garlic (eventually resorting to squeezing every last drop of garlicky goodness from it's vessel) and spread it across the slices. It comes with four pieces of bread, so enough to share, if you are feeling generous. Well, everything we ate the portions were perfect for splitting.

Then the garlic fries. I don't know what kind of magical mayo like basil dip they came with as well as ketchup and a generous heaping of diced garlic sprinkled over top, but it draws you to it like a moth to a flame. The fries are super thin and cooked to perfection. Not over salted as often is the case with fries.

The pie. We ordered the 12" vegan pizza with diced eggplant, zucchini, roasted pepper and Daiya cheese. It too, perfectly seasoned and portioned.

After all that, we still had room for the moist chocolate cake with whipped peanut butter frosting. Our slice was about 4 in. x 4 in. Atop a chocolate drizzled plate beside grapes rolled in sugar and a sprig of mint. It was nice to go from a well balanced and not overly sugary dessert to that little kick of wow. I have never once thought of doing that to grapes but it worked.

For my return dinner visit I ordered the vegan wings and more garlic, Daiya bread to go to eat on my return flight home. I was pleased to find I still got my roasted garlic in the box for the bread.

The wings were Gardein chicken strips with a sauce cup of buffalo sauce and one of ranch with carrot and celery sticks.  

Vegas is not a place I will be returning anytime soon but if I did, you better believe I would find my way back to this place. Much better than the Cantina a couple of doors down which also offers vegan options (3 star review to follow). I was also impressed our waitress Bianca, though not vegan herself and with us being her first vegan customers had been telling people that the cake was vegan after they'd eaten and raved about it. She said people often have stigmas about vegan food being disgusting and it's just not the case. :)

Five stars with all !!!
Pizza, sandwiches, desserts, beer on tap nice and cold, second time here and always delicious

This place was one if my sons favorite places to eat. He recommended we eat here because of the reasonable prices and great local food. Me and my family had a great time and the server Brandon was excellent and on his game. It's nice having a server that has great timing and a great attitude. The Alfredo pasta was very nice as well.

I had the chicken parm witch I thought was pretty damn good but my opinion could be clouded by the great tasting mules and the very beautiful staff. I came here alone but never felt by my self. The bartender/waitress Melia was very attentive and helpful with recommendations. Definitely coming back with the wife and friends

Considering the name and all the great reviews I thought the pizza would be awesome. It was horrible. Barely edible to be honest. We came back later for some pasta since I got a coupon for checking in and my fettuccine Alfredo wasn't horrible but it certainly wasn't good. Way too expensive for crappy food. Everything should cost about 75% less because that's the real value you're getting.

Had to head to the South end of The Strip on a tram to get to Slice of Vegas in the Mandalay Bay Resort. It was so worth it. This pizza place has a full vegan menu and super friendly staff. I asked for a taste of the vegan Daiya cheez so my non-vegan sister could try it before we ordered and the chef accommodated my request. Sis liked it just fine so we ordered the meatball pizza and chickUN fingers. It was really a delicious meal. I was also excited that my sister enjoyed it. They also offer Strongbo Cider by the bottle. I haven't been able to find that since I was in England years ago. Their sister restaurant Hussong's Cantina that is just a few feet away also offers a full vegan menu. We did not eat there but absolutely will my next visit. All fellow vegans please support these restaurants that have made the effort to offer us wonderful dining options!
So good for vegan and non vegan options, had the Not Your Mama's Garlic Bread with pesto and inhaled it, it was so good

I highly recommend eating at happy hour. From 3-6 they have a half off menu that includes chicken wings, cheese pizza slices, garlic bread and draft beer.   The service was great and the food was good.

White truffle pizza is the way to go. All the other pizzas are good, but the white truffle is the reason we drive and park on the strip for it. Great beer selection as well. Sizes are large, so be prepared to take some home. The wings and fries are a perfect pair as well. If your near the Shoppes, it's definitely worth checking out.

Stopped in for a casual lunch while staying at the Mandalay.  We had the pizza by the slice last time we were there and it had too much oregano, but this time we ordered chicken parm at the bar with the sauce on the side and buttered fettucine on the side.  SOOOO good!!  The sauce would have been overpowering for me and probably too much on the chicken, making it soggy, but with it on the side, the crispy chicken and fettucine could shine through and I added the sauce as I wanted.  

Also, the bartender was so friendly and nice and totally made all of our weird requests seem like no big deal.  Will definitely be back!

Loved their separate vegan menu! We ate there twice in one day and had a fantastic vegan pizza with roasted veggies and Daiya cheese, and salad (both options available were delicious). Loved the sweet potato fries too. Good service overall and well located, near the House of Blues, which was our destination. Would definitely go back.

Sunday evening I dined here with a large party.  We had amazing service and an unparalleled culinary experience. The truffle pizza is to die for! I also got to try a few items on the vegan menu. One of their signature drinks, 6" and hard was a delicious treat! The vegan chicken wings and vegan pizza was amaze! I will definitely be back.

This was actually my favorite restaurant that we went to on my last vegas trip and boy did we go to a lot of restaurant. 

My friend lysette was in charge of finding a restaurant to eat. She decided to come to this place since there was a lot of vegan choices for her. Which I love that this restaurant does this.

We decided to order: 
Not your mamma's garlic bread-the bread had roasted garlic with olive oil and pesto. I love pesto. It was super yummy. However, I didn't think it was worth 8 buck but don't get me wrong it was delicious.

House shoestring's fries: we decided to get our fries with garlic and rosemary. Fries are fries. Can't go wrong with them. 

Both appetizers were from the vegan menu which was great so we all got to share together. 

Switching over to the meat-eater menu:

Choked pig pizza-we ended up going with 18 in. It was very good. Thin crust just the way I love my pizza. All the ingredient all came together really well. The pesto, the mozzarella cheese, the tomatoes, the bacon, THE BACON, haha was yummy! 

Overall, good stuff.

This is an update to my previous review:

FOOD: 5/5
The food continues to be good. I actually liked the pizza I got last time so much that I got it again. My girlfriend got a chicken Parmesan pasta dish that I also liked a lot. They don't go wrong with the food here.

SERVICE: 5/5
My first time here had very poor service. The owner reached out to me after hearing about my experience and offered me to come back again for another meal on them to give them another chance. They had me set up a reservation so they know exactly when I was coming and they knew exactly who I was when I walked in. We had a very nice, bubbly waitress, Taylor, who was very pleasant. She knew her beers, which made it easy for me to pick mine for their large list of choices.
I was very pleased with this most recent experience, but I guess the real test of their service comes to when I come a third time to see if they treat me the same as this.

FACILITY: 3/5
No opinions changed about the facility, but I will say Mandalay Bay is certainly a nice hotel.

VALUE: 3/5
No opinions changed about the value.

4/5, Would considering eating here again.

We ordered a BBQ chicken pizza. The proze I think it's okay. The pizza is great but I counted the chicken strips that they put. They only put like 4 pieces of chicken strip. Anyways service is okay. The waitress forgot to put a plate on our table. She seems rush but I think bec this company is trying to save money. There is only one waitress roaming around the area. Anyways we just dont have any choice thats why we are here.

So good to find a place on the strip, near my hotel room at the Luxor that served up decent vegan food.  I'm not normally a pizza guy, I've lost the taste for the fake cheeses, preferring for less processed fair.  But this was good quality and delicious.  Go Vegan!  Eat Pizza!

Weird..I gave this place 4 stars initially?! Doh! This is definitely a 5-star restaurant located between Luxor and Mandalay. 

First off, they have a ton of vegan options which is AMAZINGGG! They even have 2 vegan desserts, which is usually unheard of. 

The service is usually good as well. Johna is the best! 

Every time I visit Vegas I stop in here.
This little gem was tucked away on the shopping strip linking Luxor and Mandalay Bay.  Definitely a must try for pizza lovers.  The smell drew us in and the flavor blew us away.

Yummy vegan pizza! The buffalo chicken pizza was delish and the crush was equally as good. The small "individual" is enough for two people if you're not terribly hung over or starving. The beer is expensive - $8 for a pint - ouch - but I guess by the 3rd day I was used to Vegas prices! The vegan menu looked so good - can't wait to go back and try more.

Nice to have another Vegan option I can enjoy. We stopped in Saturday night for a bite and a beer. They have a great beer selection!! I had the pasta and sauce, my wife had the veggie burger both were good. The manager brought me out a vegan meatball to try. A very nice gesture....it was good but not great it lacked flavor. They were busy but were stil able to smile and provide good service. We will be back.
Best pizza I've ever had in Las Vegas! Neat atmosphere and great service. If you're staying at Mandalay bay check out this place.

Had a Groupon so decided to try it. Wait was FOREVER even though there were plenty of tables available. I hate when restaurants do that. The two pizzas we ordered took a while. We began to get antsy. Where is the management??? Nothing here but young people who don't try any harder then they have to. Then the pizza came. They were cardboard thin and greasy. The buffalo chicken one had an interesting taste, but I was still hungry. Then we got the check. They automatically charged 18% gratuity on the check. I saw they automatically charged 20% for parties of 8 or more so beware. Our 18 inch buffalo chick pizza and 18 inch pepperoni pizza came out to about $50 even though we had a Groupon for $20 for $40. The automatic gratuity came out to be just as much as a pizza!  Not worth it.

Great Place for Vegans! They had more than plenty of options on the back of the menu. The entire back page is vegan, and delicious. I had the Gardien Meat Balls, and they where awesome, followed by the BBQ Chick'n Pizza with buffalo sauce, It was amazing, and not to spicy. The next day I had the chick'n wings with two sauces. The staff was super accommodating, and fun to chat with.

We are vegan. They have a full menu for vegans which was awesome! The BBQ pizza was good but crust a little hard. 
Loved the chik'n wings and mild bbq sauce. Also, the zeppole was amazing!!!

Ok.   I've been here before but I had never even thought to look at the vegan menu.   Boy was I missing out!  I was quite surprised and delighted by the sheer choice and quality of the vegan items.  The regular pizzas I've had here before were not bad so I'm glad the vegan items can hold up. 

The pizza crust isn't my favorite.   Maybe a little too much like cardboard (lacking a bit of flavor and kind of dry) but it served its purpose and I enjoyed my pizza.

The vegan Alfredo was delicious!  Very creamy and it did not have that sulphur smell/ taste that some cauliflower items tend to have.   I don't like replacement meat so I did not enjoy the "chicken" but I'm sure others would. 

Also, it's not advertised but the chocolate cake on the dessert menu is vegan as well.   Delicious! 

I live in Vegas so I try not to eat on the Strip but I will say this is a great place to come to when attending an event at Mandalay bay.

Bf always wants pizza so we gave this place a try. Quiet, not too busy because we went early in day, friendly staff. Food was good but not really rave worthy. Ordered a pizza and a meatball sammy. I thought it was a little strange my side salad had edamame in a mostly italian place.

How does Nadine C. have such great experiences everywhere!?  Granted, we went to the deli area to get some slices to-go to eat in our room since we had crawfish for dinner like five-hours prior but does it make that much of a difference to dine-in?  Apparently!

For $21-something, we got three giant slices of pie [one Hawaiian, one veggie, and a meat combo].  The pizza itself was thin and soggy and all the toppings were on the verge of sliding off and into my lap.  Not a great start.  While the bites with toppings and cheese had okay flavor, once you hit the crust, it's game over.  Tasteless!  

Slice of Vegas is quick and speedy but they could use some work on developing more flavor.  What I would have done for a packet of crushed red pepper.  Meh!

We had a group of 10 every where we went in Vegas to eat, when that happens everyone charges you 20% for tip and then gives you poor service. This place went above and beyond for us. They are extremely kid friend and have pizza dough balls you can get for them. And the food will not disappoint! Can't wait to come back to this place on my next visit!

Stopped in for a pleasant happy hour. Got the vegan hummus. It was great flavor with crisp veggies. Nice warm fresh pita. The hummus had excellent body and flavor. It was topped with a pleasantly sweet roasted red pepper and microgreens. Coupled w an angry apple cider it was a nice snack. High recommend. Only flaw i saw was even though at bar, waitress was not very friendly.

After 2 days of heavy drinking, a group of 4 dudes (Mr. Bloewen, Mr. Booth, Mr. Buxton, and myself) were looking for an early lunch.  We teetered on an all you can drink buffet and Mandalay, but though for the better to avoid that.  After Buxton was refused service at Burger Bar the night before, we elected to try out the nearby Slice of Vegas.

We were unsure of what to order, and our waiter was hard to find.  We were the only people in the establishment, since they just opened, but the waiter was either busy playing with his phone in the back, or just didn't want to talk to us.  We had to yell at him everytime to finish talking as he quickly was walking away.

We ordered an appetizer of french fries that were good and hot.  We were all in the mood for pizza so asked the waiter what size we should order.  We are 4 average built guys.  His response was, "I've seen some people eat a large all by themselves, and some split it with 4-5 people."  Gee, thanks a lot, Guy.

Without any help, we tried ordering the large pepperoni, and know we could order more if that was not enough.  If you are in doubt, I will say that it is more than enough for 4 dudes.  We were all stuffed, and didn't even finish one piece.  The pizza was also extremely greasy, and completely mediocre.  I think that I have to say Domino's is better than the Slice of Vegas.

I am highly doubtful for the continued existence of this restaurant, and assume that it will be replaced (go out of business) soon.  If the quality was higher, i would be more hopeful.

Great location.  I was expecting NY style pizza somehow. So that set me on a different frame with a different expectation. Perhaps the look and feel. Ownership seems consumer oriented and values based which is good. Nice people on staff.

Nothing special, nothing terrible. Slightly over priced but then again it is in Mandalay Bay. If you're looking for a decent meal in the resort that won't destroy your bank this is a good place to go.

I guess I expected better pizza in Vegas with all the former east coasters that have set up shop here. This place goes down as another fail in my book. Service and atmosphere was just fine, but the pizza was just meh and bland. Got a large with meatballs and ricotta to share with wifey and I, a lover of pizza, had one slice and decided it just wasn't worth it. Crust was dry, had no flavor, and I guess same went for the cheese and sauce. 

If you are looking for good pizza on the strip, my bet is still secret pizza.
Love the all VEGAN menu! Many choices and all very delicious.
They serve a decent slice here, given that good pizza can be hard to come buy, though I much prefer the pizza joint at the cosmopolitan. A slice, after tax, costs $5.86.

It is your standard pizza joint. Nothing spectacular for food. It was super crowded during dinner on a sunday evening. We waited about 30 minute to be seated. They gave the kids crayons once seated which is nice. 
We ordered for the table pizza and salad. Waiter was really nice. I guess for Vegas I was expecting more. There are several tv screens with sports playing on it. I guess this would be a good place for guys to hang out.
I had the Vegan pasta with spicy marinara, absolutely delicious! Good service nice beer selection. Very impressed with their vegan, gluten free, and normal selection.
I was surprised by garden salad. Really fresh, dressed well. It was a nice change from typical vegas fare.  The hangover pizza  was unique and delicious. My server did every thing right.

Service was awesome! Just like my last visit. Lovely to know that Jennifer was informed on what was vegan and not vegan. 

We ordered the veggie supreme 24in I think it was called and sized lol. It was amazing. Came out super prompt. Beyond burger was delicious and came with a lot of fries (Tip: ask for fries no salt, thank me later LOL). YUM. Cooked awesomely and had a lot of flavaaaa. Skipped dessert because we were stuffed and had plenty of left overs, but totally recommend.

I do love that Jennifer also mentioned the yelp check in for free fries etc, but we were stuffed AF but cool! 

We will be back!

Absolute surprise and great find! We were looking for a place to eat and my kids wanted pizza. To our delight not only did they have pizza for one child (really good size portion for kids menu), some of the best mac 'n cheese I've ever had. Plus I had their Antipasto salad and my husband a sandwich. We loved it so much we grabbed a few slices one evening after hanging out in the pool. (You can get it by the slice  - but I recommend if you are gonna need a whole pizza order ahead. It takes 15 -20 min. or they overcharge for by the slice.)

It's really cool that the entire backpage of the menu is a vegan section with apps, food, desserts. The vegan pizza with veggies and daiya cheese was very good, though not amazing, but it was amazing that a place like this exists in a major casino (Mandalay Bay).

A great pizza place to grab a bite to eat. My husband loves their meatball sandwiches. Service is good, food is good and plentiful. We eat at least one meal here every time we are in Vegas. We've also ordered a pie to go and taken it to our room.

Perfect spot to please the lady with the vegan menu and myself with an awesome burger! The cauliflower was on point highly recommend! Manager was awesome with our yelp rewards and our server Amanda was super awesome and friendly!

Great place if you're looking for a tasty, inexpensive pizza. The freshly made sauce is absolutely amazing!! The staff was incredibly friendly. Our server, Johnna, was awesome!! Super informative about the menu and very attentive. I will definitely be back, thanks to her outstanding service and the delicious food.

Good food, bad prices. That about sums up Slice of Vegas. I came here on a Monday evening with my fella and Groupon in hand. The wait was minimal, although I was surprised that there was a wait at all on a Monday. 

Once seated, our waiter slash bartender was extremely attentive and friendly. He didn't even give me a snarky look when I mentioned I had a Groupon, kudos for that. I ordered the gnocchi with alfredo sauce and my fella got the barbecue chicken pizza. He really enjoyed his pizza, despite the $19 price tag for a single serving. My gnocchi wasn't bad for price and taste. I would probably order it again, since it's not too expensive. The food didn't blow me away, but it was solid and service amped up the star-rating on this review a bit too. 

I probably won't go out of my way to go back to Slice of Vegas, but if you're in the area and craving a slice of 'za and beer, this place is for you.
Love their vegan menu and happy hour drinks. Friendly staff and good service. We had the roasted cauliflower, BBQ wings, and garlic bread

As a vegan this place is great.  Ive tried the vegan bbq chicken pizza, & the meatless meatball pizza, both were delicious.  They have the meatless meatballs as an appetizer, so delicious its really a must try.  The staff is amazingly friendly and tentative.  Definitely visiting again, probably sooner than later.

There aren't a lot of reasonable, quick, good choices for a bite in Mandalay Bay between fast food (the food court way in the back by Shark Reef) and expensive.  Slice of Vegas, in the Shoppes at Mandalay Bay (the mall between Mandalay Bay and Luxor), is a welcome option.  It serves up good New York-style pizza and decent pasta dishes, and while it's priced higher than you'd pay off-Strip, it's reasonable by casino standards.  There's also a take-out section, which is a life-saver if you just want to grab and go or bring something back to your room; Along with the to-go window at Libertine Social, it's a solid choice if you want something good but don't want to sit down for a full meal.

Very average pizza!  Very over priced based on the cost.  Asked for a side of sauce to add to my pizza, had to pay for the side, was tiny and when I asked about it the response was its our policy.  Hate to say it was a waste of time!

I cannot wait to get back to Vegas to have their 4 Cheese Truffle pizza!!! Thin crust was perfect, cheese was perfectly blended and melted, and the truffle taste made it heaven in my mouth!

My vegan friend brought me here and am sooooo grateful she did! I went in April and wrote this review now bc i was drooling as i was reminded of it after eating something else with truffle oil recently.
